Reviews.Title: “Location, Customer Service and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Susan Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Design de la Sorbonne for 9 nights and I loved it. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. I upgraded to a larger room when I arrived and was happy about it. I had a friend with me for 3 nights and the rest of my time I was alone and the room was a good fit on both occasions. I loved having the computer in the room....I could watch TV on it, check the internet and e-mail (occasionally!) and play region 2 movies, so it was a real entertainment center. The bed was very comfortable and the room was always clean. The location was terrific for everything I wanted to visit...lots of places to walk to, a bus to the Louvre right down the street, the metro not far, an easy walk to Notre Dame. Many interesting restaurants and cafes close by and several cinemas that were so comfortable and clean that it made me nostalgic for the ways movies used to be shown in the USA. I was very comfortable staying here and would definitely recommend it. The smallest rooms are pretty small so if it's possible to upgrade and you'll be there for a few days I would recommend that...but really, I thought this was a wonderful choice for my visit and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great welcome”
Reviews.Author: Gerald-Labour
Reviews.Content: The lady receptionist was welcoming, efficient, and unusually for Paris, very friendly. From reviews on this site we were aware that the rooms could be small. We were offered an upgrade from a standard to a superior room, and having compared them, were pleased to pay a supplement of 20€ for a good sized bedroom, and an excellent bathroom. As has been mentioned, the location is everything, only 5 minutes downhill (arriving!) from the Luxemburg RER direct from CDG airport. If you want to breakfast outside the hotel there are a number of cafes round the corner in the Place de la Sorbonne - we can recommend L'Escritoire.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Faraura
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as we were looking for something modern but 'boutique', and thought this fit the bill quite well. Pros: - location - very close to luxembourg gardens and the pantheon, easy walk to the isles and notre dame. - nice and clean rooms, well decorated. - Mac in room - with free internet and good size screen for watching films. Cons: - Very small rooms, quite dark too. - Noisy - can hear people on the stairs and outside (though is on a quiet street). Tip: When coming in from Gare du Nord - Luxembourg is a good tube stop - about 2 mins walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great loacation”
Reviews.Author: BenJones0001
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we have visited this hotel, this time we opted for the best room, Room 62, It is much larger and much nicer than the previous room we had and although quite a bit more expensive, worth every penny. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The location is amazing, within walking distance of many of the main sights and there is a Metro and RER within 3-4 minutes walk for those that are further away. The staff are very friendly and helpful, more than happy to arrange restaurant reservations and taxis etc for you. This will now be our base every time that we visit Paris. I would also recommend trying out Les Fontaines restaurant which is only 4-5 minutes walk away while you are there for some amazing food at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: art_girl_28
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was truly chic and very clean as well. The location was wonderful and we loved how many cafes and restaurants were in the neighborhood. The iMac in the room was a huge bonus for us because the wifi was spotty. We paid for the breakfast in the morning and were very pleased with the food and the service in the breakfast area. Our only complain was the shower. It was the tiniest I've seen, and I've been all over Europe and am accustomed to small rooms. I couldn't take a shower without the shower curtain clinging to my body, and when I tried to gain some room by turning sideways in the shower I would often bump the shower handle, scalding or freezing myself often. I was always glad to be done with my shower so I could escape the curtain. Anyone who is claustrophobic will probably want to ask for a room with a larger shower or stay at another hotel. Overall, we loved it there. The reception folks were very helpful and spoke English well. We loved our stay and our view. We could see the dome of the Pantheon from our room!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for my needs”
Reviews.Author: Nightster1
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small clean hotel with good rates. Apple macs in the rooms for internet and TV. The standard rooms are a bit small, so are the ensuite bathrooms and lift. If you are "big" you will be cramped here

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: hailzbee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Design Sorbonne is in a great location with easy transport to the CDG airport, Gare du Nord (eurostar station), Versailles & the city centre. It has many fantastic restaurants & cafeâ€™s nearby. Yes the rooms & bathrooms are small, but itâ€™s Paris! It is more than comfortable for two people. And yes the elevator is small (2 people, without luggage), but again itâ€™s Paris!! The staff are friendly and speak fantastic English! I would highly recommend this hotel & would definitely return. We asked for the green & black striped room prior to arriving, and we were given this room when we checked in. It was room #55 (on level 5)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: leapea29
Reviews.Content: I took my Mum to Paris for a couple of days and needed somewhere to stay overnight as Paris in a day for her would have been too much as a diabetic! I booked this hotel because it was in a great location for food & drinks of an evening and because I secured a great price by booking early. The hotel is on a quiet back street, no more than a 3 minute walk from the Latin Quarter. When we arrived, we were checked in very quickly and were told we could leave our bags in their storage room while we went out for the day as we were too early for checking into our room. We were able to use the bathroom to freshen up and change after our journey and we were then advised by hotel staff on the best way to get to the Eiffel Tower - we were even updated on the weather forecast! The room was lovely, beautifully decorated and had everything we needed. Most importantly, it was clean. The only downside was the loud television in the room next door which it seemed was never turned off! The rooms are small, but this is expected in Paris. This wasn't a huge problem for us as we only used the room for sleeping at night so didn't spend much time there. The staff were very helpful, serving us drinks in the breakfast room out of usual hours. The breakfast was nice, with a selection of meats, cheeses, breads and cereal. All in all, I would definitely go back to this hotel as it's perfect for a city break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gavin117
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was in a great location. The room was small but most rooms in Paris are. The lift is unbelievably small but handy for taking luggage. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as there are loads of good value cafes in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, clean & quiet.”
Reviews.Author: travelling_girl033
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of January. We stayed in a twin room (the beds were pushed together and made up as the 1 bed) on the 5th floor. The hotel is whisper quiet. The heating is very very efficient - so much so that we slept with the window open and curtains shut and were still toasty warm (with the heater on its lowest setting). It is walking distance from almost everything (my husband and I love to walk). We even walked to the Eiffel tower, but took the train back. As other reviews have mentioned the bathroon is microscopic. My husband and I are both very tall but knew about the bathroom after reading the reviews. It is fine and we managed for our stay. The computer software needs upgrading for you to be able to use the full use of the free internet. Was not a major issue for us. The only minor issue we had, was a bit of a cigarette-smoky-smell coming into the room somehow, despite it being a non-smoking hotel. The staff tried to rectify it for us (talking to the guests, perhaps?) and it wasn't too much of an issue. The staff are very helpful and friendly. They printed our Eiffel tower tickets for us and have a great system to forward any message on to you. The lift is tiny and can barely fit 2 people. We mainly used it to get our luggage to and from the room. The stairs are fine to use. We would stay here again and recommend it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great view”
Reviews.Author: Longtonian
Reviews.Content: Our room was stylish, quiet and comfortable. Fabulous view from our window of the Sorbonne across the road and of the Pantheon, which looked stunning when it was lit up at night. Good location for cafes, bars and shops. Tourist areas within easy walking distance. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend Le Cosi restaurant just round the corner for dinner - Corsican food - expensive but absolutely fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: japes59
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in September 2011. Everything about the hotel underlines the "design" aspect of the name, but not to the detriment of service or comfort. The location is very central, and close to a lot of our favourite Paris places: the Luxembourg gardens in particular. Plenty of good cafes and restaurants nearby. The rooms are generally quite small, and the bathroom was tiny, but both were very clean and nicely decorated. Bath towels could have been a bit larger. My only seriously negative criticism of the hotel itself is the rooms are poorly soundproofed, and the noise of doors closing is very intrusive. We didn't have breakfast included in the price of our room, but were very happy to go out and have it in a local cafe (of which there are a few on Place de la Sorbonne around the corner). The hotel staff were consistently friendly and helpful. In general this was a nice, well designed update of a small Paris hotel, but in future we would probably choose somewhere else to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmazingSteve
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Design Sorbonne for 3 nights just after Christmas. It's in a great location just a few minutes from the Luxembourg metro station on a direct line from CDG airport. It's about 10 mins walk from Notre Dam with the bustling Blvd Saint-German full of restaurants and cafes on the way. Our room was small, as you'd expect. The bedroom area was perfectly fine with a nice view from the 5th floor over the Sorbonne university plus aircon and a TV/Apple PC to play with. The bathroom, though, was just a little too small for comfort - you had to perform a twist to sit on the toilet and the shower cubicle was so narrow I really struggled to wash properly. As mentioned there was a PC in the room to freely surf the net and do a bit of research on before venturing out. This was really handy. The hotel also provided free WiFi but I struggled to get connected to this using either my iPhone or iPad so had to rely on the PC in the room. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. The hotel was beautifully decorated inside and seemed well maintained. We had breakfast included, this was taken in a tiny room with barely enough space to swing a cat. The breakfast itself was continental and perfectly adequate but I would say not worth paying extra for if your price doesn't already include it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - Another Hotel in the Hotels Paris Rive Gauche Group”
Reviews.Author: heleleat4915
Reviews.Content: I just got home from a 3 night stay at the Hotel de la Sorbonne. The hotel is very "hip" and reminds me of the W hotels but of course much smaller (I think only 33 rooms). It is part of the HPRG group of hotels who have a number of small boutique hotels ideally located around Paris as well as some apartments for rent. I have stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon before so had high expectations of the hotel. It was nicely decorated in a very modern style. Good for the young. The hotel has a few drawbacks, none of which are deal breakers but something you need to think about: 1. It is very noisy if you have a room facing the street. If you choose this place then ask for a room facing into the courtyard - others staying at the hotel tell me it was beautifully quiet 2. Linens aged - towels especially small 3. No corkscrew in the room, and when we asked at reception we were told we were not permitted to open a bottle of red wine in our room unless we agreed upfront to pay any damages. This is insane. If you cant do this then make it part of the note for the booking. Caveat emptor. When in France drink a good Bordeaux!! 4. The rooms were oppressively hot. We turned the heater off but still hot, so we had to open the windows and then the noise was bothersome and you woke up freezing. So need to work on temperature control Advantages: 1. Location perfect- short walk to Rue St Germain, Notre Dame, the Pantheon, the Latin Quarter for dinner 2. It seems to be attached to residential apartments so you feel as though you are living in the city 3. Nice clean modern and recently renovated bathrooms 4. Cool lobby 5. Nice and helpful staff (very nice and very helpful) 6. We met other guests at a champagne soiree for New Years eve courtesy of the hotel with some finger food - nice touch. So do I recommend it overall? Yes. Would I stay there again? I prefer the Hotel du Pantheon for aesthetic but would happily stay here again provided cheaper (we got done with New Year eve hijacked prices of 305 Euros per night......... price of being in Paris for the New Year I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: sue-kai-ron
Reviews.Content: The location is good, close to metro but most of the hotels are in one way or another. Very quiet neighborhood, a little bit too quiet. The hotel on the other hand is not quiet at all. The doors slam all day long, so you get a wake up call without asking. That is really annoying if you want to sleep long.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: vancity9
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very quirky in its modern design but the rooms are quite small. There is no mini fridge in the room. The bathroom is also tiny but all in all the hotel gets the job done. It was a comfortable stay. I chose this hotel for its proximity to the university area. Very close to the Luxembourg Gardens which are one of my favourite places in Paris. Probably would not stay again as there are many other options in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service!”
Reviews.Author: willows84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a recent trip to Central Paris. What stood out to us was the way the staff were so friendly and helpful - they couldn't have done more if they tried. We don't speak very good French but they were happy to speak to us in English and as soon as we'd ask for directions somewhere, they took out a map and marked where we were in comparison to our destination and told us the best route. We also forgot to take a travel adapter but the hotel had one and lent it to us for our whole stay! There are also umbrellas to borrow free of charge - these came in very handy as it poured down when we were there. This hotel is in walking distance to Notre Dame Cathedral and we also managed to walk from the hotel to the Louvre Museum, Champs-Elysee and Eiffel Tower! Public transport wasn't really needed in our case so this hotel was perfectly located. If you're travelling from Orly Airport, catch the Orlyval (signposted Airport Shuttle at the airport!) to Antony Station. Then catch RER B to Luxembourg Station. From there it's just a 5-min walk to the hotel. It's 10.50 euros per adult one way. Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris and would def stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great, enjoyed the hotel”
Reviews.Author: DARquest
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our visit in Paris. The room was quite small, however, the location was great. It is near the direct train line to the airport and walking distance to most attractions or at least a transportation option. The Sorbonne area is quiet and peaceful for being right in the city. The breakfast was good along with great service. We enjoyed the wi-fi and apple TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great people at the reception, very good position”
Reviews.Author: manwholivedinhotels
Reviews.Content: I have been there for the 2nd time. Few Hotel owners understand how much is important to have professional and motivated people at the reception. I guess the Hotel Manager of HDLS worked on that because the reception service is excellent. Fluent in several languages, kind and smiling but withouth exceeding... Position is great, breakfast is not cheap (13 euros) but it worth the money you pay. Yes I know the dimension of the rooms is not great but dear friends we are in Paris... When in Paris I will stay again in this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Chic Parisian bolt hole”
Reviews.Author: phunter123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with another couple, for 1 night, during a short city break in Paris last weekend. The hotel is tucked down a side street in the Sorbonne area so, whilst a great location, it was also peaceful. The hotel is certainly not spacious, but feels more cosy than claustrophobic. Our friends had the standard room, which is tiny, and we had a 'superior', which was slightly bigger but still small. Whilst I would probably have an issue with this if staying for a week, it was absolutely fine for a short break. The rooms were very clean and well equipped with Mac computer, safe, dressing gowns etc. It was a little disappointing not being able to make a cup of tea in the morning though! Staff were very friendly and efficient. Happy to give us a map, pointing out which sites to visit, order taxis etc. We didn't bother with the breakfast in the hotel as, for 13 euros, it was just bog standard cartons of yoghurt, bread, croissants etc. i.e. nothing freshly cooked, apart from eggs. The person at reception was happy to recommend a few places a couple of minutes walk / 2 streets away. We were very pleased with the creparrie that we chose, and had a fantastic breakfast there, for much less than it would have cost in the hotel. We would definitely stay here again if visiting Paris, although probably only on one of the very reasonable 'promotional rates' advertised on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Jhallowes
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, lovely service from all staff. Rooms are an average size for Paris. Fab location. Liking the apple mac's in the rooms- wish all hotels had this!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: fuffyhead
Reviews.Content: Really loved our stay here. Great location, wonderful quirkily decorated rooms and lovely staff who were very helpful. Love the little touches like having umbrellas for guests in reception. The rooms are small but what they've done with the space is wonderful. I have two tips - first, the hotel website recommends you get the RER B train from the airport to Luxembourg station. In fact getting the RER B direct from CDG to Cluny Sorbonne leaves you about 5minutes walk from the hotel and is closer. Second, become a fan on Facebook as you get preferential rates - lower even than on their website!

Reviews.Title: “"Wow" when entered in room, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: McOrion
Reviews.Content: When my girlfriend entered in room she said "wow". First impression is important and even if at a closer check furniture quality was not excellent hearth had already decided "I like it". Things we need in holiday are: room clean, quiet, not too small (we know Paris standard), close to centre or a good Metro station: it was a perfect hotel then. What can be useful is Wi-Fi but this time we had a real computer in room. Perfect if you wish to hear "La vie en Rose" on request. An italian lovely receptionist (we are italian) was like the cherry on a good cake; it's thank her if I could get in few minutes roses needed for our anniversary. We are very happy of out stay so I can just say: "better than expected".

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better...”
Reviews.Author: hinona
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Hotel Sorbonne. Here are the positives. Great location. Great staff. Quiet and near a metro stop. Good restaurants and excellent gelato very close. Negatives. Clean but very small room, with very small closet space and no dresser. Towels were very thin and the bathroom itself had no outlet. The breakfast room is very small and the breakfast itself very limited. It was included in our room rate but was no where the price they asked for it as an add on.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic lodging in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jacquelinesss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I finally took our first Euro trip together, we were very pleased with where we stayed in Paris. As soon as we arrived we were happy to be away from the bustle of the Latin Quarter (which is a five minute walk from the hotel, if that) and thrilled that we were so close to St. Germaine and the other attractions north of the river. The service was great, the staff was very accomodating and always willing to help. WiFi was free although there were some signal disruptions towards the end of our stay. The rooms were small but as expected for Europe. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: myrcou
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located close to the Sorbonne, the hotel is well designed. The rooms, however, are very small, even the superior ones. Bathrooms are miniscule also. Breakfast is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: cornhusker17
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within the Sorbonne. I loved being able to look out of my window and watch the students on the side street below or in the classrooms across the street. It is near numerous sights, shopping and restaurants. The rooms appear newly renovated. the decor is somewhat wild but clean and welcoming. The bathrooms are small but serviceable and pretty. The WiFi was not working (although there was a Mac) so I used the WiFi at the M cDonald's down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms far too small and over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Darryl C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by no means shabby or run-down, but our standard room was so ridiculously small that I left disappointed. Most other hotels have wardrobes larger than the bathroom, and there is no space to walk past one-another in the bedroom itself. I didn't think the towels offered by the hotel were suitable to this price range either, they were small and quite tatty. My idea of comfort does not extend to turning over in the middle of the night and banging my head on the wardrobe. I can't help but think that despite its excellent location and buzzy neighbourhood, this hotel offers poor value given the lack of space. We were glad that the weather was good so we didn't spend much time in the room. I agree with other reviewers that the wi-fi, although free, was patchy - couldn't get the Mac to work (nor the TV channels) or a wi-fi connection for my phone. Staff were ok - we arrived to find that another group were without rooms due to over-booking or systems issue, so that makes me wary of booking within this group again. The reception was pleasant enough but didn't try very hard when we asked them to order a taxi on Saturday night - we were simply told 'busy time' and left to fend for ourselves. Won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel in Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: CarolaRodina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed here for the first 4 nights of our honeymoon, and loved it! Our room was great, had a window we kept open most of the time (opens to a fairly quiet side street) and even had a large apple monitor for any online things you may want or need! It apparently doubles as a tv as well. It's in a fantastic neighborhood - wonderful restaurants just steps away both in the Place Sorbonne and around the other side nearer the Pantheon. Walk to the Luxembourgh Gardens and to loads and loads of shops and whatever else you may want. Plenty of Metro options too. You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A great location for a nice accomodation”
Reviews.Author: F S
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. The staff kindly helpful, tv/mac useful. Rooms clean but of not so comfortable space -- too small bathroom and a ridicolous shower. Superb and elegant location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, good value hotel in the 5th”
Reviews.Author: KellyC
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The room was great looking. The beds were comfortable, the tv/imac with internet was genius, the bathroom had a great shower. What more can you ask for? The lobby is small but charming and the front desk staff was helpful and greeted us very warmly every time we dealt with them. There is a lovely square around the corner where I grabbed a croissant and coffee. For those concerned about location, I will admit I typically stay in the 3rd but couldn't find anything in my price range that seemed very nice. I chose this because I had stayed in the 5th once before and found it almost as convenient for my needs. It is in a nice area very near Luxembourg gardens and the rer train. I like to walk so it was a bit of a trek to the 1st, 2nd and 3rd where I spent most of my time. But it was worth the walk since the hotel was so nice. I did go to dinner once in the 5th and once in the 6th so that made for a nice stroll those nights. All in all, I would definitely stay here again and have recommended it to a few friends that have planned trips to Paris recently.

Reviews.Title: “Modern plush hotel”
Reviews.Author: CSN
Reviews.Content: Bought a deal a few months ago and paid in advance which when I came back to it seemed expensive (c.+200 euro a night room only) and although it was good (I was upgraded though) I'm not sure in retrospect I would do that again. I do like this location up around the pantheon/sorbonne. It has restaurants and shops but is quieter and still convenient. Staff are friendly and helpful (good english) - night porter was a little surly though. Mac is nice (I played DVDs on it) but I couldn't work out how to turn it off so the room was completly dark to sleep in - although saying that the black out blinds on the sky lights are 100%. Also free wifi - although quick - went down a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but poor soundproofing.”
Reviews.Author: CriticsView
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights in August, it's in one of my favourite parts of Paris. Centrally located, contemporary style revamp within the last couple of years. Plenty of character and personality. August Hotel rates are generally good in Paris and this one was no exception, providing good value for money. Probably less so at normal rates and the area has a different ambience when the students are there. Breakfast, as is so often the case is overpriced and I would recomend the breakfast available just around the corner in one of the cafes in the square (about 7â‚¬). My only complaint, and this applies to so many Hotels, is the poor level of soundproofing between rooms. The couple in the next room came back very late one night. They were really not making an unreasonable amount of noise but it was more than enough to disturb even a heavy sleeper. I would recomend the Hotel but remember to pack ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it-great location”
Reviews.Author: jwitte1809
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights before an organized tour at this hotel. It was great. We took the RER B from the airport and got off at the Luxembourg stop which was only a couple blocks away (don't even have to change to another line). We were able to easily walk to the Pantheon, Notre Dame, Ile de la Citie, Cluny Museum, Luxembourg Gardens-great location and there are a couple metro line stops close. Also Place de la Sorbonne with a few cafes is just around the corner. There is also a Monoprix store a couple blocks up Blvd St Michel towards the river-great for batteries, wine, snacks, etc. (very much like a Target store). Yes, the room and bathroom were small, but it is Paris. We have had similar sized rooms in London too. Very clean and everyone at the front desk was very nice and spoke English, so no communication problems. Didn't eat breakfast there, but it is offered (maybe 13 euros). Street very quiet. I was honestly a little concerned about staying in the Latin Quarter-touristy, loud, etc, but not this street/several block area-very classy and nice. I would definitely stay here again; we felt it was a very good value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: snoogans1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently for 6 nights, and have very little to complain about. The rooms are smaller than American hotel rooms, but average-to-good sized for European hotels. We were two adults and had plenty of room for all of our clothes, etc. The bathroom was very small, but so well-designed that it never felt cramped. We reserved a room with a shower, and the water pressure was fantastic. Having the imac in the room with free internet (very high speed) was a great touch. It was incredibly helpful to be able to look up museum hours and restaurant reviews on the spot. Overall, the room and public spaces were clean, beautiful, and everything looked brand new. The front desk staff were all extremely helpful and spoke fluent English. In terms of location, this hotel was perfect- getting to numerous RER lines and the metro was very quick. The neighborhood has everything that you may need- restaurants, cafes, grocery stores, pharmacies, etc. and isn't nearly as overwhelming or pretentious as some other neighborhoods. The Sorbonne, Cluny, and Pantheon are all within a few blocks. We had a wonderful trip to Paris and this hotel was a big part of that. We definitely plan on staying there again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: heroin1
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Located close to RER B Luxembourg. Rooms trendy but very dark (no main light - we stayed in one overlooking the courtyard) and no mini bar. Cleaned well every day. Staff can all speak English. Breakfast basic - not worth paying extra unless included in the room price as there are places nearby which do breakfast for less than 13 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Mzpickles
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in central location for public transports etc. The rooms were small but I expected that for Paris from other comments. The breakfast was nice and the rooms and lobby were always clean. Our air con leaked and was never rectified when reception was told (they actually said it was our fault??). The only major con is the lift - it is TINY! My husband and I had to take it separately with our luggage and struggled to fit together without it. Luckily we were on the 1st floor so we took the stairs instead. Overall a nice hotel and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly service”
Reviews.Author: bamme
Reviews.Content: Safe and lively location in the Latin Quarter only 3 minutes away from the RER B that runs directly to CDG airport. Its closer to the Luxembourg RER station than the map linked to the hotel's website indicates - when on Rue Soufflot & walking up towards the Pantheon you turn left at the intersection with Rue Le Goff & the hotel is 1 minute walk away & on the left side. Many tourist attractions are nearby inlcuding the famous Pantheon around the corner and the Sorbonne University across the road. Luxembourg Gardens are also only a few minutes away as is Notre Dame. On the RER B you can pretty much reach all of Paris with only one connection to the many nearby RER/metro lines, especially at Chatelet Les Halles. Spoilt for choice in terms of eating out all around the Latin Quarter & Bvd Saint Michel provides plenty of opportunity to do some shopping. The hotel has been renovated to a very high standard & the iMac in the room with free internet access is very useful. Rooms are a bit on the small side as is usual in Paris, but the rooms are well designed & make the most of the space available. Very clean and well maintained. I have stayed there 4 or 5 times now and have always found all the staff to be very friendly & helpful - feels like it is family run. The special offers can be great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Adele S
Reviews.Content: If a small boutique hotel is your thing, then you'll love this. The rooms may be small, but very well designed (we had a standard room), with extremely comfortable bed, apple mac which is a nice touch and the bathroom has the boasts a power shower, everything you need for the centre of Paris .I have seen a review complaining about the size of the lift, but I would say its typical of a small french hotel, and hey, you only need the lift to carry your luggage to your room. The location is perfect, quiet yet close to bars, restauarants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, perfect location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Nyrop
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located just across the street from the Sorbonne, this hotel was an ideal setting for our pre-honeymoon. The room was small, but we didn't miss anything. Very beautiful and unique interior design. The bed was good, everything was clean, and the staff was friendly, helpful and fluent in English. The iMac in the room was very convenient for our daily planning. My best recommendations for this hotel. You should also consider its sister hotels which look equally beautiful: http://www.hotels-paris-rive-gauche.com

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel, very romantic and great location!”
Reviews.Author: thepoph
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly placed in central Paris is excellent value for money. The rooms are designed beautifully as is the reception area which is filled with eclectic pieces. Staff are very friendly and more than happy to help with any queries. Breakfast is provided but we didn't eat here as I believe it was quite expensive. The room is quite small and the bathroom tiny but perfect for a few nights, small touches were appreciated for example an iMac in each room which served as a television and computer! Definitely worth a stay, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautifully decorated”
Reviews.Author: emmiemoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fab location, right by the Sorbonne, in the lovely Latin Quarter. 10 mins walk to Notre Dame was ideal. The Hotel itself is beautifully decorated and very tasteful, much more interesting than most. The staff were welcoming and friendly, and the rooms, whilst small as all are in paris was great. Having the Apple Macs in every room really made that extra bit of difference, I wouldn't hesitate to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: meic_watkins
Reviews.Content: Hotel has had a stylish make-over - rooms well furnished (though ours was perhaps a little small - but it's an old building), bathroom fine - real gift was an iMac in the room with free internet - though there's wifi throughout as well. Service really friendly and efficient. Breakfast a little disappointing for the price, but plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. However, this place really benefits from its location - great place for exploring the Rive Gauche, just off Boulevard St Michel, with a great little square (Place de la Sorbonne) just round corner - sit in the shade of the trees outside one of the cafes and watch the world go by!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with modern facilities and excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sgbcn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Design Sorbonne last weekend and were impressed by the hotel location, staff, and rooms. The rooms are small (as expected in Paris) but have every possible feature you could want. We loved the mac minis and the free computer/internet in the rooms! Rooms were quiet. We had the breakfast included and it was excellent - fresh croissants, jam, cheese and meats. Lots of nice restaurants and cafes close to the hotel. Hotel is within easy walking distance to most attractions in Paris and only 3 stops from the Eurostar terminal at Gare du Nord. We would return the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely decor, great staff, worlds smallest bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Sc0ttTheD0t
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay here and loved the feel of the place. Everything felt new and very clean. Bed was comfy and having air con in the room was great. The staff couldn't be more helpful and all seemed to speak great English. Location is pretty good - far enough from the main road to be quiet, but still near metro's, RER, bars etc. Only criticism was the size of our bathroom. It was impossible to turn round in and we had to open the door just to dry ourselves. I have stayed in a few Paris hotels and yes, they are all pretty small, but this was bordering on the unusable. Those of you with a larger frame may struggle.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sless
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to Paris and stayed at the Hotel Design de la Sorbonne. It was amazing. It is very small but very chic! The front desk staff is very pleasant and the room decor was awesome. We stayed on the main floor in the one room in the lobby and our room was rather dark even with all lighting on. We could open our window which led to the courtyard. The bathroom was very spacious and everything was clean. There are MAC's in each room that you can go online and watch T.V. on. The location is prime! Only a few blocks away from everything...you're in the heart of PARIS!! We asked if we could see other rooms and they let us go in all the rooms that weren't occupied. Some of them were amazing. I will definitely go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend...”
Reviews.Author: dave b
Reviews.Content: Hotel impressively decorated and meticulously clean, in an area that was equally clean, safe and central to allow us walking distance to major attractions - 15 mins. Notre Dame - we even walked to Eiffel Tower in just over an hour passing the Louvre and Arc De Triomphe en route. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. A perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CityBreak1
Reviews.Content: Decor in hotel is gorgeous, expecially loved bathroom. Very high standard of housekeeping. Friendly staff and lovely ambience. Overall excellent hotel in good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, on the money, will return!”
Reviews.Author: Pappleton
Reviews.Content: we arrived early with the intention of leaving our luggage so that we could explore Paris before checking in, we spoke a little in French to the receptionist who humoured our English accents and spoke back in English to us much to our relief! We were given the option to check in there and then which surprised us as it was only 1015. We were given room one, and were told that despite this. Not being our official room, we could have it if we wanted it. The room was small, but having read previous reviews on tripadvisor, we knew that all rooms were small. The bathroom however, was very large and well stocked with shampoos etc. Room was clean and towels changed despite us hanging them up. iMac was a nice touch and it was good to watch English TV through YouTube! We wanted to be a little 'parisian' on our trip so we went room only and had breakfast in nearby brasseries. We went to 'l'ecritoire' in the place de la Sorbonne just around the corner. Breakfast there was just â‚¬7. well worth it. Despite the room being on the ground floor near tote reception, it was really quiet at night. Notre Dame only 10 min walk away, Luxembourg gardens 5 mins and the pantheon only 5 mins too. Excellent links to CDG airport via the RER to Luxembourg station. We would return to this hotel, it did exactly what we wanted and lived up to our expectations. Thank you fellow trip advisor bloggers for your comments!

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Gayley_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as a 30th birthday trip. Easy walk to hotel from metro station (think it was luxembourg) and hotel is situated on a quiet street near the university. Pleasant staff in the hotel who were helpful and often greet you when you return each day. Elevator was tiny! Was a squash with two of us and our luggage but quite fun at the same time! Rooms are quite dark with black wallpaper with coloured stripes but funky and well designed boutique style. Rooms are quite small but enough room for two to stay for a few nights when out sight seeing for most of the time. Bathroom was small and both me and my boyfriend banged our head off the tiny shelf above sink when cleaning our teeth lol. However shower was warm and worked, was clean and tidy and again all you need for 3 nights. Had a safe in the room which was free and easy to use to store valuables and good storage space to put clothes and cases etc. Free apple mac computer was a bonus to keep in touch with news and also research places, sites and restaurants to visit in Paris. Location was good with restaurants, bars and shops, metro system all just around the corner. Close to Pantheon and market ,15 min walk to river with view of Notre Damme and a further 10-15 mins walk across river to Louvre. Overall the hotel was perfect for what we needed at a good price and an excellent location away from too much hustle and bustle. Would definitely recommend for couples, singles and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tractor33
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. The staff were fantastic, we had a very warm welcome when we arrived. The free internet was fast. Good value for money. Would definitely recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dngold
Reviews.Content: -perfect area -plenty of restaurants -Cluny & Sorbonne around the corner -quiet hotel -perfect loaction -close to subways -close to everything one needs in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Original budget friendly design hotel”
Reviews.Author: svalkenborg
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a booking site. Personally adore the location. In front of La Sorbonne and 30 sec walk from place de la Sorbonne. At arrival, i had a smooth check in. They offered me a free upgrade from standard to deluxe room. Now, be advised that in France a deluxe room is 2 inch bigger. Nevertheless, it was a great intention. Once you arrive in your room, the atmosphere breaths a certain grunge-film noir modern style. Black wallcovering, black carpet. The room was small, the bathroom was tiny, but i couldn't complain. They offer free internet connection, which is great! But only if it would work. Because of no internet connection(everything was connected through Apple air) nothing was working, even not the television. If you book this hotel, please request Ã  room that does not sit next to the elevator. The lift makes a zooming noice and it follows you into your bed. I would recommend to take your breakfast in a brasserie at place de la Sorbonne. Order a french breakfast(coffee, Orange juice, croissant, baguette and marmelade) for only 7 euros and enjoy the view and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, get a superior room.”
Reviews.Author: katatvandy
Reviews.Content: Like all Paris hotels, this one had small rooms. However, the location and the service cannot be beat. I had a superior room for one person and frankly it was just enough space. The noise was not too loud except when there were small children running amok. I asked the concierge/receptionist for tips every day. Some have good English and for some I needed to speak French for them to understand. The hotel was very updated without being overly modern and the decor was classy. The tv does have limited channels (it doubles as a computer) but the air conditioning was very up to date and got the room to the exact temperature I wanted. Overall, I would stay here again and would recommend to friends. I loved getting to know this part of the Latin Quarter better and found it to be quiet, well situated, and a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic birthday gift”
Reviews.Author: terziCT
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Its design, cleanness, proximity to major areas and its staff were all major plusses.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: takkt
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the hotel and loved it. I traveled alone, and had a deluxe room. Was the room small? Yes, but that is Paris! I have also stayed in the Interconti in Paris with a 500 Euro a night room and it was nearly the same size. Space is at a premium in this fair city! The room is very well appointed and I had a view of the street (room 34). The bathroom had a full bath, and did not flood as some other guests have reported. (The bathroom and the Intercontinental flooded when I stayed there, but then I realized you should take the nozzle and face out, not toward the shower head. Paris does do a weird half-glass thing with the showers though.) The staff was charming and very helpful. My interactions with them were nothing but pleasant. My phone didn't work one morning and they had an engineer into fix it in a couple hours. As the other reviews mentioned the location cannot be beat. I did not partake in the breakfast as there is a plaza around the corner with many brasseries offering similarly priced options.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to trip”
Reviews.Author: FozzieandBlakey
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at start of trip round France. Smart, well designed and located hotel just around the corner from neat square, Place de la Sorbonne with plenty of small cafes. Stayed in Room 1 - ground floor. Small but well designed - love the iMac TV/Internet. Would recommend if you're neat & tidy!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: juco0501
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing above average. The microscopic elevator barely worked. My interactions with the reception staff were very poor 4 of the 5 times we interacted: I had to wait 20 minutes to check in, my wakeup call for an international flight was late, reception did not answer the phone, etc. The rooms are tiny, some smaller than Paris average. The room smelled, and the shower flooded the entire floor because the door was improperly installed. And the internet did not work the entire weekend, and they never called anyone in on the weekend to fix it. On the plus side, the hotel had decent (if a bit bizarrely colored) decor. Location was great for Luxembourg gardens, next door to the Sorbonne, close walk to Saint Germain des Pres... I won't plan to stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pop85
Reviews.Content: perfect hotel in terms of location , cleanliness and the like.loads of places to eat around. only the rooms were small in size.highly recommend this place.fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but teeny rooms/beds”
Reviews.Author: snowflakexc
Reviews.Content: Our room was super small (even for Paris) and the bed was so short our legs hung off! But the iMac in the room was a nice touch, and decor was creative and lovely. Great location right next to Place de la Sorbonne and close to Luxembourg Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dee28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Design for 4 nights with our 11 month old baby and had a fantastic stay. The hotel was very accommodating of our bub including storing pram in the luggage room and offering use of microwave if we needed to heat meals. The reception staff were always friendly and helpful. We were in a superior room which was small (although we also had a portacot in the room) but adequate. The location is fantastic and we walked everywhere. On the one occasion when I needed to use the metro it took max 5 minutes to walk to the cluny/sorbonne station. Luxembourg Gardens are a stones throw away, there are 3 great restaurants in the Place de la Sorbonne which is 50m from hotel entrance and a monoprix supermarket just 200m down the road. We ate breakfast at the hotel for 13 Euros pp and they also had a high chair. The breakfast was basic (2 choices of breakfast cereal, yoghurt, apples, pastries and baguette, toast + preserves, cheese and cold meats) coffee/tea and orange juice but convenient and reasonably priced. We didn't have any problems with noise and were there over a weekend. There is no minibar/fridge in the room. The computer in the room and free wifi were a big plus to us. Overall a great stay and we'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MsTrellis
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its excellent location and good reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel is very clean, with efficient reception staff. Our room was clean and quiet. (We tend to go to bed quite late - noise through the walls might have been an issue if you go to bed early, but the hotel thoughtfully provides earplugs). The design scheme is a bit OTT for our taste, but it certainly reinforces the fact that this a boutique hotel. We loved having an imac in the room, though the connection could be rather slow, especially for web tv. Don't expect big rooms. We were in a superior room which was about the size of a standard room in most places in Europe. This was not an issue for us, and does not affect our rating for the hotel. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, as we prefer coffee and a croissant at local cafes, (which is both cheaper and more authentically 'Paris'). However, if we'd wanted a full buffet breakfast, the rate would have been reasonable. We booked on a special deal, making the hotel a reasonable price for central Paris, and this governs our value rating. We may have thought twice if we'd had to pay the 'rack rate'. Do watch out for the showers. The cubicle doors are not sealed very well, and if you don't point the shower-head towards the wall, you soak the whole bathroom and the floor of the main room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel,great location,great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Fledermaus_1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel during a weekend break to paris.We found it perfect for our needs,as it was so central.A five minute walk from luxembourg RER station,which is on the line directly from CDG airport,or from Gare du Nord if arriving in paris by eurostar.Very much welcome if hauling heavy suitcases.It's a five minute walk from notre dame and the metro stations. Plenty of decent places to eat and drink literally around the corner.The staff were more than helpful during our stay,from the warm welcome,to the fond farewell. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cf0210
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as it was recommended by a friend and we thought it was excellent. The hotel is located in the Latin Quarter area of the city, close to Notre Dame, Jardin du Luxembourg and the Pantheon. Its location is ideal to explore Paris by foot, especially if its your first time in the city as it was for us. It is close to the RER B station of Luxembourg, on a direct line from Charles De Gaulle Airport, making it hassle free to get to. On arrival the staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good English which was brilliant as our French is not great! Our room was located on the 5 th floor, there is a lift which is just big enough for two people - but meant we didn't have to struggle with our case. Our room was cosy and had a double bed with en suite shower and toilet. Some people would say the room was small but for us it was perfect, we had enough room to move around and place all of our things. The room was very clean and had air conditioning which we used as it was very warm most nights. The room also had a TV which doubled as an Apple Mac PC with free Wifi. We thought this was a brilliant system as it allowed us to keep in touch with friends and plan our activities whilst in Paris as well as being able to watch TV or play DVDs if you wanted. We paid to have breakfast each morning served in the dining room downstairs. We would reccomend doing this as the breakfast was lovely. You have a choice of toast, fresh fruit, fresh pastries, bread, ham, boiled egg and yoghurts served with either fresh orange juice, tea or coffee. It was very tasty and there was always enough variety every morning. The hotel were very accomodating allowing us to bring our own food back to the dining room to eat in the evenings if we so wished. We did this one night with a chinese takeaway and the staff provided us with plates and cutlery which was very nice of them! The staff were very approachable and were happy for us to leave our luggage with them after we checked out while we checked out the sights. They also reccomended a lovely restaurant around the corner which we tried and had a lovely meal one evening. We were really impressed with this small hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: chuckieamc
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone - excellent location (short walk to RER luxembourg train station for easy travel to Charles de Gaulle airport, shorter stroll to nearest Metro, 100 yards to the lovely Place de la Sorbonne for a relaxed pre-dinner drink). We had room #2 in the courtyard (worth asking for in advance I'd say as it was really peaceful and quiet). Room was excellent for this price range and location - some would probably find it small but having been to Paris quite a few times now I've seen some pretty teeny tiny rooms! Fantastic shower, little Easter chocolates left for us and Apple imac in every room. The only fault I could find was that the room was a little dark - the decor is very boutique-y so its all about atmospheric lighting etc, but sometimes when you're hunting through a very packed suitcase you need better lighting! I would definitiely stay here soon - i Imagine their prices will rise next year once the good reviews keep coming in.

Reviews.Title: “Location is amazing, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dkenny_uk
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The best thing is the location. 3 minute walk to Luxembourg RER station which takes you right to Charles De Gaulle. 15 second walk to bars, restaurants, shops, cinemas, etc. 8 minute walk to Cluny Metro. 10 minute walk to all the cool bars in the Latin Quarter. 15 minute walk to Notre Dame. I could go on. It is on a quiet street across from the university so feels out of the way and very quiet at night but is literally feet away from activity. We arrived 3 hours before check in, not a problem, our room was ready. They had even given us the green stripy room weâ€™d asked for as we liked it on the photos. Very friendly and helpful with quaint little reception and even quainter (tiny!) lift. We stayed on the 5th floor in a superior room and yes, it is Paris so the room was small. Enough space for two to freely move around and enough hanging space but I think more than 5 days and it would get a little claustrophobic. Very clean, iMac computer and entertainment centre very handy and very comfortable sleep. The only negative I can think of is the Wi-Fi was a little intermittent when not using the provided iMac but itâ€™s hardly worth mentioning. Happy to recommend and answer any questions if you are planning this hotel for your trip. All in all, a great boutique style hotel and I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: sturmovik
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice beds, quirky lift, helpful staff. Yes the bedrooms are small so if your planning on swinging a cat not the place for you. For everybody else - reasonable, funky hotel right in the centre - and the courtyard facing rooms are lovely and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: BerkeleyJay
Reviews.Content: Great location! Walk a quarter of a block out the hotel door and you are on the Place de la Sorbonne, where cafe tables spill out the cafe doors toward the fountains. Walk down the Boulevard Saint Michel down to the river and Notre Dame -- just ten or fifteen minutes. You are totally in the center of the Latin Quarter, and can walk pretty much anywhere. Amazingly, there is an actual computer in each room, so researching the next day's activities was very simple. The rooms are small, the bathrooms even smaller. We were there during a warm spell in April and kept the windows open all night (they opened onto a courtyard) and it was quite quiet (we stayed 6 days). Very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for quality!”
Reviews.Author: luvlyliver
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 4 nights. It is a great location, literally 5 minutes walk to the River Seine, and lots of great shops, bars, and places to eat nearby. The design and decor is very classy. We stayed in a standard double room, number 15. It was small but enough room for two. Shower was great. My only complaint is that the walls are thin and on the last night we had trouble sleeping due to the man in the next room snoring loudly! Can hear the pipes and water running from other bathrooms too, but if you've had a busy day walking around Paris, nothing will keep you awake long at the end of the day. The staff were lovely and kept hold of our luggage when we arrived early, and spoke French, English, Spanish, and Deutsch. Also, all rooms have an iMac- win! All in all, a pleasant stay, and for the price, location, and classy decor, there isn't much to fault. Would definetly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “I cannot recommend this hotel enough!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferHammerdorf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with our friends at the Design Hotel Sorbonne from 26-29 of march. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. It is perfectly located, with a direct train from CDG to Luxembourg station, which is situated 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The entire hotel is newly restored, everything is so chic and cool. All the rooms have different decor, with bright colours. Our room was overlooking the quiet yard, while our friends were overlooking the Sorbonne university (they didnÂ´t complain about any noise from the university in the morning, we all slept like babies :-D) Everything is clean, and with a Mac computer in every room, you can watch TV, surf the internet, listen to music etc. Its in the PERFECT location, Sorbonne is literally next door (hence the name of the hotel :-D) The Pantheon and Luxembourg Garden is 1 minute walk away, Notre Dame and Il-saint-louis 5-10 minutes away - It is perfect. The neighbourhood is so romantic, filled with little cafÃ©s, small streets...I really want to go back soon! If I ever go to Paris again, I will definetly stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and trendy!”
Reviews.Author: adumala
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Design de la Sorbonne for our final night in Paris and wished we could have stayed longer. The hotel was conveniently located right off a small court yard with places to sit and rest of have a nice bite to eat and a 5 minute walk to the Luxemburg Garden. The inside of the hotel was amazing, beautifully decorated with bright color schemes and a vintage vibe. Our room was small but it was comfortable. They offered a new computer to watch movies and search the internet. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have stayed in. I highly recommend stay in one of Parisâ€™s â€œdesignâ€� hotels, very similar to the boutique hotels in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little chic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Accuratereviewer38
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for weekend in March. Having only viewed photos on website I can safely say the hotel did not disappoint. It was spotlessly clean and although rooms were small, the attention to detail and interior design made it a very enjoyable place to use as a base. Fab location short walk from Metro St Michel. Would definitely stay here again and will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, decor.. overall very good.”
Reviews.Author: laurah15
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husband's birthday weekend off the back of reading some great online reviews. It absolutely delivered.. We had excellent service from booking through to checkout, the location was fantastic for exploring Paris and the boutique decor and in room iMac was very much to our taste. The room was small, as to be expected, but perfectly adequate for a weekend stay. We got a great offer by booking online, about 50% discount. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, great location, great value and style.”
Reviews.Author: Netsirc
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel primarily for its location, but also the great reviews and the fact that the hotel seemed to be charming and have plenty of character. It met or exceeded all of my expectations. Yes, the rooms are small. The bathrooms are tiny. But the decor is wonderful, the beds are super comfy, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Plus, it is a 5 minute walk (at most) to the RER and less than 10 to St. Michel Metro and Notre Dame. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. If you want a five star luxury hotel with a spa and those kind of amenities, this is obviously not it. But for a two star hotel, what you will get is a great value with everything you need and then some. Specifically, the best things about the hotel in my opinion: - location - staff (always friendly). Also, I emailed before we arrived and they made a dinner reservation for me. - the comfy beds. I am picky about hotel beds, and slept like a log every night. - the in-room computer and free wifi! How many hotels provide you with a computer? VERY minor annoyances: - The bathrooms are SO small and the showers are configured in such a way that you risk soaking the entire bathroom floor every time you take a shower. We did this the first morning then figured out the best thing to do was to just use it as a hand shower. - The room was really warm at night so we had to open a window. Oh well. It was quiet especially our room overlooking the courtyard. - Breakfast was expensive for what it was so we opted for something to go, nearby instead.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: londoner46
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in great location in Paris. The only thing is that the rooms are quite small and the bathroom is tiny with tiny sink, but for my 2 nights stay it was just perfect. Really liked the IMac in the room that can be used as a computer or as a TV, also the Wi-Fi is very good and it's free!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: AlexisBelfast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had been to Paris several times before. We wanted a good hotel, conveniently located to some sights, close to an underground station if we wanted to travel to others, relatively inexpensive, clean, nicely decorated, pleasant staff, near lots of restaurants and shops, etc etc etc...... Our wish list seemed to be getting longer and longer, and just made selecting a hotel even more difficult. We eventually picked the Design de la Sorbonne and were so glad that we did because it surpassed all our expectations. We booked a superior room (ie slightly bigger) because this is always worth doing in Paris. Our room and bathroom were clean and recently refurbished. All staff were very helpful and pleasant. We had requested (and received) a room on an upper floor just in case there was any street noise during the night. We didn't hear any and slept soundly. The wall between us and the adjacent room must have been very thin because we did hear people talking on our first evening there. After that it was very quiet. The continental breakfast was very nice and we would recommend breakfast in bed because there is only a small surcharge for this. We stayed for 4 days. A perfect 4 days in Paris of which the hotel was a big part.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel for an Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: cMcJ10
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with this hotel for our Valentine's weekend. Hidden across from the University of Paris in the Latin Quarter and located nearby by Luxembourg or Saint Michel RER stations. About a 30 min train ride from CDG and a 5-10 minute walk from the stations. Safe area with lots of shopping and sightseeing nearby. 10 minute walk from the Seine river. Staff was friendly and welcoming. Design is updated with a Boutique style. Mac computers available in the main lobby and in each guest room. Numerous ammenities included. Breakfast was 13â‚¬ each which included baguettes, croissants, toast, jams, honey, fruit (dried and fresh), salami, cheeses, yogurts, juices, tea, coffee, cereal, and other odds and ends. Our room was small compared to American standards but a great size compartively to European hotels. Everything was clean and bathroom products were provided. We are in our mid 20s and would recommend this for all ages. It cost about â‚¬120/night. Great location with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FootTraveller
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in this hotel in the early part of January and knowing Paris we weren't too bothered about the small room as we know in Paris rooms tend to be small. The room had beautiful decor and the Mac in the room helped as it had a great home page with local info and weather and travel details. We had three main problems with our room, one: the walls are paper thin and we could hear all the conversations of our neighbours, two: the wallpaper was pealing on one of the walls (easily rectified) and three: it was very difficult to control the temperature in the rooms as the heating was always on there is no thermostat so you had to turn it off and open a window to cool the room down. They were all the issues and very minor ones at that, for the money we paid it was excellent value for money, we walked to most places but otherwise the RER was a 2 minute walk and there are some nice places to eat but you do have to know the area a bit as it is opposite the university so lots of cheap eats (as long as you know where to go)

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JessFH
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. As frequent business travellers it was nice to stay somewere that wasn't too corporate. Really easy to get around Paris from, just off a quiet little square. We got a great last minute deal and all the staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “20 euro worth of 100 euro upgrade”
Reviews.Author: suitraveller
Reviews.Content: When we read from TripAdvisor that this hotel has small rooms, we said "It's Paris. You should expect small rooms there." But we didn't know that it's amazingly super tiny! We booked three rooms: 2 superior with bath & 1 classic room because there was no other superior rooms available. The hotel manager has nicely set all of them in the same floor (on the 5th). I picked the classic room. It's super tiny. The size of the room was 3x3 cubic meter and the bathroom was 2 meter length and 1/2 meter wide! Can you imagine to sit in a toilet with a sink and a shower with that size? It was impossible to sit in a toilet without touching the sink & a toilet paper. I couldn't bend myself to pick up something that I dropped. It reminded me of a toilet in a train. On the next day, I asked if there was an available superior room for us. There was luckily on the same floor that the guest checked out later that day. We supposed to pay 30 euro extra, but the receptionist was nicely lowered it to 20 euro extra. We got then bigger room, a normal size room. If you want to stay in this hotel and do not want to have a claustrophobic experience, it's best to book a superior room. Other things: Cleanliness: we got once a clean towel with a red spot there. We didn't use it. Service: all receptionist were so friendly and nice to us. Location: perfect. Plus things: 1. Design is really trendy that makes a unique stay. 2. The Mac mini in the room & a free internet is really great. I wrote this review with it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Garfield123456
Reviews.Content: We had found this hotel on Trip Advisor. Agree with other reviews that it is a great little hotel. Well located next to the Sorbonne. Easy accessible - use the RER line to Luxembourg from Gare du Nord or airport and then only a 3 minute walk. Easy to walk to Ile de Citie / Notre Dame etc. Loads of excellent restaurants around in Rue de l'Harpe area (again 2-3 minutes away). Rooms are pretty small but well laid out and VERY clean and well kept. Have to get used to the decor - we loved it but maybe not for everyone. Staff extremely helpful - booking tickets for us etc. All spoke English. Part of a group of hotels and I think this is the cheapest in the group but can see the quality of the service. Didnt have breakfast as preferred to eat out but heard others say it was good. Overall, highly recommended and we will certainly stay here again if in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel, definitely worth a retunr visit”
Reviews.Author: Tang_UK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Design de la Sorbonne just after the new year and can't recommend it enough. The staff were very helpful and friendly, making recommendations and reservations for us. My French is very basic and my husband's non-existent but they spoke English without any problem. The location also is fantastic - we took a train from Gare du Nord - I think it was 2 stops and with a short walk we were there. Fantastic. It's also easy to walk to Notre Dame and beyond. Lots of good brasseries and restaurants around too. I believe we were the only tourists in most. As some have mentioned everything is small at the hotel - I guess it's a converted house. The room was small and the lift tiny, but we were only there over night and didn't want to spend all our time there anyway! If we were staying a week it might become a bit much but we weren't and the room was plenty big for a handful of nights. The design is very modern and we loved it and the Mac a nice touch for doing your own sightseeing / restaurant research and checking emails. Next time we're in Paris, we'll def stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with chic, new decor. Mac computer with free internet in the comfort of your room.”
Reviews.Author: sgbes
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here and found the staff very accommodating. They happily spoke English with no attitude. Room was super clean and new with it's own Mac computer. I felt very at home and able to look up all points of interest with ease. Don't think you can beat it especially for the price. Stayed in Rm 1. Bathroom was large though I wish they'd made the shower bigger. Very warm which was nice as I visited during the coldest winter in 120 yrs! Nice European breakfast with selection of breads, jams, meats, yogurt and cereal. Location is terrific and blocks from Saint Michele and Luxembourg stops. Had some trouble with the Luxembourg stop accepting any of my credit cards. If you need to take the RER B back to CDG, I recommend Saint Michele stop. P.S. they have a photo contest using your room as the backdrop. bring your gear if you're interesting in participating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: KW1011
Reviews.Content: I traveled alone to Paris and found a deal at Hotel Sorbonne about two months before traveling. Around $500 for 3 weeknights in December. My rate included breakfast and a "Christmas gift upon check-in." I didn't actually receive a gift, but who cares. The hotel was exactly as the photos on the website show. Very chic, modern and well designed. Located close to both the Metro and the RER, I had no problem getting to the hotel from Gare du Nord (no transfer on the RER) and from the the hotel to Charles de Gaulle was very easy as well. The staff spoke English very well and were very friendly. The hotel was what one would expect for Paris - a tiny spiral staircase, a very small lift. The room was small, but cozy and very clean. I found the bed to be comfortable and the linens of high quality. The iMac in the room was a godsend. It was so helpful to look up restaurants and directions on the internet, as well as keep in touch with people back in the States. I had a street view room and was concerned about noise, but during the night things calmed down and I had no problems - I even slept in until 11am each day. The hotel did provide an amenities kit, which included earplugs, in case this was a problem. The room was made up daily, the safe functioned. The shower was hot. I have no complaints. The location could have been closer to more of a neighborhood area, like the Marais, but it was easy to get places from the hotel as it was pretty centrally located. The breakfast, which I only had one day, was pretty decent for a continental buffet and included freshly squeezed OJ. I even emailed the hotel after returning to the US to see if I had left something in my room (turns out, I just overlooked it in my suitcase). They checked with the housekeeper and wrote me back to let me know they didn't find it. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish, friendly hotel in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Joelle A
Reviews.Content: Though the services are rather limited (no bar, no food other than breakfast), it doesn't really matter because you somehow have everything you need at the Hotel Design de la Sorbonne. The decor is stylish, the staff welcoming and friendly, and the atmosphere cosy. We enjoyed sitting by the fire after wintery walks around the city, eating a delicious breakfast, and relaxing in our room. The room itself was well appointed, with an amazing bathtub in our deluxe, top-floor room. Glimpses of the Tour Eiffel from the skylights added a romantic touch. The heating is a little finicky, we had trouble controlling the temperature to a comfortable level, but we were never too cold. The bedding could be slightly improved to a more luxurious standard, but these are minor details in what essentially was a first-rate stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NS666
Reviews.Content: Not a lkarge hotel, with 3-4 rooms on each of 5-6 floors, this was booked my my son after some research. We had good rates. The hotel has had extensive redesign and I guess refurbishment, and feels almost new. Whilst cramped (especially the lift!), it was an enjoyable stay, and we would definitely use again. Our room was a good size, though a couple of others in our party had pretty small rooms, with even smaller bathrooms (no room to wash over the sink in one case), but that is a minor criticism. The staff were helpful, friendly and spoke good English. Breakfast was good; the gas fire in reception was nice after a cold day. The free Apple Mac's in the rooms, with free wifi, were a neat touch - although I had no time to use. I did have to power mine off at the plug, as the light from the LCD screen was a distraction when sleeping overnight. Well placed for Notre Dame, and most central Paris, as long with the latter that you are prepared to walk, use the RER, or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: olivcr
Reviews.Content: This well decorated design hotel is a very good option for those looking for a place to stay a few days in Paris, close to a couple of subway lines and within a walking distance to some of the best to do in Paris. The rooms are really small, but it was all we needed for a week in Paris and they were clean. Particularly the bathroom was an issue, but our room had the smallest of them from the three rooms we had. The acoustic is also one point we were always taking care, since it is possible to listen to conversation from the next door room. But overall it is a well maintained charming place, with a fair French optional breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EmilyNewYork
Reviews.Content: It was a short visit as my last stop. My friend recommended this place. It was great location and great value for the money and kind staff. (Given that I don't speak french.) Rooms are little tiny but.. great location will compensate that. Walk to train/subway station. Literally next door to Sorbonne. Walk to Louvre, Musee d' Orsay.. Greek Quarter, Notre Dame Cathedral... Good thing is that you can take a train from the airport and walk to this place. Save some $$.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location but Loud and Small”
Reviews.Author: CML_2009
Reviews.Content: Location This hotel is located across the street from the University of Sorbonne, in the heart of the Latin Quarter - restaurants, cafes and unique shops are plentiful. Notre Dame and the Louvre are within a 10-15 minute walk. Hotel The service via the front desk was exceptional. They made excellent dining recommendations and had significant travel planning expertise. However, the hotel bans red wine in rooms, which really burns me based on the rate charged. Room My wife and I stayed in a deluxe room for four evenings that was tiny. Although the room's decor was very stylish art deco, it was difficult for two moderate sized adults to maneuver around each other. The size of the bathroom was comical. At 6'1 (185 cm), I was far too big to sit on the toilet or enter/exit the shower. Additionally, the noise from the street is horrendous. My wife and I could hear every hard-soled shoe that passed in front of the window, which coincides with early morning classes. I would recommend this hotel to little people with hearing deficits or those who think size does not matter.

Reviews.Title: “All round nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJ_Cooper
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, the room was very nice and clean, it was a little smaller than your average hotel room, but we had plenty of room to move around in / store our bags without bumping into eachother and it more than made up for the size in character!! The in-room Mac was extremely usefull for quickly looking up maps and the weather etc as well as checking email - this alone makes the hotel a good choice. Breakfast was very nice with baguettes, cheese and meats, plus croissants and pain au chocolat - worth the 13 euros, will book with it included next time. Staff were freindly and helpfull - all round excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Latin Quarter Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Islander063
Reviews.Content: This is a small, stylish, hotel next to the Place de la Sorbonne. The rooms are small by U.S. standards but well kept, clean, and serviced by a very pleasant staff.
