The Luxembourg Gardens are nearby with a metro and B Line stop. Each room has an iMac with free internet. We would happily stay again in this hotel on a return visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BenJones0001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location close to all of the attractions, restaurants and bars. The room was nicely decorated and came with an iMac with free internet and also free wifi for our iPhones which was very useful indeed. The room was small but not so small it was uncomfortable. Now for the down sides, there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room which we found to be a real pain as we had to wait until we went out for our morning coffee. Also we put the do not disturb sign on the door in the afternoon when we came back for a nap and at one point they just came into our room and asked if they could clean, which we found a little annoying as they had, had 5 hours in the morning whilst we were out to clean the room. Also we found the room quite noisy day and night; we could hear pipes banging and doors slamming continuously. In summary, if you can book this hotel for around â‚¬100 per night it is good value but at the advertised price of â‚¬240+ we would have been very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, convenient, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: StellaRossaSeattle
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this hotel... There were things that were absolutely wonderful and some things to improve. The location was really convenient in the 5eme arrondisement, the service was wonderful (friendly, knowledgeable, English-speaking), the rooms were very clean, etc. I had written to the staff prior to my arrival, as I had a flight that arrived at 8:30 a.m. When I checked in at 10 a.m., my room was ready for me! This was such a blessing! The hotel is very "designed" -- makes a statement with its bold colors and playful twists on classic French. Very whimsical! The elevator is about the size of a refrigerator and can fit one person plus luggage. Another good reason to travel lightly in Paris! My room was very tiny as was the bathroom, although it is Paris after all. It had everything I needed, but on a miniature scale. The Mac in the room was a great feature! I was not used to the keyboard, since it differs from an American one, but regardless, it was nice to have a computer. The WiFi did not work very well in my room; I had intermittent service, although it worked well in the Lobby. Lighting could be better; it is on the "moody" side. The acoustics are not the best (could hear neighbors and their plumbing), but since I travel with earplugs it didn't bother me much. The bed is very comfortable -- I slept like a rock! Since it is an hotel de charme, the windows open to a tiny courtyard (you can see your neighbors). I liked having fresh air in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap but beautiful hotel in great location - good for a splurge!”
Reviews.Author: StreathamSusan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we wanted to make sure we had a nice hotel in a good location. Although it was a bit pricier than we wanted to spend, it looked as if it would meet our requirements and we were not disappointed. Room was wasn't huge but it was perfectly adequate and beautifully designed. Breakfast was expensive at 13 euros so we just ate in the many cafes for half that price. Staff were very friendly, which made for a comfortable relaxed stay. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel if you are happy with the price and want to guarantee a great hotel. The Mac PC and free wifi were a nice touch and helpful to check museum opening times / restaurant reviews before heading out.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Chic.”
Reviews.Author: hifromshreya
Reviews.Content: Fits the bill for a SHORT stay in the city of lights. The pros are: Location!! One of the best on the Left bank, right in front of the Sorbonne University (Division IV) Small and cozy. Decor is good, quirky, in fact. Pinks and blues and greens. Each floor has carpets with French names or quotes, and photographs on walls. Its a clean, well maintained place that you can retire to after a day of shopping/sight-seeing. Free internet in each room, with an Apple Mac. That is one bonus. The Service is decently good. The staff is friendly and bilingual. The cons: Don't expect a major view from the hotel rooms. This is not a hotel that you can see the Eiffel from. But a lively campus area more than makes up for it. The hotel is sufficiently muffled, so don't worry about your sleep getting disturbed. Although the rooms are extremely clean and pretty, they are not well planned. The rooms are TINY and can get a little cramped, with a lot of luggage, but the bed size is not compromised on. Also, The rooms have tiny toilets, with a shower cubicle and pot, but all very tastefully decorated. This is why, staying for more than 3-4days can be awkward and trying. By Parisian standards, the room size is normal. But it can get a little cramped, but the end of the day. Price-wise, i found the hotel to be reasonable. The location is good. It is not very close to the metro but has plenty of bus stops on Rue St. Germain, which is right behind the hotel. I'd give it a full recommendation. This hotel fits the bill for a nice stay for a couple of a small family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: JayKaySF
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Design de la Sorbonne for several days while vacationing in Paris. I highly recommend staying here. It's a great hotel in an excellent location. Many great restaurants and shops, and far enough from the really touristy areas so that you can escape the chaos. The hotel staff is very helpful and friendly as well, and fluent in English (which is fantastic since my French is horrible). The rooms aren't huge but pretty standard for European hotels. They also have really good special rates on their website so definitely book your room at their site. Big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “design in small portions”
Reviews.Author: jackied04
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general has a nice feel. The bathroom was nice and large. The room was clean and the location was very good (walking distance tmany interesting points of the city). But the room we stayed in was the smallest we have ever stayed in Paris and the lighting was insufficent.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Perrrry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderfully located, close to the metro, cafes and restaurants, and walking distance to most of the sights. It is clean and well maintained; the staff are friendly; the bed is comfortable. But the room is small. Very small. The bathroom is tiny, such that there is really only room for one person standing. I tried to bend down to the sink but cut my head on the overhanging shelf, whilst nudging the door frame behind me. The price is reasonable for inner Paris, but with such a small size, we really only used the place for sleeping and showering. Not for the claustrophobe, but not a bad place overall.

Reviews.Title: “super cute boutique hotel - great location - small room”
Reviews.Author: Synsiya
Reviews.Content: we really liked this hotel. first, the good stuff: it was very cute and different from any hotel we've stayed in. great location near the sorbonne in the latin quarter...really easy to walk everywhere from here or take transit if you wish. had an imac in every room with free internet. now, the bad stuff: the room was small...enough room for the bed and to open one suitcase halfway. The elevator was also small .. enough room for 2 suitcases and you would have to take the stairs up to meet your luggage. internet connection was slow at times. you are not allowed to eat in the room...ordinarily not a big deal but since we have a 2 year old we need the flexibility. the staff..nice enough but not overly friendly or helpful. on our last day we asked what was open. the staff had previoulsy told the person before us the same details and he suggested we catch up with the other guy and follow him. the room wasn't very expensive but given the size (and compared to rooms in north america) it wasn't convenient for 2 adults and a 2 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: gdelriego
Reviews.Content: The hotel is VERY well located, just footsteps from good restaurants, cafes and bars. The rooms are small but no surprise for those how have been in Paris before. The cleaning lady did a good job and the internet / TV / Computer system available in the room was a nice touch. Taxis are very easy to get as major arteries are within walking distance. I would definetelly book at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lordieclaudie
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Paris was a memorable one , as we got engaged whilst we were there. The hotel was superb! An amazing location and the hotel itself was everything the website said it would be. Beautifully deigned, amazing furniture, spotlessly clean and exceptionally helpful and friendly staff. The rooms were "cosy" but for a boutique hotel we expected that. I would highly recommened this hotel to people and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: aldinger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a quiet street. It's very close (5 min walk) to the Luxembourg metro station. It's also walking distance to the Pantheon, St.Germain (Latin Quarter), and Notre Dame. The room is pretty small but very clean and modern. It even has a computer that doubles as a TV. Internet is a bit slow and walls are thin but overall it was a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: balubina
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel,I've already been here once.,The rooms are very small,but everything looks new,clean and every detail is accurate,the design is everywhere. The area is very well served:underground,busesetc Brasseries,restaurants ,Quartiere Latino and Saint Germain very close.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem - one to remember”
Reviews.Author: CrazyClaireHerts
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel last weekend and really enjoyed our trip. Its part of the hotel des rive gauche and we tried their sister hotel Hotel des Grande Hommes in March this year which was also fantastic. The reception area was quite small but check-in was easy considering it was late at night and the rooms were really welcoming. The lift was small it was fine for two adults and two suitcases - although we did the stairs when we didn't have the luggage! We had a superior room on the top floor and were really pleased with it - its not large by any standards but it was perfect for what we needed with a compact bathroom with walk-in shower, toilet and basin. The beds were really comfy and the best bit was the Apple Mac which was in the corner with internet access - great for doing some last minute research and planning as we'd not had much time beforehand. The hotel is literally around the corner from Place Sorbonne and we can recommend breakfast in a brasserie there called Les Patios where for 7 euros each you could get breakfast which included coffee or tea, orange juice, croissant and tartine - just what you need to start a day of sighseeing! The one slightly negative thing was that the staff on reception weren't as friendly as the Hotel des Grande Hommes (well in our opinion ) they were very nice when asked questions but seemed quieter and less forthcoming that what we had experienced at their sister hotel and we didn't feel we could ask them questions about where to eat locally etc. Might be just us though and we definitely wouldn't let it put us off going here as we had such a fantastic stay in every other way and will recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Chic”
Reviews.Author: slw06
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location to metro, restraunts, shops and Notre Dame. Safe area and literally across the street from the Sorbonne University. Hotel has a very chic interior design and a Mac computer in each room. Room and bathroom was very small but extremely clean and comfortable. A nice breakfast room is available.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed! Much better than most hotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ruth78London
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel that I nearly didn't even look at due to it's 2* rating. I think it's best to ignore these ratings in paris as the night before I stayerd at a '4*' with work and it was dreadful. If you like modern, chic design at great value for money (look on lastminute!) then this is the place for you. There's even free internet on Macs in every room -nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Len_Lambchop
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved staying at the Design Sorbonne: stunning design, polite and helpful staff and terrific location in the Latin Quarter, near lots of cafes and restaurants and shops, and two different stations a short walk away. An iMac in the room with free internet access, plus free wifi - very generous. The absolute best thing for me though was that my room (one of the least expensive) had the most comfortable bed and pillow that I've ever encountered while travelling and I had the best sleep there for my whole month away, plus the shower was so roomy and well designed and the water pressure so good that it was actually the best shower I've had in my life and I'll be looking to replicate it at home. Very very impressed, will always stay here when I visit Paris from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, cool and superb location”
Reviews.Author: PragueMarti
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night in this hotel but totally loved it. We were upgraded to a superior room on the 5th floor and the view was lovely - over the roofs of the Sorbonne university and the Pantheon. The room and the bathroom were tiny (as seems to be the standard in Paris) but really cute and cosy - we especially loved the bed and the tiles in the bathroom and of course the Apple computer which the rooms at the hotel offer - you can use it to watch tv or surf the net. Room was warm and clean and the bed was comfortable. We arrived early in the morning - left our luggage in the hotel storage and went exploring the city's numerous sites in the short time we had in Paris (the main purpose of this trip was a visit to the Disneyland). The staff at the reception was very nice and very efficient and spoke excellent English. The location is just great - the hotel is in a side street so very quiet as a result even though you are just meters off the busy St Michel boulevard. It took us maybe 7-10 minutes to walk to the Notre Dame, about 15 minutes to the Louvre. Carrying the luggage of two people (mine and my niece's) I appreciated the fact that the hotel is maybe 2-3 minutes walk from the RER station Luxembourg which is directly on the line from the CDG airport so no need to transfer. We didn't have the breakfast at the restaurant although their breakfast premises seemed very nice we opted for a cheaper option in a nearby cafe - there are many cafes and restaurants to choose from. I choose the hotel based on its location and the good reviews on the tripadvisor but was a bit nervous that probably the rooms won't be as nice as on the photos as the price that I paid (we booked directly on the hotels website) was maybe a touch too good for such a location and the look of the hotel on the photos but I was not at all disappointed. The room was just as on the pictures; it was all still looking very new, the reception is really pretty and the view we got thanks to being "upgraded" by the hotel staff had a movie quality - just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: HilsTassie
Reviews.Content: We were recommended Hotel Sorbonne by friends and it stacked up on Tripadvisor and looked great - but it was even better than we expected. The rooms were lovely and very comfortable - beds & pillows brilliant. We booked the larger deluxe room which was a reasonable size. Our room directly overlooked the Sorbonne and we were able to sleep with the balcony windows open without being disturbed by street noise. The hotel is 2 minutes walk from the Pantheon, and 30 minutes walk from the Louvre, so it is possible to walk to many attractions. The staff are superb. Their recommendations for dinner were brilliant, and we were appreciative that they were proactive - for example, asking if we would like them to confirm airport transfers for us. We would recommend the Sorbonne to anyone looking for a first class hotel near the centre of Paris

Reviews.Title: “Location, Room and Amentities terriffic, Staff helpful and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Kate24Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel in the latin quarter was perfect, safe and easy to get to all the sights of Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens are a must see. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. The only complaint if any was the coffee and tea at breakfast was terrible and probably a little over priced - ate breakfast out after first day. Apple Mac computer in room both helpful and easy to use, bed comfortable and room reasonably sized. If getting off train at Gare Du Nord - suggestion get a cab to hotel - makes taking suitcases a lot easier. Also suggest carnet of tickets whilst you are there travelling on the meto is easy and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: natbro
Reviews.Content: Only 2 nights in Paris this trip and wanted to stay in the Latin Quarter/St. Germain area for a change of pace. We chose this hotel based on previous reviews. The location was perfect for walking. We visited Notre Dame, Jardin des Plantes, Cluny Museum, Luxembourg Gardens and walked along the Seine--all in one day without public transport. The Pantheon is close by. The restaurant selection on and around Rue Mouffetard is amazing. We walked to the CinÃ©ma UGC OdÃ©on on Blvd St Germain where there was a good selection of VO movies. The hotel: everything is petit. The lobby is small, the elevator miniscule. Our room was #54 which, according to the fire escape diagram on the door, looked to be the biggest room on that floor. We had a large closet with shelves and hanging space. The safe was small- netbook didn't fit. Our bathroom had a tub/shower combo. The sink was teeny; even the toilet was very small. The bed was comfortable as were the pillows. There were two tiny bedside tables. The Apple computer/Samsung monitor worked well. We found the internet a bit slow, but okay. The keyboard (understandably) was European. There were english language TV channels. Our view was onto Rue Victor Cousin and the Sorbonne with the Pantheon in the distance. East facing room- the curtains worked well at blocking out the morning sun. The room was very dark in the evening. There were plenty of lights and lamps, but the black wallpaper, carpet and draperies absorbed, rather than reflected the light. I think that a lighter color scheme would have made a world of difference- both in brightness and making the room appear bigger. We had breakfast there one morning. It is okay, but saw some breakfast menus in Place de la Sorbonne that were a bit cheaper and, more importantly, had lovely square-side tables where one could people-watch while eating. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay, and would use this hotel again (but only if we could have our "big" room again).

Reviews.Title: “Good location - modern design - definately stay”
Reviews.Author: ang201045
Reviews.Content: Pros - convenient location to RER (caught this from the euro star to Luxembourg), clean modern rooms - beautiful design, convenient location - no beggars - lots of restaurants near by, English speaking staff, free wi fi and mac book computer in every room - so convenient!! Cons - we were on the 4th floor and the stairs were very steep - this was ok for us but could be a problem for some. lift was very small only enough room for your luggage - again ok for us, but maybe not for some. rooms were a sized well, however shower and toilet quite compact - again ok for me, but maybe not for some? I really enjoyed staying here and would definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RockonCaroline
Reviews.Content: I had the responsibility of booking a hotel for my sister & her family visiting the UK from Australia. My sister & I had stayed in Paris before and knew what area we wanted to stay and the Design Hotel just really fitted the bill perfectly. The added bonus was the internet/computer in the room. The rooms were absolutely perfect and chic, we did book superior going on the previous reviews. The hotel is centrally located and still was quiet to sleep. I am happy I made the right choice and will recommend in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MTeddy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated between two RER stations (Saint-Michel Notre Dame and Luxemburg) and so it is very close to sightseeing spots as Pantheon, Luxemburg gardens and Notre-Dame. On Boulevard Saint-Michel there is a small store with foodstuffs just 5 minutes walking down from the hotel. Rooms and corridors are interestingly decorated with colorful walpapers and pictures. Our room was small, in black-green colours, always clean and has a small bed and really tiny bathroom. But we liked it. It has own Apple PC with free internet and TV. We did not eat breakfasts in hotel, because there are another cheaper opportunities where to buy a croisant or baguette or eat in a cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy kitsch”
Reviews.Author: Bes1
Reviews.Content: Nice, cosy hotel in a lovely, quiet area. My room was extremely colourful with 'silver' accents, bit kitschy but funny. Small (with an even smaller bathroom of course, welcome to Paris), but meticulously clean. Great shower, nice bed and of course the mac with free internet is just great. The breakfast is really nothing special and overpriced though. All in all - lovely hotel, can def recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room on top floor - excellent if you can get a deal!”
Reviews.Author: AliceR006
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the two rooms on the top floor in the eaves with a bath in the room and a fantastic view of the pantheon and overlooking the sorbonne. Absolutely loved it - although probably not worth the 350 euro or so rates they were charging on the day - but we were happy as we had got it on a special offer. Friendly staff too. Great location - plenty of parks and nice bookshops round the university, and only 10 mins walk from the islands. Also recommend the cafe in the odeon theatre nearby - great simple food, stays open late and a beautiful place to sit on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very nice design hotel near Jardin Luxembourg”
Reviews.Author: Tien79
Reviews.Content: We have stayd at the Hotel Design de la Sorbonne last week and enjoyed it very much. It is a nicely decorated, clean hotel with kind helpfull receptionists. As it is only 10 minutes away from Gare du Nord (by RER), only 2 minutes walk from the Jardin du Luxembourg and walking distance from St. Germain, the location is perfect! The clean and complete designrooms are small (aren't they all in Paris?), but with a Mac computer with free internet. No need to bring your laptop! A perfect place to enjoy a few days in Paris with your spouse/partner, we wouldn't recommend it to couples with young children as the hotel, the rooms and public areas are all very small.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet style Sorbonne,”
Reviews.Author: KAGOZ
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel with a great quiet location and very friendly helpful staff. Its has definite style and design flair which makes its a chic place to stay. The rooms are not huge but this is so through out most of Europe so I thought it was pretty good and im 6'5" or 193cm tall. The Mac computer in the room for TV and free internet was a real bonus too. If you can get an early advanced booking rate on their web site and not one of the booking sites then its great value. Cafes everywhere, cinemas galore and some great quiet restaurants up behind the Pathenon a minute away.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable & convenient”
Reviews.Author: Good_nights_sleep
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of hunting around for a hotel before I booked my four night stay in Paris. And I definitely struck it lucky with this place. I booked far enough in advance to get a good rate on a double superior room (with shower). The room wasn't that much smaller than a lot of hotels I've stayed in (even in Australia) and I loved the decor (very pink!). I am typically very picky about the cleanliness of the bathrooms in hotels but couldn't fault the housekeeping here. As I don't speak any French the multilingual staff were a terrific help. Once I got my bearings the location was also a big plus. They do ask you to leave your room key at reception when you go out. I hadn't encountered this before, but it was nice not having to worry about where I'd left it or panic about it being stolen during the day. I know other reviews have mentioned the speed of the internet connection but I really didn't have any problems with this in my room (on the third floor) and it was nice not to have to hunt for an internet cafe or use my phone for a change. I would happily book this hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing find in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: jamesward
Reviews.Content: A brand newly refurbished hotel, in the centre of Paris, with amazing staff - all for under 100â‚¬ a night. Wow. What's not to like about this hotel. It's small enough to have a friendly, family feel about it but the facilities are bang up-to-date (Apple Mac and free wifi in every room), the beds are very comfortable and the location can't be beaten. Damien on reception deserves an extra special mention. He was hardworking but always very friendly and helpful. The only small downside for us was the couple in the next room having a loud argument late at night. The walls didn't provide a lot of soundproofing, but thankfully a few bangs on the wall soon shut them up.

Reviews.Title: “excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishinspain
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 2 nights in the Hotel Design Sorbonne. it was our first time in Paris and needless to say we loved the city. I chose the hotel having read the opinions on here, and i'm very glad it was the one i decided on. It's a beautifully designed boutique hotel, only a 10min walk from the Latin Quarter. Even though it's well located in a busy area, the street it's on is very quiet so we had absolutely no problems with getting a good night's sleep. The metro is a 5-10min walk - there are 2 stops and also a RER stop nearby. We didn't use buses. Breakfast at the hotel is 8â‚¬ for a continental selection and 13â‚¬ for hot food. We didn't have breakfast there though - we walked 1 minute down the street to the Place de la Sorbonne as we wanted to be outside. There are 3 cafes side by side offering continental breakfast for 7â‚¬. We tried 2 of them and both were great. We were welcomed on arrival by a helpful staff member, and any other dealings we had with the staff were warm and polite, and they spoke great Enlgish (my French is embarassingly rusty!) I emailed the hotel before our trip about dinner on our first night. They recommended and booked Le Cosi which is about 2mins away. We had a great dinner there! The hotel is tiny - corridors, reception area, breakfast area, BUT it's all spotlessly clean and beautifully designed. Our room, as expected having read the reviews here, really was tiny. The next time I think I'd pay more for a bigger room if possible, as we really were stepping on each other's toes! However we didn't spend much time at all in the room, so it wasn't a big deal. I felt the bed was also very small - obviously due to the size of the room! The room and bed size are the reasons I gave 3 stars for room and sleep quality, even though we slept well! T All in all we had a lovely time, and would most definitely return and would also recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Room tiny but overall very good”
Reviews.Author: WaltzingMatilda20
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel purely based on the reviews on Tripadvisor as I had never been to Paris before. The hotel is quite chic in interior design and although the rooms are VERY small (apparently you have to expect this in Paris), I found them to be comfortable and clean. Our bathroom was more than sufficient in size and also had a bath. The best part about this hotel really was the location. You cant beat it for very easy access to the RER B and the Saint Michael metro. RER B is the direct line from CDG Airport and was one of the reasons I chose this hotel (Luxemborg stop 3 minutes walk). The whole metro thing was really easy and if you get yourself a Paris Visite travel card in CDG from the information booth in Terminal 2, you are set to use the fantastic public transport system as soon as you leave the airport. The hotel breakfast was pleasant and traditional. The front desk staff answered all our questions quite happily in English. Near the Luxemborg Gardens, walking distance to Notre Dame, shopping, cafes and very safe day & night, I would definately recomment the location. All the comments about the lift are true. I person with 1 bag only.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: touristSheffield
Reviews.Content: Although the superior room was tiny (and the bathroom miniscule), the overall ambience, design and location made up for this. Very helpful staff (lift almost impossible to get 2 people into- making it difficult to get to 5th floor room) next to Place De Sorbonne - with lovely restuarants and bars,yet the hotel itself was very quiet at night A great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: McBrown85
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner at the Hotel Design de la Sorbonne on 14th-16th July 2010. It was our first trip to Paris and booked this hotel based on the brilliant reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not dissapointed! We were due to arrive in Paris a little earlier than check in so a few days before I emailed the hotel and asked if it was possible to check in a little early, on our arrival our room was ready which was a lovely bonus. The hotel itself is small and quaint but has lots of character! Our room was on the ground floor and we were not disturbed by any noise during the night, the room had lovely decor and was spotless and clean. The location of the hotel was ideal for sightseeing, only a five min walk to Notre Dame, the latin quarter is close by with some great choices of restraunts, cafe's and bars. Other travellers have complained about the room size, the rooms are small but for a few days stay they have more than ample room. The mac computer in the room also came in handy to check the weather for the day ahead and good internet access! I would definately reccomend this hotel to other travellers who want a boutique style hotel with out the price tag and a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely (new) rooms and furniture”
Reviews.Author: aussieladytraveller
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit overdue but I had to write it as we had a great stay at this hotel. The rooms are small but that is standard for Paris. We had a room higher up, overlooking the street and rooftops. Our windows opened up and let in the lovely warm breeze. Beds were comfortable, all furniture and accessories were beautifully co-ordinated and in excellent condition. Hotel is within walking distance to Jardin Luxembourg - grab a picnic and head there for some people watching and relaxation. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel so can't comment on that. Hotel is within walking distance to the metro and also to some restaurants, cafes and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy but stylish rooms in a stunning location, helpful staff indeed”
Reviews.Author: PeteHarris
Reviews.Content: Having our flights cancelled at the last minute by the volcano left us with a bit of contingency work on our hands. We bagged Eurostar tickets, but lost our first night in Paris. We emailed the hotel to let them know our rooms would be available that Friday night, but we were still coming Saturday. The rooms are small - as others have said - but they are very nice, and in such a great location I can only think you should be leaving the room more! The walls were a little on the thin side, but not enough to be a major inconvenience. The staff were very helpful - not only with the day late arrival, but also with recommendations for restaurants, and service in the small breakfast/tea room. The most impressive fact of the weekend was that unexpectedly the hotel refunded us for the night we missed (despite not being obliged to) which I think really sets apart hotels in the customer service stakes. The combination of location, honest and friendly staff and attentive service made this a great choice and I'm glad we went for them. (Actually, we used this site to act on our decision). Whilst it wasn't cheap (Â£70pppn), for the heart of Paris and a hotel - not a hostel - i felt it was worth the premium. I'd certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “could not ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: p-onholiday
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful nine night stay at this hotel. The staff couldn't be more helpful and friendly and they really made us welcome for the duration of our stay. We had read reviews saying the rooms were small but it's Paris, you expect a smaller than normal room for the privilege of staying in one of the old buildings! However, we were there for 9 nights so were worried that we would maybe feel a bit boxed in but we didn't feel claustrophobic or get cabin fever at all! We have stayed in cheaper hotels in the area and more expensive ones as well and the rooms have all been of similar size but I have found this room the most comfortable by a long way, the A/C definitely helps! There is also an iMac in each room which is handy for the internet to check restaurants/sightseeing etc... The location of the hotel is perfect, lots of lovely restaurants within a short walk and several transport links within 10 minutes. We got the RER from CDG airport to Luxembourg station and it was a short 5-10 minute walk to the hotel. Could not recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great city!”
Reviews.Author: Tantastic
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel based on the good reviews on here and the good price (approx Â£100 a night) and wasn't disappointed. Its in a great location, close to the Luxembourg RER station (2 min walk) which is great for the airport and a 5 min walk from the nearest metro. Had a twin room on 5th floor. Yes the lift is tiny but it did the job for 2 of us and 2 weekend cases. The room and the hotel were really well decorated in a boutique style. The room wasn't small at all for a weekend stay and we had plenty of space for 2 cases. The room had aircon and a safe and free internet access, which is excellent when you consider the prices charged for this in most hotels. Bathroom was clean and nicely decorated. The lady at reception was really helpful and printed off maps and gave us information on anything we asked about. All the staff were really friendly. Had great weekend in Paris and would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend - in fact I can't think of any negatives (which is unusual for me!)

Reviews.Title: “Location extraordinaire”
Reviews.Author: desacadienserrants
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beaten. Within an easy walk to Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens, the galleries of St Germain des Pres... we couldn't have asked for more. The decor was very appealing, with a very trendy flair. The rooms are certainly small, and I have no experience with any other Parisian hotels, but I take it this is par for the course, so I wasn't too surprised. The shower was a bit problematic; I think it wasn't properly sealed as we had a problem with slight flooding every time we used it, despite trying to move the shower head around to minimize the problem. The breakfast was impressive for the price; our first morning in Paris we ate a croissant and coffee at a cafe across the street and were surprised to find that the breakfast at the hotel was more plentiful for the same price, so we ate our breakfasts there for the rest of our visit. Definitely a good choice as a base for exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Just as advertised”
Reviews.Author: lonetraveler25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Desigh del las Sorbonne for 2 nights this June. The room was adorable just as the websites pictures showed. I got the room and breakfast package and it was completely worth it. The breakfast was ready the first day at 7:30am and the sencond day I had come in a bit early and they were completely ok with setting up early for me. All the staff was very kind and very helpful which was greatly appreciated! I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT A/C, SMALL SHOWER”
Reviews.Author: POPA-JOE
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at hotel at end of June on arrival in Paris (Paris Nord station) on the Eurostar train from England. Took RER train from Paris Nord station to Luxembourg station about 3 blocks from the hotel. Difficult to exit from Luxembourg station with luggage. Easy walk to hotel, however. Hotel well-located in Latin Quarter a block fom the Sorbonne, 15 minute walk to Notre Dame. Lots of outdoor restaurants & shops nearby including grocery store on Blvd. St. Michel. English speaking front desk staff; pleasant and customer oriented. Minimal amounts of ice upon request. Did not use the hotel restaurant. Stayed in (small)Room 15 on 2nd floor. Double bed. Very quiet. A/C was the best during hot, humid Paris summer days. (Whereever you stay ensure A/C available.)Bathroom size was ok, but shower was the smallest ever. TV doubled as computer w/internet access. Took 55 Euro/30 minute taxi ride to CDG Airport upon departure. Great hotel; would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at a charming boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marieroseUsa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location in the 5th district of Paris. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Will definitively stay again and strongly recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “great and great”
Reviews.Author: kartikdelhi
Reviews.Content: his hotel is right across the street from the Sorbonne University. It is in a very safe neighborhood and there are plenty of cafes and bookstores in the area. It is also only a couple blocks from the Cluny Museum. It is an easy walk to one RER and three Metro stations. It is a couple blocks to the Luxembourg Gardens and you can walk to Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter tourist area, the Louvre, Ste. Chapelle, the d'Orsay. The location can't be beat for the price. Desk is staffed 24 hours a day and the staff speak English. They are very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast is a bargain at only 5 euros. The rooms are small but very clean. You have a telephone and hair dryer and plenty of closet space. I had no trouble hooking up my laptop and recharging camera batteries. You don't get a lot of amenities at this price, but you do get location, location, location. It is just half a block from the Place de la Sorbonne with busy cafes and shops and a fountain. Blvd. St. Michel is at the other end of the Place. If you get a room in the front, you can actually see into the classrooms at the Sorbonne University across the street. One desk clerk spent a goodly amount of time helping me find an adapter for my battery charger and then just loaned it to me on the honor system. They are all very pleasant. They offered to call to confirm our return flight. We did it ourselves, but it was nice of them to offer. We were very happy with the service there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in nicely renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pensionado
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this trendy renovated hotel are small but quiet. Beds are comfortable. Bathroom is also small but up to date and clean. The location is perfect; many sight are on walking distance and the area is full of nice restaurants and plenty of side walk cafes. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Best rates are available when you book early via internet. We paid on average EUR 145 per day; continental breakfast is EUR 8 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Style Over Substance”
Reviews.Author: BeePhoenix
Reviews.Content: We really liked the chic style of this hotel, which offers an iMac in every room and some very cool decor. But we were disappointed by the service. The room we were given was a superior room, with lime green and black wallpaper. It was a bit on the small side but looked out over a courtyard with lots of posh apartments and had good sunlight. The iMac in the room was very good for internet, watching TV and movies and was a great idea. There was also free wifi but the hotel doesn't put a password on the network so everyone from hotel guests to students from the Sorbonne across the road can access it. As a result, the wifi is very slow and pretty much useless - a pain if we needed to use our laptop and iPhone. On the first night we went to bed and discovered that the bed was broken. The night receptionist couldn't offer us another room because the hotel was full and his (valiant) attempt to fix the bed just made it worse. As it was too late to look for another hotel, we had to try to sleep in the busted bed. The next day it was promptly fixed but there was no real apology and no offer of a refund or any attempt to compensate for the inconvenience. We also noticed that the cleaning staff tended to fling our belongings onto the floor so that they could make the bed or tidy up, which was a little disconcerting. On the plus side - hotel is in a good location, near the Luxembourg RER station and the St Michel metro. There are nice restaurants and good shopping nearby. The Latin Quarter is very touristy but bustling and the hotel is on a quiet side street. The staff were okay, not too friendly but they spoke English. They held our bags for us after checkout. Overall, the hotel is very stylish, certainly not your run of the mill chain, but falls down a little when it comes to service. We would cautiously recommend it to a friend (they might have a better experience) but would try somewhere else next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very expensive shoe box!”
Reviews.Author: snowinparis
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was a really awful - we pre-paid for a superior room, it was a shoe box. Having been coming to Paris for 10 years I can honestly say that this was the worst hotel we have stayed, as the room was far too small, The hotel did provide a cot for our baby - however it had to be placed against the window - and babies should not sleep in a draft. So the baby was put between my husband and I in the small double bed. We could not move around the room, so to get to our clothes we had to move the travel cot onto our bed and so on. I did question whether the room was superior but I was told that it was and that others rooms had even tinier bathrooms. Our baby had nowhere but the bed to play in - but the bed had to be used for bags when it was not used for sleeping, and babies can not really play on beds as they can fall off them. Noise from the road below was load at times. The window faced onto the street, meaning that we had no privacy if the window was open and it was gloomy if the window was shut. The room was stuffy the carpet was wet by the shower/toilet - there was no bath for a baby. The Mac was small - no bigger than a 19 inch screen but the room was so small, the furniture in the room was chipped. There were not enough towels provided - the first night we were told that they had no more clean towels, the second and third night we requested more. Our stay for 3 nights was not much shy of 500 GBP. I am well aware that hotels in paris may mean small rooms, but I feel completely ripped off by the room we stayed in. Staff seemed nice enough and other guests seemed to have bigger rooms, but they should never have put us in that room - it simply was no suitable for a baby. In hindsight I should never ever have signed for the pre-payment before seeing a room. I will now always ensure I see a room before I move my bags in - and I have to say that this is the first time I have been let down by tripadvisor reviews.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Fi_Lpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Design Hotel Sorbonne in March 2010 and were so pleased to have found it. It is located by one of the Sorbonne University buildings on a fairly quiet road (and our room was at the front). it is about a 5 minute walk to the nearest Metro station in a lovely area that felt totally safe both day and night. The place has been refurbished to a high and very modern standard - it has a modern and colourful design which is felt as soon as you enter reception and followed through all the communal areas and the rooms themselves. Knowing that many Paris hotel rooms are small we didnt have great expectations of space however we were pleasantly surprised that it wasnt a poky little room but a decent size (certainly not large but nevertheless a totally decent size). Our room was right next to the lift which was so small that we rode it once but never again! And i would venture that most people would take the stairs unless you like the feeling of claustrophobia. One of the nice features of the hotel is that there is an IMac in every room which doubles up as a television with a couple of English channels. It was a great base from which to explore Paris and there are some nice bars nearby too (serving the smallest glass of wine known to man - 90ml!) and overall Paris is pretty expensive, but this place has to be one of the best mid-range hotels. I would totally recommend it to a friend and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Petite is generous description of the room but fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy034
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11am to this hotel and we were allowed to go straight into our room which was great as we had caught an overnight train to Paris. The room was modern and fully renovated but absolutely tiny. Both my boyfriend and I are tall and we found it pretty claustrophobic. The noise from the other rooms was pretty bad. We heard our neighbour having a full conversation with her mum on the phone and the fact we could hear this and detect her accent meant that the walls are thin. However such a great area to stay, lots of resturants and bars and near the beautiful Jardin du Luxembourg. I would recommend this hotel for its location and it is clean and renovated, but I woudl ensure you get a larger room. It was tiny and unless you are a hobbit I think you will find it too small for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Not petite at all!!”
Reviews.Author: Danish H
Reviews.Content: Paris is our last stop for our Europe trip. And what a grand way to wrap our our trip by staying in this hotel. It is located in Rue de Cousin and Rue de Sorbonne. To simplify this review, just book the room and enjoy this lovely boutique hotel. The washroom is big enough for 2 people to move around freely, which is very rare for a typical french hotel. There is a Mac computer, and wi-fi is free all over the hotel. The room interior is as beautiful as seen in their website. Of course, the elevator is still petite, but you are in Paris; be romantic and hold your love of your life tight while going up the elevator. Receptionists at the front desk are extremely helpful, friendly and informative. Breakfast is served with options of 8euro or 13euro. Outside the hotel, you can find lots of chic restaurants, and further down there is a mini supermarket, lots of boutiques, home interior shops, and well known big brand, eg Etro, Ralph Lauren, etc. Overall, this hotel exceeds my expectations in many ways, and in Paris, the size of the room is considered Grande.

Reviews.Title: “You're better off living in a cave.”
Reviews.Author: jaslim13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a joke. We booked it on the website itself at 115euros (50% discount early booking internet pricing) per day and stayed for 3 nights. The room is amazingly dark. There're only two lights in the room, and I'm not even talking about ceiling lights. These are tiny bedside lamp lights we're talking about. Tried pulling back the curtains but closed it back immediately. You see, I stayed in room 2, first floor and that means everyone can look in these full length windows which are directly beside your bed = no privacy at all. That means no sunlight, no lights, just darkness all around. Staff was unfriendly every single time. From the moment we came in, no smiles no nothing, not even a 'Hello.' Extremely unwilling to answer questions. Saw that previous members were given maps of Paris. Well they didn't even present us with the hotel name card nor inform us of anything else, except shoving our room key to us. I'm sure it wasn't me because I always smile at people and stuff. Maybe it's because I'm Asian? Idk. Hairs found on the bedsheets when I haven't even slept on it. Internet on the iMac is slow like hell, practically non-existent I think. I tried loading Twitter. It took so long to load I had time to shower (i;m a girl), brush my teeth, dry my hair and it was still loading Hotel was nice enough to give us two chocolates....except they put it in the sink. Eew? I took those out and scrunched it a little and threw it on the table. The next day we found the same scrunched up chocolates on our pillows. Ooooookay. For my money I'm positively sure I would be better off living in a cave lit with candles. I'm sorry but the hotel is just horrible.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: larryharryUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the end of May. This hotel is located in a good spot within the Latin Quarter.It is quiet at night but just around the corner for places to eat and drink. The design classic rooms are small but sufficient for 2 to sleep.We used the hotel as a base so were not there very often. The staff speak English and are pleasent and accomodating. I was suprised that the staff were unable to book me a taxi for a return trip from the Eiffel Tower area one evening though. Could do with tea/coffee facilities within room. Would recommend this hotel for location, cleanliness and quirkiness (ie: interior design).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKNinaBR
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband and 2 year old daughter. They gave us a cot free of charge, most places we contacted wanted to charge. We stayed on a double superior room which is a bit bigger than the double. Hotel staff were helpful when we needed. The hotel is very clean, no smoking and in a excelent location next to sorbonne university in the latin quarter. The room was very clean and modern small but this is Paris. We were very pleased with our stay and defenitely recommend. The only thing I can say is that the lift is very small, but at least there is one.

Reviews.Title: “Cool economical boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_duo
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Paris and enjoy a hip but economical hotel without all of the useless amenities that you probably don't use anyway, then try this hotel. Our room, #33, was the typical small Parisian hotel room, but everything was still very nice. The first plus was the free in-room internet on a Mac. The second, the linens were all very crisp and fresh; third, the tiny (but modern) bathroom was super clean, and finally, the design of the room itself was also fairly hip -which makes the simple hotel fun. If you chose to, you could have breakfast in the small dining room on the first level, but we chose to venture out and find new places to eat everyday. The only drawback to the hotel was a little noise from the neighbor's entering or leaving their room, and a little more from the cleaning staff in the morning. Overall, for the price this turned out to be an excellent choice on our part. The staff was always friendly and willing to help us if we needed assistance in deciphering anything (since our French is more than limited).

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: daithi70
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Hotel Design at the Sorbonne for a short break in May.The hotel was very centrally located-just around the corner from the Pantheon, and very close by a whole host of restaurants and bars. The staff were friendly and helpful, giving us a very detailed map of the city which came in very handy! The staff were also ready to accommodate re-bookings in case our flight was delayed/cancelled due to the volcanic ash-luckily our flights were not affected. The decor was very unusual-our room had a massive roll top bath right beside the bed!The room was tiled, bit the floors were warm to the touch, and the bed itself was very comfortable. We didn't have any meals in the hotel as there were loads of places to have breakfast nearby. We didn't want to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “If you like a good night's sleep, this isn't the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: HoldenGreen
Reviews.Content: Quaint hotel in the Latin Quarter. Great location. However, the walls are paper thin. We laughed when we saw that the hotel provided two sets of earplugs, however we didn't think we'd need them. We were wrong. We heard the guy upstairs sneezing! The rooms are very small, but that's okay...it's Paris. However, the noise level is unacceptable. It's not noise from the street, it's noise from the hallways and other rooms. Pray that you don't get room 1 - it's the only room off the lobby and is right next to the staff office and lobby toilet. It was a little strange. We booked the room online through the hotel directly and received a promotional rate. I guess the promo rate is valid for the worst room in the hotel. The staff is truly an asset to the hotel. The guy who worked late in the evening and early in the morning was top notch! He was friendly, helpful, and very nice. His english is great, and he made us feel very welcome. It's not his fault the hotel is noisy. I wouldn't stay here again, as there are other hotels in the same price range nearby in which I'd stay before returning to Hotel Sorbonne.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location! Enough...”
Reviews.Author: Jenksruss
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Enough said. Apart from that the hotel is very nice but I personally found that our room was nothing really special, just some nice wallpaper on a normal room...and that's it. Yes there are Macs in all the rooms but the cables are not hidden and it's not possible to plug in your own iPod or iPhone, so what's the point? The reception, corridors and breakfast room are all lovely however I was left disappointed by the unimaginative room. That said I would recommend it for a night and as I said, location is everything.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but very very small!”
Reviews.Author: Trueandfair
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate our first wedding anniversary over a long weekend. The only reason I booked the hotel was due to tripadvisor reviews. We were not disspointed with the hotel-beautifully decorated and quaint. Luckily we are both quite slim but had either one of us been bigger it would have been uncomfortably small-especially the lift and the bathroom. Having said that we expected this from reading previous reviews. The staff are lovely, location is great and breakfast was also delicious. We were slightly disspointed that even though we had mentioned at the time of booking (on their own website) it was our anniversary, there was nothing that made this special. Perhaps if we had stayed in a larger chain we would have recieved a complimentary breakfast/flowers/champagne. Maybe this is the expectation we had due to the fact that we had mentioned it when making the reservation and we expected the hotel to go above and beyond our expectations? Overall a great location, beautifully decorated hotel. A minibar/tea and coffee facilties in the room would have been much appreciated as when we came back after a full day sightseeing we wanted to relax in the room before getting changed for dinner-we had to order room service for this at over 10 euros. On our first day we walked to the Eiffel Tower - quite a walk!! RER is very close, some delicous places to eat and drink nearby and a few supermarkets if you need anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: katy554
Reviews.Content: Stayed our first night in Paris at Hotel Sorbonne, and we loved it. Great location for getting acquainted with the city, close to the metro, close to lots of popular sites, and nice little eating places right around the corner! Rooms were typical european hotel rooms as far as size goes, but cutely decorated! The best part was the Mac computers in the room. I wish every hotel had these! They made it so much easier to look up restaurants, other hotels, book trains, contact family, etc. The hotel staff was very helpful, and the breakfast was just right to start the day. Typical french fare and coffee. Every staff member we came into contact with was nothing but pleasant and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “9 nights in paris”
Reviews.Author: wswmagnolia
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED this hotel! It was very small but so cozy and quaint. we heard no street noise at all though the walls are very thin and sounds reverberates through the halls/stairway. However, it did not bother us at all. The free internet connection and Mac were a huge plus and the LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION is just PERFECT! the staff was very friendly and the room service excellent. We would definitely return to this hotel! Not used to having to turn in the room key each time we left the hotel but that was fine. When in Rome... :)

Reviews.Title: “If your going to stay in the Latin Quarter..stay here !!”
Reviews.Author: featheredserpent
Reviews.Content: This place is just awesome for the money. Very cool designer boutique hotel. The staff is very sweet and helpful. You can walk to EVERYTHING in the latin quarter, the rooms were immaculate and were very quiet facing the Sorbonne. The place has a very unique hotel, and ive never been to any other hotel like it. Just a great find for 80 euro a night !!! Loved you guys!! Oh yeah- Macs with free internet in our room!!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Linderup
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights in a standard room for 220 Euros (booked at the hotels own webpage www.hotelsorbonne.com). For the price this was sublime value for the money. Well rooms are small and beds even so, but the rooms are clean, have a nice design and free internet. The staff is very friendly and the location is fine - there is no noise from the streets at night and a 5 minutes walk to the metro and 8-10 minutes to Louvre and RER B (to the CDG airport). Defiantly recommend if you can get the discounted price - for the list price of 240 Euros a night this is just another expensive hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: sms6778
Reviews.Content: Got back yesterday from this hotel and i really liked it. It is very well located: close to RER B that takes you directly to CDG airport, restaurants, supermarkets, and we walked everywhere except for Eiffel Tower and Montmartre. The hotel is in a side street facing the Sorbonne, but as our room faced the inner courtyard there was no street noise. The room and bathroom are small (like i already knew because of the reviews here) but i found it adequate for the two of us. I liked the new bathroom and the funky decoration of the bedroom. Most importantly, it was very clean. The only bad thing i can think about this place is the thin walls. If you have noisy neighbours and light sleep it could be a problem, but not my case and i sleept weel everyday as i found the bed very confortable and big. Oh, and i loved the Mac in the bedroom, it really was great to keep in touch while away on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is nice except the bed!”
Reviews.Author: Doris168
Reviews.Content: the mattress of this hotel is definitely not good for healthy sleeping. We stayed for 3 nights last week and now we are still nursing our sore neck and back! Watch out also for the sharp metal shelves in the tiny bathroom...i had acut but the staff was nice enough to offer me a plaster. Other than the above, the location is good with many restaurants around....

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, great location - perfect for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: LJR83
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for our 1st wedding anniversary (in room no.52, a 'design double classic', on 5th floor). Main plus points include the modern, boutique-style design, the location (close to the RER line to CDG airport & Gare Nord, in a nice neighbourhood that felt safe to walk around at night, & just 10mins walk to Notre Dame & the Seine), the in-room tv/computer with free internet access, and the wonderful view we had of the Pantheon from our room. The only slight negative was the size of the shower-room (very narrow), but it was clean and modern & fine for a few nights stay. Also, no iron, kettle or mini-fridge in the room - but again, could easily live without these for a few days. All in all, we had a wonderful stay at the hotel design de la sorbonne and I am certainly hoping we get to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: mak_nob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is funky, a lot of thought went into the design, service was great, very helpful and the location is very good

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, stylish, friendly...Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Jen_Si_UK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day break in Paris and the hotel was more than we expected. Lovely staff, lovely hotel, very clean, comfortable and free internet access to boot. Our bed was made, room cleaned and towels changed every day we were there with a lovely sweet left on our pillows. There was a little noise from the street but mainly first thing in the morning due to students walking to University at the bottom of the road - but no more disturbance than a normal street. Bathrooms are a little tight but I've heard this is usual for Paris and I actually booked this hotel based on previous reviews. Surprised it is only 2 star! The hotel is in a great location and easy to navigate around Paris. This being our first trip to Paris, it was very easy to find and accessible from Metro station literally a 2 minute walk away (just make sure you have a good map with you and know which entrance to come out of station - 'Gay Lussac' exit). Plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and within walking distance to shops etc. Would definately recommend this hotel and will be sure to stay here again if we ever return to Paris in the future!

Reviews.Title: “great decoration, with great location”
Reviews.Author: castorr
Reviews.Content: i really liked this hotel...everyone said to me that in paris, the affordable hotels were lousy... but they were wrong... this one is really nice, the decoration is amazing... but it's still a 2 star hotel... but better them a lot of 4 stars hotel that i stayed in... the breakfast is kind of pour, but just because it's not a huge buffet... it's still good... but they could do better... the staff is really great..everyone speaks english and understood my lousy french! the rooms are really small but they are amazing decoration... the bathroom could be bigger...but it's still okay...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: rhizome1844
Reviews.Content: I really can't find any fault with the hotel. Ok so the rooms are small don't have a minibar or coffee making facilities but i do not intend to spend any significant amount of time in the room. Why would you in Paris? I can't imagine that there is a hotel with a better location. The surrounding bars and restaurants are excellent and the hotel is 30mins from the airport via RER Luxembourg. You can walk to all that Paris offers from hotel with ease. The hotel is unique in every way. From the lobby to the reception toilet to the staircase the entire hotel is furnished in such a stylish way. The staff are welcoming and extremely helpful. The rooms are extremely comfortable, clean and again beautifully furnished. The Apple MAC in the room is another stylish addition. The view of the Sorbonne from the room adds to the ambience. The hotel is probably the best hotel I have had the pleasure to stay in in a capital city. I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone. Thank you to the hotel for helping making our trip such a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste time looking at any other hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Scottie078
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Paris, we finally decided on the Hotel Design de la Sorbonne after reading all of the great reviews it gets on Trip Advisor and we were certainly not disappointed! Although the public areas of the hotel and the rooms are quite small, the decor is very trendy and modern and everywhere has a 'polished' feel to it. There were 4 of us in our group with 2 staying in a Superior room and 2 in a Delux room. Both rooms were lovely, but the Delux was much more spacious (worth paying the extra for!). The hotel itself is in a superb location. We flew into CDG airport and took the train (RER Line B) to Luxembourg station. It only cost 8.60 euros each way and the station is only a five minute walk from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as it really is as good as all the great reviews it gets. Don't waste anytime searching through the millions of hotels in Paris, just book the Sorbonne - job done!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Excellent Staff and Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: travelinstylegirl
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Tripadvisor and despite reviews that rooms were too small, we decided to take a chance. We were not disappointed and in fact, it was even better than we expected! We got a very good deal when we visited and paid about EUR370 total for the two nights we stayed here. We booked the design deluxe room, which I understand is a little bigger than the normal room, but nevertheless the size of the room was just right. The bathroom is on the small side but the layout made it absolutely perfect. We never felt cramped; it was very well designed. We love how the design was well thought out; it is very unique, very hip and trendy and is targeted to younger people. We loved the imacs in each room which doubled as a TV. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and spoke perfect english. The street where the hotel is located is very quiet, something which is hard to find in central Paris. We loved the whole vibe of the place, being a university area. Lots of quaint little cafes around the area, and all in all a relaxed, pleasant atmosphere. The location is absolutely fantastic; a very short walk to the Pantheon and a longer, but very pleasant walk to the Notre Dame. We will definitely stay here again! What a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: neevyq
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on tripadvisor and I have to say that the reviews were very accurate! we stayed here from the 9th - 13th of jan. hotel is just off blvd saint micheal, very near blvd saint-germain, notre dame and the pantheon. we took the RER B from CDG, took about half an hour and just a 2 min walk from the station to the hotel, so handy! hotel decoration is lovely from the reception to the rooms. we stayed in the standard room which was small, but this was expected as its paris and it was perfect for just the two of us. really lovely room, very clean and having an apple mac was just brilliant. we also encountered five different memebers of staff during our stay, all were really lovely and helpful and spoke english which was a big plus for me! things to possibly be wary of: the size of the rooms, (if your funny about that) the bathrooms very small so a tall person might find the shower a bit daunting! but me and my boyfirend found it fine and id say we're about average height. also scary spiral staircase which i wouldnt recommend going down if u were a bit tipsy! also do ur research before u go regarding restrauants, loads around this hotel and trying to pick one can be hard, read reviews or ask reception for one as this will save u so much time and mean you'll avoid all the tourist traps! this was our first time in Paris and we just loved it and the hotel def contributed to the experience! if i go back (and i very much plan to) I would def stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION, NICE STAFF AND DESIGN BUT TINY ROOMS!”
Reviews.Author: haydenny
Reviews.Content: You will find a very friendly staff and an excellent location here on a side street along the Sorbonne so the noise levels from the street are low. We very much appreciated the help of Claudine the receptionist as well. The design of the hotel is fun and well done. However, as a New Yorker used to small places, the size of the room was a shock. We booked and prepaid a classic room. It is simply too uncomfortably small and impossibly for small for two people. The bathroom resembled an airplane bathroom in size. I'm not sure how water from the shower avoids flowing into the room. The neon green stripes did not help either. We had to pay another 25 euros to upgrade to a superior room which was slightly better and provided some additional space for luggage and a larger bathroom. But the two of us could not cross the bed at the same time (at times one of us would walk on top of the bed). You basically just need to turn out the lights and go to sleep and forget you are in someone's attic or closet. There is no privacy soundwise from the bathroom with your roommate and you can literally here people peeing in their own rooms followed by toilet flushes. We felt we had to whisper in our room so we wouldn't disturb other people as well. There only other thing to add is our room reeked of body odor after the maid left and we had to open the window in the winter to air it out. I hate the criticize the hotel because the staff is so friendly but we would not stay here again due to the size of the rooms. (And please don't tell me rooms are small in Paris. I know. But there is a limit.) We are two in shape adults. There is no way anyone large or overweight could stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, Apple Mac in room.”
Reviews.Author: margaret279
Reviews.Content: We moved rooms three times on arrival! Firstly we had to "upgrade" to get a bath instead of a shower, then the second room was so hot and there was no adjustment on the radiator. The man on reception was really nice about it all. Rooms a bit small but had an Apple Mac which doubled up as TV, CD and DVD player, internet and a handy restaurant guide! Our bathroom was very small but adequate for one at a time! One of the top rooms in the eaves had a Victorian style bath in the bedroom (separate toilet). Continental breakfast (8 Euros) - I really get annoyed paying a lot for a room abroad and then having to pay extra for breakfast! There was also a choice of buffet at 12 Euros or cooked at (I think) 25 Euros. Our room was on the first floor on the street side, but it was very quiet at night. It led on to Place de Sorbonne which is a pedestrian square very handy for all the sites. The best way to get to the hotel is by RER to Luxembourg. Only 8 minutes from Gare du Nord!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean, cozy choice--a stand-out in its price range”
Reviews.Author: Peregrina651
Reviews.Content: Let me start by thanking my fellow trip advisors for leading me to this absolutely delightful gem; the hotel was everything that you said it would be. Your pictures were great, too. With the euro at 1.40 against the dollar, we were truly watching our pennies on this trip and finding a hotel that would cost us less than $200 per night and still meet our standards was a challenge. Thank you, TA We loved everything about this charming hotel: the staff, the over-the-top decor, the cozy rooms, the location (we walked almost everywhere), the iMAC so I didn't need to bring my own computer, free internet. We did not miss the services that a higher category hotel might have given us (mini-bars, bars, restaurant, fitness room and were happy not to have to pay for their presence. The neighborhood is full of good restaurants but we ended up most nights at one of the two on Place de la Sorbonne (especially after I found that one of them has THE BEST chocolate ice cream). One of these places became our breakfast restaurant. Someone mentioned that the hotel was noisy and that you could hear what was being said in other rooms. I did not find that to be true. Moreover, I found the guests to be unusually quiet in the stairwells and hallways, especially at night. Of course you can hear water in the pipes because it is an old building. And yes, the bathrooms do have issues but cleanliness is not one of them. I never did figure out how to shower without flooding the floor (and wonder if the additions of some gaskets might help). I could go on and on but I would just be repeating what has already been said. So, let me end by saying thank you to everyone at Hotel de la Sorbonne. We had a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “chic, stylish, forgivable shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: westmoor
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me say that as a British couple in our 40s suffering from an intolerance to noise at night, and being crippled by the mighty Euro, this hotel nevertheless provided nearly everything we needed. Flying into CDG, this hotel was only 10 minutes walk from Luxembourg RER on Line B, a direct 40 minutes into Terminal 2B and our Easyjet flight. Painfree journey, no hassle, and only approx. 8 Euros each. This meant we could squeeze the maximum time in Paris - the hotel had a luggage room so we could still enjoy the city before we had to head home. The room was cute, clean, quiet - mattress was far too soft for us but I appreciate lots of people prefer this - my back cant stand it though. The shower room was fine, except anyone over 5ft 6 like me needed to carry out a reversing manoeuvre to sit on the toilet via the hand basin, and the shower pan leaked due to the gap under the cubicle door, but these are just minor gripes. Big plus though was the Apple TV. Fab toy - unlimited access to the internet meant I could keep up with UK news, flight delays etc. As well as watch bizarre Italian game shows and have my customary rant at how poor BBC World is. Many larger hotels suffer in comparison to this kind of facility. The only minus is the breakfast - we didnt buy it as 12 Euros each for "the buffet" is bonkers. We went to MacDonald's and spent 4 Euros 80each on a much better meal! But all in all its a great hotel, great location, and definitely worth searching out.

Reviews.Title: “true french taste near sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: AnjaBukina
Reviews.Content: I had really enjoyed my 3 days stay at Sorbonne hotel in Paris. It's a small boutique hotel, designed with true Parisian artsy taste and located right next to Sorbonne university, in safe and cosy Latin quarter. The service is great and reception speaks perfect English. They are as helpful as any excellent reception could be, besides are friendly and give good advise about the city, which is important for a solo traveller. I am happy to recommend this hotel to anyone, who is looking for a truly Parisienne experience, beautiful environment and attentive and kind staff. Merci bien!

Reviews.Title: “Chic and fun, fashionable yet nostalgic, and does not ask too much”
Reviews.Author: Milij
Reviews.Content: When we were searching online for a hotel to stay in Paris, this one caught our eyes because its design - the bold and bright color of the room and the lobby were beautiful and nicely designed. When we arrived at the place, the ambience is warm; the lobby was small but cozy, nothing falling short of what is displayed on the website. The stairs and passages outside the rooms were narrow probably as most of the Paris hotels, but they are decorated with photos which adds a nostalgic hint to this modern place. The room is small but enough for daily activities. Besides no mini bar, which instead is a public one located at the breakfast place, all the facilities of a decent hotel are there, plus a Mac, which is used as both a computer and a TV. The room we selected had a bathtub, which for a couple, could be anything but for a normal bath, inviting all types of imagination. We got from Sephora several galets de bain effervescents (the bathing stuff that melt in water and give out nice smell to bath). Thought that since we have a bathtub, why not do something with it. It turned out to be a brilliant idea, which included all facets of senses - the sound (of sizzling water when the thing was melting), the temperature (of the warmth of water in such a cold day), the sight (of the person in front of you), the smell (chocolate!), and, most importantly, the taste.. and what's beyond the bath. An exceptionally fulfilling experience. Its location is also very good in that it is close to the subways and RER, as well as the two islands where the museums are located. Itself is on the right bank of Le Seine where we walk around and see lots of bookstores. There are also an area of walking street full of restaurants and bars. One only thing I can think of so far as a weakness might be the flush of the toilet. When pressed once, only minimal water flows out, which was pretty scary and embarrasing since I just finished using the toilet and dont really want to call for help. The trick is to press it for several times quickly like pumping the water. Then at around the 5th pressing, problem got solved... All in all, it's a really cozy and nice-looking small place. I would be happy to stay in the same place for next time visit, though the idea of exploring more nice hotels is always intriguing and probably will always make us stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A stunning hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: michcolon
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a trendy, reasonably priced hotel in a good location - this is the one. Macs replace the TV so you can surf the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location next to The Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: ParisSorbonne
Reviews.Content: Good points first: great location, right opposite the Sorbonne university buildings. Very quiet at night and nice friendly staff. What lets it down, is the lack of quality you would expect from a 4 Star Hotel, we got a Delux Superior Room which had a very small unheated shower room. We had a couple of problems with the room (the Apple PC didn't work efficiently and the flush in the bathroom was awkward and stiff to handle - the hotel staff were aware of both problems but obviously not bothered to sort them out). Very quite at night, but when other residents got up in the morning to use the bathrooms, you could hear everything(!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Design Hotel in the Heart of Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: allsP
