Reviews.Content: Located just opposite to the Sorbonne University and next to the Place de la Sorbonne, this hotel is quite a cozy and convenient place to stay in Paris. The room is clean and elegantly decorated. This is my first time travelling to Paris and I understood that most, if not all, of the rooms in Paris are small, so I won't comment on the size of ours - at least good enough to open two big luggages. The lift is tiny but at least there is one. Soundproof is not that good - you can always hear your neighbours walking through the corridor. The street (Rue de Victor Cousin) is quiet most of the time, except the weekday mornings. It gets unexpectedly busy that you may find yourself woke up early by the motorcycles hustling through. Most of the staff are helpful and nice. And I love to have an iMac with free internet access in our room, just need some times to get familiar with its French style keyboard. And it sometimes restarted itself without warning. Luxembourg station on RER Line B (which directly takes you to the CDG Airport) is just two bends away, which is a good news as you don't need to carry your luggages up and down the stairs through stations. To go to the nearest Metro (Cluny-Sorbonne), you need to walk for about 10 to 15 minutes, which is okay too, unless it's a cold rainy day. The only drawback is the not-so-attractive price, but PARIS, in general, is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.”
Reviews.Author: mark1123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best in my two week five hotel journey. We arrived in Paris and got on the RER from CDG, from the stop near the hotel it was only 5 minute uphill walk (Suggestion don't over pack) It was more than the pain of lugging the luggage from the Continental terminal to the RER stop in CDG (No escalator UP) The hotel it self is located in on a quite street that parallel to the Sorbonne University, it's located in a great, safe area and happens to be a five minute walk to the Notre Dame and the Gaudren du Luxembourg which is a must see. There are shops and restaurants near by and of course their is metro stops near by to get anywhere. I found the restaurants near by where the best regarding the price and the quality and the taste of the food. You step in the lobby of the hotel and suddenly realize that your not in the typical hotel. It's colors are bright and vibrant and unique, not like some generic chain hotel. The staff speaks both English and French and will bare with your knowledge of high school level french. The "lift" has to be the most annoying thing about the hotel as you can only fit one person and a bag at time. We had four bags and i just gave up and carried them up the 4 flights of stairs. The room itself was very small compared to american sized rooms and even some European hotels, but was fine for only sleeping in. The room was well thought out by a designer if you could not tell, with great wallpaper and furnishings . As for the rest of the room, it has a iMac that doubles as a TV and Computer, brilliant idea. It was great for looking up reviews of places to eat and see in Paris as well as for checking facebook and email. As for worrying about your data, just restart the iMac and everything was wiped off using deepfreeze i think. It also offered free WIFI thats fast and has great coverage throughout the hotel. The bathroom was TINY, the shower was one of the smallest i had ever been in but it had good pressure and hot water and new towels every day even if you hung them up on the rack. (a minus in my book) After i think it over this has to be one of the better hotels i have ever been at so far, although it would be one of the best if it had free breakfast and cheeper rates. (i'm asking for too much)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SallyEnglish
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superbly located - only 3 minutes walk from the RER direct to Charles de Gaulle airport, on a quiet street and a short walk away from Notre Dame. It has - joy of joys in a French hotel - a lift, however, it is very 'petit' so make sure your deodorant is working and your breath is fresh in case you have to share! The staff all have very good English and are patient with those who choose to practise their rusty French. The decor is very modern - anyone who can't contemplate waking up to pink and black / turquoise and brown / lime green and black should perhaps look elsewhere for accommodation. I was offered a choice of room; overlooking the courtyard or the street. Street was quiet, courtyard was deserted. The rooms have comfortable beds, good wardrobe space, a safe, a telephone and a t.v./computer with free wireless in all rooms. There are no coffee/tea making facilities, but the tap water is potable and there are cafes just around a very close corner. The bathroom is replenished with soap, shower gel, shampoo daily and clean towels appear every day regardless of whether the used ones were hung up or thrown on the floor. As, minor, downsides; the heat in the reception area was unbearable - all the staff wear t-shirts and any guest wearing outdoor clothing was liable to suffocate in seconds. (Solution: go out and enjoy Paris instead of sitting in Reception.) The noise of other guests coming in late at night does carry a little - but it's nothing a pair of earplugs couldn't defend against. The rooms are TINY, definitely don't bring a cat to swing. My single room had a double bed and had I been there as a couple we would have had to ask for an oxygen tank I think. The bathroom is almost dolls house size and body origami comes in useful for using the loo without cracking a rib on the washbasin. The same in the shower - over-enthusiastic scrubbing of body parts could result in serious bruising. However, the water is plentiful and hot and cleans just as well as it would in a shower twice the size - and who goes to Paris to spend hours in the shower or to sit in their hotel room? Over all - it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location + lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: re67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location,nesteled in a side street so noise was minimal but within walking distance of the hustle+ bustle of St.Michel. Although the standard rooms are small(we upgraded to a bigger room) they are stylish,clean+ very servicable. The staff are the best thing about the hotel, Remi being particularly friendly+ helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Small and classy hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Ambrosiano
Reviews.Content: Just few steps from the Sorbonne University, this small hotel offers a nice design touch in every possible way. The rooms are not big, but this is just Paris so it can't be helped. The furniture is new and very nice. The combined TV and MacMini solution is a BIG plus as the Free Internet. The staff was nice, polite and helpful; the hotel faces a small street so it's pretty silent. Our room was close to the elevator, but no problem for noise. Thumbs up for the Hotel Design La Sorbonne!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, your choice in Paris, and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: ag00dtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Design de la Sorbonne for three nights in October. This is an excellent choice: cozy, well located, extremely clean, affordable, great staff, design roomsâ€¦.Here are some thoughts: - Location: the hotel is facing the Sorbonne University in a very quiet street. It is 5 minutes walking from Notre Dame and 3 minutes walking from Luxembourg train station, which is one of the main stops of the RER (the train which takes you to both airports). The street is very quiet and has a nice environment as in the morning there are many students from the university. - Rooms: we stayed in a Design Classic double. 113 euros / night. The room looks exactly as in the website. Our room was blue and brown, and had a big Mac screen which worked as a TV and computer. There is also wireless in the room. The room is not very big, but I would say it is fair enough. Big comfortable bed, closet, mirror, window overlooking the Sorbonne, night tables, desk, computerâ€¦The en-suite bathroom is extremely clean and a little bit small (but I think this is not a problem). I think the hotel was recently renovated as everything looks brand new and well cared of. - The hotel itself is very cozy, just exactly as in the website. There is a small patio at the entrance, a cafÃ© where you can have breakfast (although there are some nice cafes in the area), a photo exhibitionâ€¦ The staff was very friendly and helpful. - Environment: quiet and really well located. 5 minutes walk from Notre Dame, 3 minutes walk from Luxembourg train station, 3 minutes walk from Luxembourg gardens, 10 minutes walk from the Latin quarter and the Le Marais, where there are plenty of nice cafes and restaurantsâ€¦. In sum, I think this is an excellent choice, nice, cozy, friendly, affordable, clean and without doubt, the hotel I will stay in when I go back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: strat01
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small but the location and the friendly staff more than make up for it. The distance to the Luxembourg RER station is great if arriving from CDG airport (same line). Close enough to walk with suitcases. The free WiFi was great. As I had my own computer I didn't need to use the Mac .

Reviews.Title: “Hip design in lively convenient location if only a wee bit bigger...”
Reviews.Author: sarinees
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Design Sorbonne beginning of Oct 2009 for one night. I booked a room for single occupancy and I was given the room with lime & black theme (room no 31). I love the colour theme as it's fun & hip, bedding is in co-ordinating colour, and the bed & head board and the iMac table is fantastic piece - slightly boudouir but not too much (for me). The room overlooking to a courtyard, leading to a centre of research of INSEAD as well as prestigious apartment (I was fantasisingly living in paris apartment with unfinished wooden roof)... Anyway the downsides of the rooms are 1) shower room is SUPER tiny and the curtain failed my expectation as they decided to use a cheap super bland white clothes rather than a more chic option. 2) no mini bar (would have been nice to have at least one bottle of Perrier/ Evian) Having said that it is somewhat compromised by good spirit of hotel staff. I asked them directions to local restaurants & famour patisserie "Kayser", and they happily printed out maps and showed me directions. Would consider going back there next time in Paris only on a promotion price though - I wouldn't definitely pay for their rack rate price because of the said downsides.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: drisadds
Reviews.Content: To begin with the fact that they allowed me to have an earlier check in!! I arrived in Paris around 8 am...after almost 16 hours of traveling! The rooms are beautifull , CLEAN, modern, my room had a nice view of the Phanteon area and La Sorbonne, walking distance to good restaurants and cafes, museum and attractions. The breakfast is actually very good and the attention that they gave us was the best from all the rest of my trip! Thanks to Remi, Christie <Soma and Clement, they make our stay pleasant and help us with our tourist attractions arragments> Cant way to go back to Paris! Isabel (San Diego, CA)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bear025
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews i had read and was not disappointed. The hotel is in a great loaction and after walking around the city it was in a perfect location, down a quiet road but 1 minute away from a small square which then led on to a bustling road. This hotel made the whole weekend perfect, v friendly staff and really funky rooms!! Definitely going to be visting again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with character, great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: malaLondra
Reviews.Content: very nice, fresh and young hotel, in a great location ideal for business and leisure alike. doesn't offer the services of large international chains but staff is helpful, the hotel is clean and recently renovated and rooms despite being small are stylish. Good internate rates too, definetely a good stay under all aspects. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: SuziQ69
Reviews.Content: We booked attic room (there are only 2) no.62 - and it was worth paying extra as it was a beautiful room with views over the rooftops and a nice shower room. It was also private and really quiet. The reception staff were friendly and respected my desire to speak (and practice!) french. We didn't try the breakfast as we wanted to try the local cafes but the breakfast room looked really funky (in line with the rest of the hotel). The location was excellent & we walked almost everywhere, particularly to the St Germain & Latin Quarter areas for wandering around, eating and drinking.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it more than we did”
Reviews.Author: journeydog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights at Hotel Design de la Sorbonne on our second trip to Paris. It is a cute, small hotel and is spotlessly clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful and it was nice that the hotel was staffed 24/7. The room, a standard, was quite small but that didn't bother us. What did bother us was the miniscule bathroom which included a "half" sink and a shower that leaked all over the floor. The room was also very dark. Even with the curtains pulled back and the large window open, I had to use a small book light to read anything and locate items in my suitcase. It was very frustrating. The Mac in the room is especially nice although it could be a little twitchy at times. The breakfast room was lovely but we chose to eat out each morning so we cannot really comment on the breakfast itself. We would recommend Hotel Sorbonne for short stays only.

Reviews.Title: “The HOTEL to stay in on your visit to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: centennialamber
Reviews.Content: Although I have been to Paris many times before, it is a city I love and continue to visit. Wanting to try another hotel and area of Paris to stay in, seeing Hotel Design de la Sorbonne instantaneously confirmed that our choice was the correct one. The hotel is impeccably clean, stylishly designed, boutique and personal and centrally located. Arriving from the Eurostar, both Met stations are on the blue line direct from Gare du Nord and it is a short walk from there. The people at the hotel are polite and welcome you, saying hi as a friend but are also discreet and not overwhelming. The rooms are beautifully designed. Having the Apple Mac with unlimited internet access was fabulous. Having stayed in many Parisien hotels, this is the one that will be chosen to stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RR2035
Reviews.Content: My reviews are similar to other travelers. I loved this little hotel, the design was great, the location was very convenient for both walking and metro, especially when heading to the airport it was nice being so close to the Luxembourg RER line which runs to the airport. The hotel staff was super nice and helpful, making a great restaurant recommendation for my last night when my plans didn't work out. It was also nice knowing the desk was manned 24 hours a day. Also, I was traveling solo and felt safe both in the hotel in the surrounding area both during the day and night. Great Place!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish little hotel in the heart of the left bank. Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: familykidd
Reviews.Content: We've been to Paris before and love the Latin Quarter on the left bank - meandering little streets, lovely cafes and restaurants and much more chilled than the hectic wide roads of the Champs D'Elysee. We were delighted to find this lovely, stylish and well placed hotel right opposite the Sorbonne and less than two minutes walk from the RER (the direct train line from the airport). The hotel is beautifully styled , mixing modern colours and fabrics with lovely traditional patterns, photographs and all the original character of the building. We stayed in the attic in a gorgeous room with a view over the rooftops to the Eiffel Tower on one side and the Pantheon on the other. The room was quite small, as is the case with most hotels in Paris, but well designed and we loved the luxury of a bath in the bedroom. Notre Dame and the river were a ten minute walk away; the Pantheon and metro/RER a two minute walk away. Restaurants and bars within 30 seconds, but the street was quiet and so you had all the facilities on the doorstep without any of the noise. Service was excellent. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel - the weather was so nice, we picked up croissants and strolled to the lovely Luxembourg gardens, just a couple of minutes away. Had a lovely time - would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New-world hotel set in old-world France”
Reviews.Author: francophileBristol
Reviews.Content: Classic French architecture opposite world renowned Sorbonne University transformed by a modern, sophisticated interior with sharp colours and 21st century technology. Add to that the knowledgeable, professional - and multilingual - staff and you have the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing location, wish we could've stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Marillius9000
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 2 nights of our honeymoon here (and considering the hellhole we went to after, I wish we could've stayed). The hotel is beautifully decorated thoughout, with interesting art exhibitions on each floor, and clearly a lot of thought has gone into the look of this hotel. We were in Room 37, a lovely orange/red coloured room. The Mac computer in the room was brilliant, we could stream films in bed, listen to music, find the nearest veggie restaurants, so useful! Staff were friendly and efficient, and we were allowed to leave our baggage at the hotel for hours after we'd checked out. Location is amazing, with beautiful fountains of the Place de la Sorbonne literally 10 seconds walk around the corner. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Hotel in Excellent position”
Reviews.Author: filu77
Reviews.Content: very nice little room, furnished with design pieces and smart colours, very kind receptionist, well connected with major attractions of the city and airport

Reviews.Title: “a hotel with everything”
Reviews.Author: martito78
Reviews.Content: Friendly, polite and helpful staff. The room extremely clean and comfortable. The shower may be difficult for older patrons to negotiate as it was very small but, for us, it was perfect. Internet in room great for researching places to visit and eat. The room was air conditioned too, which was great as the weather was very hot! Great location- close to lots of great restaurants, cafes, shops, Metro stops, gardens, etc. Great view onto the street and over the opposing houses to the Pantheon. Great price considering the quality and location of the hotel (advanced booking with special cancellation conditions). Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie081
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Sorbonne exceeded our expectations of a Paris hotel. Although the room was a little small but it was made up by the other factors such as friendly, helpful staff, clean shower room, The imac in the room was also a brilliant idea. The lady who prepared breakfast was very nice...always had a smile on her face.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique chain of hotels”
Reviews.Author: Pookyal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Design de la Sorbonne, having stayed previously down the road in their sister hotel, L'hotel des Grandes Hommes at Place de la Pantheon. This was much newer I think, reflected in its more 'funky', brightly coloured interior design. Not for the faint hearted, the rooms and communal areas are pretty bold, as shown in my pics; only just on the right side of bearable if I'm honest. If you are looking for traditional, prob best to try their other hotels (think French toile)! Colour choices aside, the rooms are really well appointed in terms of technology and have a flat screen TV complete with the usual array of TV stations (only one English speaking though - BBC news) as well as CD, DVD, free internet and radio all incorporated into the one compact Apple Mac unit. That's no bad thing, cos the rooms are very small so they need all the space they can get! I know Paris hotels are renowned for small rooms, and to be honest, I am not that bothered about the bedroom size as I don't usually spend too long in it, but the shower room was almost impractical and there was no bath. We had booked a superior room and that was pretty dinky so I am not sure what the bedroom/WC size is like in the lower garded rooms. At the Grandes Hommes, the rooms were still quite small, but the bathroom was fully equipped and two of us could at least stand in it at any one time. That said it was all immaculately clean and I slept amazingly. Breakfast was included in our price and did the purpose, but if you are staying on a room early, I am not sure it is entirely worth the 8E or 12E as it is not a very extensive buffet (there is no buffet for the 8E option). All in all, would recommend this place if you are staying for a night or two in Paris, if only for cleanliness and location. But for any longer, the size of bathroom (and perhaps the colours?!) might drive you mad.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in August”
Reviews.Author: Davunger
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Design de la Sorbonne. The room was sunny and quiet, this being August, and the room was cheery if small. Having a computer with internet in our room was really convenient and helpful. The staff was extremely helpful and always willing to help us figure things out. The only caveat has nothing to do with the hotel and its location, in the heart of the Sorbonne area: Paris is depressingly quiet in August with many good restaurants closed. But the hotel was a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: TO-Gord
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I'd stayed at the Hotel de la Sorbonne ... the first was nearly two years ago before they'd done all the renovations. Now, it's got this funky new design with lots of chartreuse and amethyst colour themes and accessories, as well as beautiful limestone and porcelain bathrooms. Yes, the rooms are on the small side, but hey ... you're just sleeping in them, right? And you can't get a much better location in the heart of Paris, about a 10-minute walk from Notre Dame. Close to the Metro or the RER. And if you request a courtyard-facing room, you won't even know you're in the middle of a bustling international city. Very quiet! Friendly staff. And the new iMac-TV combos make it so easy to flip from watching the news to checking your e-mails ... all in the comfort of your own room. Great location, good value, plenty of local restaurants and local colour ... close to most central sites ... I'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A smart looking hotel with serviceminded staff and a super location.”
Reviews.Author: HakanUppsala
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel with rather small but really smart rooms. As the name says its all a design and it is well done. Breakfast is ok but not a great experience. They have very helpfull staff and the rooms are well cleaned every day. They unfortunately dont have any minibars at the rooms and they dont have an eviromental alternetive, such as that you can keep your towels for the entire stay but they change them all every day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: BabsyLondon
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel and fabulous location. Rooms small but perfectly formed with air con, computer for the kids and a lovely clean bathroom. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and stylish”
Reviews.Author: maz333
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! We made our decision to stay here based on the Tripadvisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. The room was a little small but that's Paris hotels for you. It was fantastic having the Mac in the room as we could access information on Paris, trains etc. Staff were extremely helpful and polite (unlike some of our other hotel experiences in Paris) and we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this little place!”
Reviews.Author: dartaboutg
Reviews.Content: We were traveling all over Europe, staying in all manner of places, and I was a little nervous about Paris knowing that you don't always get what you pay for. This hotel was more than what I expected -- the front desk was so great and accommodating. The room was so clean and put together -- loved the bed treatment. And located on a quiet street but still central to everything. And the rate was amazing (and we got an upgrade). We moved from here to Mama Shelter after two days, and I wished we would have stayed at the Sorbonne (did not like Mama Shelter). Did not like the iMac TV and radio interface in the room, but it seems a lot of hotels are going this way. Hope they all work out the bugs. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish hotel in an interesting location with great staff”
Reviews.Author: ads_m
Reviews.Content: A 30 minute train ride from Paris CDG airport takes you to Luxembourg station from which the Hotel Sorbonne is a short walk. It is tucked neatly away from the busy streets nearby and Notre Dame Cathedral and the Luxembourg Palace and Garden (Jardin Du Luxembourg) are a short walk away. Our room was compact but finished to a good standard with a nice powerful shower, and with a mac mini based entertainment system.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: JayFinland
Reviews.Content: This is a small, recently renovated hotel in a great location. We easily walked to Notre Dame, Les Halles, Pompidou Center and Louvre from the hotel. The hotel's breakfast was ok, just worth the price but nothing more. The other reviews describe the hotel quite accurately, so I won't go into more details. We stayed one night in room 12, which was located on the first floor facing the street. It was just big enough for two adults and our 1 year old baby. The street was quite small but had traffic (cars, motorcycles, pedestrians) almost 24 hours a day. The room's single glass window didn't keep the street noise away. We had requested a more quiet room when booking a few weeks beforehand, so in this respect the room was a disappointment. Would I stay again? Only if the hotel would guarantee a more quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel right by Place de la Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: akling80
Reviews.Content: This very beautifully decorated hotel is situeted in the Quartier Latin. It's only a short walking distance down to the Seine. Our room was on the 5th floor, no. 55 to be exact, and faced the back yard. That suited us perfectly - no noise at all from the street. The room wasn't very big, but big enough for me and my husband and to suitcases. It was clean and the shower was lovely. There was a Mac connected to the flat screen tv in every room. We did not try the hotel breakfast. We ate at the cafÃ©s at the Place de la Sorbonne, only 2 minutes from the hotel (and the same breakfast, only cheeper). We were happy to be so lucky with our choice of hotel for our first visit to Paris. Other tips for first timers in Paris: - Boattrips on the Seine -" Hop on and hop of" buses to get a the biggest sights - Get early to the Louvre to avoid ques all over the museum - Don't bother to try to get to the top of the Eiffel Tower. The lines are endless... We paid 11â‚¬ per. person to go to the roof of Tour Montparnasse. From there we had view of the entire Paris. The view of the Eiffel Tower was exceptional. We went up around 10.30 PM and at 11 PM the Eiffel Tower lit up by hundres of lights - beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Good, friendly and convenient choice!”
Reviews.Author: Lilla33
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were both visiting Paris for the first time and looked long and hard for a hotel that suited our needs. I think we made the right choice with Hotel de la Sorbonne. THE GOOD: The staff at the hotel were very polite and helpful. They answered all of our questions and sometimes with more detail and information than we requested. It was great having a Mac in the room with free Internet because it helped with last minute research and directions. The room had a unique, funky style. Location was great - so close to the Pantheon and Les Jardins Luxembourg, as well as the RER B line (Luxembourg station), which takes you right to Charles de Gaulle airport and connects to many of the Metro and RER lines that link you to major Paris sites. There is a delicious gelato place around the corner. We originally did not select the breakfast option but on Day 3, decided to eat breakfast at the hotel and found it filling and of good value. Convenient, as well. This is a non-smoking hotel :) THE ODD: The hotel has the smallest elevator that I have ever seen. My friend and I needed to take two trips to get to our room with our luggage. In order to turn on the room lights, one has to stick the room key into a special slot in the closet. Although our room had two twin beds, they were pushed right together so it was almost like sharing the same bed (in the hotel's defense, I noticed this layout in photos of other Paris hotels). My e-mail would not work when I selected Internet from the Mac menu - it would only work when I chose the At Work option from the menu. NOTE: As this is Paris, the keyboard is a French one. It takes some getting used to. I typed with two fingers the whole time. THE NOT-AS-GOOD (BUT CERTAINLY NOT HORRIBLE): We arrived about an hour early and room was, understandbly, not ready. We were told to come back in half an hour. We returned hour (decided to go to the Pantheon) and room still was not ready and had to wait an extra 15 minutes. Wonderful lady at the front desk (whose name I forgot to ask), offered us coffee and juice while we waited. Pillow was too high and stiff for my liking. Phone connection, at least for long distance calls, was a bit too crackly. Only one soap and one shower gel was provided upon arrival, even though this was a room for two people.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: travel_reviewer01
Reviews.Content: The design aspect and location next to the Sorbonne in the Latin Quarter are central elements so if you're kind of artistic and like a mix of old-fashioned French/modern art then you'll love it here. It's also totally clean and the staff are nice and help with any questions or problems, and the computer/internet/tv in the room is very useful. On the other hand the rooms/lift are quite small so maybe not for you if pure functionality is what you're after or if you're looking to stay on a generalistic tourist trail. Personally I thought it was great and would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “stylish and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: spvztb
Reviews.Content: Small but stylish and comfortable rooms. Nice staff (patient with my poor french). Wifi reception in room was weak. (fine for email, too slow for skype). I didn't see how to connect directly to the ethernet or turn on the computer in the room (but didn't try too hard or ask for help).

Reviews.Title: “loved, loved, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tmotj
Reviews.Content: I was so happy with this hotel! The location is **fantastic**, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the design is just very cool and true to the photos online. I had an "economy" room and it was 110 euro/night averaged over several nights. I was exceedingly happy with this. It is true that the economy rooms are not huge, and the bathroom is a bit cramped, but this is Paris folks! If you want a big huge room in such an amazing location at a boutique hotel you have to get out your Eurocard and shell out some serious cash! I am 5'8" and my husband is 6' and while we had some funny moments because of the small size, we were both very happy with the hotel. The value for the location, cleanliness, and charm seems really perfect. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The staff were also very helpful and always present at the front desk. They respond quickly to requests and are just really on-the-ball. Most of the reviews I read of this hotel were similarly sparkling so I am happy to add my experiences to that crowd. Regarding some other reviews I have seen on tripadvisor: I don't know about the courtyard noise --- I did not hear any so the renovation must be over or in hiatus currently. The bedbug complaint that was written here freaked me out so I inspected the hotel room thoroughly and this claim is not validated --- larvae are visible to the naked eye. The room we stayed in was meticulously kept. I stayed a week and neither myself nor my husband got bites and it's been a week and we've seen nothing. The author of that review does not seem to have picked up the bedbugs at this hotel. Stay here if you want a boutique hotel experience at a reasonable price in one of the very best spots in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: CDDKCph
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Design de la Sorbonne for 3 nights late june 2009 and it will definitely not be the last time. Being a frequent traveller I normally stay at the bigger hotel chains so I have not much experience with these "smaller" places but I was very pleasently surpriced. The staff was very friendly and it was clean that they really liked worked at the hotel. They were always smiling and ready to help with event the smallest request. Hotel Design de la Sorbonne is located within walking distance to Louvre and Notre Dame as well as a metro station. The Place de la Sorbonne square 100 meters away is very nice and has some goodt restaurents. A small super market is approc. 200 meters away. The hotel was recently renovated and completely refurbished is a style that especially my girlfriend really liked. A cool touch was the Mac media center in the room that also offered free internet access. The room was somewhat small even though we were upgraded to a deluxe room but I guess that is normal for Paris. Overall it was a great stay and I can't wait untill the next time I get a chance to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Tries hard but gorgeous nonetheless”
Reviews.Author: nakedcowgirl
Reviews.Content: So cutting edge it bleeds. Not to everyone's taste, but I thought it was gorgeous. Rooms are small, but you are in the middle of the Latin quarter. Small, but clean and comfortable. I use a Mac, so love the use of an iMac for TV, internet and DVD player. Great location, quiet rooms, staff couldn't have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, lovely area, great staff”
Reviews.Author: PistolPete75
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and sized rooms for Paris, off the main street and rooms come with free internet via the TV. Even better was going for lunch just round the corner, and Bono walking in and sitting near us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ski83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for six nights in May 2009. I found the staff to be very nice and very helpful. The hotel is very clean and my room was comfy. I stayed in room 15 at the end of the hall on the second floor. My room looked out over the courtyard that is still undergoing some construction. I'm sure the courtyard view will be lovely when finished. The decor is modern with a funky vibe and the pics that are posted by the hotel are accurate. The location is great, there are tons of restaurants and cinemas close by and you can walk to most of the major sights. I loked having a mac in my room with internet access. My only complaint is that I wish they would add another english tv channel. The only english language tv is BBC world news and CNBC...ugh. I plan on returning to Paris soon and will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “So pleased we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: thegoodwitch
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in one of the deluxe rooms on the 5th floor overlooking the Sorbonne with a view of the Pantheon. The room was immaculate. It felt like we were the first people to stay there. It was small but had everything we needed. The bed was comfortable, there was enough storage and the bathroom had a tub and shower. I loved the Mac. It was really handy to be able to surf the web and look at what we were going to do next day, pick places to eat and so on. I hadn't used a Mac before but it was dead easy and worked really well. I had heard this hotel could be noisy but we weren't disturbed at all and I'm a light sleeper. There was some street noise from about 8am but we were up well before this. The lift was out of order the whole time we were there. It was a bit of a drag but we're reasonably fit. I wouldn't have been happy if I was elderly or disabled, however. The air conditioning hadn't been switched on at the time of our visit but the room temperature was ok. I believe it was due to go on in the next few days. We didn't eat breakfast here so can't comment on the food. The location of this hotel was perfect for seeing central Paris. It was a short stroll from Notre Dame and very close to the Luxembourg Gardens- a lovely place to relax. I thought the price was fair - we booked directly with the hotel online. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, stylish, affordable”
Reviews.Author: Gingermegs79
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of our trip to France, never having been to Paris before. We had a room on the 5th floor with a view to the Panthenon, which was lovely. It was nice and quiet for our stay. We were prepared for the room to be small, but it was fine for us (my husband is 6'3"). We could walk around the bed but it was cosy. The room was stylish and very clean. The only issue we had was the bathroom screen didn't really do the job and the floor got soaked with every shower, but not a major problem. We would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: twoonie
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hotel de la sorbonne for part of our honeymoon in may. the kind staff gave us a room on the fourth floor overlooking the courtyard. the room was fantastic - not huge, but comfortable, stylish and very clean. the hotel is in a great central location and we walked most days to any sites we wanted to visit. the metro is a short walk away. the elevator wasn't working for the first two days of our visit, but it wasn't a huge inconvenience as the staff assisted us with getting our luggage up the winding stairs. when the elevator was working again we couldn't resist using it - it is tiny! the breakfast room was charming and the best value in the city. we had breakfast at the hotel only twice, but i would recommend it as a great start to the day. when we are back in paris we will be sure to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “central location, friendly staff and authentic”
Reviews.Author: stchad
Reviews.Content: Liked staying at the Sorbonne again--I have been a few times over almost 20 years. Very helpful staff on reception and in the breakfast room. One suggestion--more soap in bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: writertype777
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a decent stay at this hotel in March -- the room was small, but well designed. The location was fantastic, although there was construction all the time. The big downside appeared about a month and a half later -- bedbugs! I don't say this lightly -- but since my friend and I couldn't have picked them up anywhere else, I feel it's necessary to advise accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Just as remembered but better.”
Reviews.Author: NZtraveller08
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel with the advantages of comfort, the very best location, helpful welcoming and friendly staff, and quality breakfast and service. This hotel has been refurbished in recent time and the decor is very impressive giving it a real feeling of an upmarket boutique hotel. The hotel had been recommended by family who had recently visited Paris and after we booked we discovered that, by chance, it was the same hotel we had stayed in on our last visit to Paris 27 years earlier. Our memory of that time was one of a small budget hotel with welcoming and very helpful staff and we are pleased to note this is still part of its character today. An added bonus is the hotel's commitment to art photography and we spend time enjoying the exhibited pieces in the hotel. There is no better location for a hotel. We enjoyed easy walking access to all the sites in Paris. Although centrally located the hotel is in a lovely quiet street with the bonus of easy access to some good local regional truly french and inexpensive cuisine - which is one of our passions. We were also pleased to find that access to the airport was very cheap and easy as the meter line that takes you to Orly or CDG is one block away at Luxemburg station - less than a two minute walk. All in all, this hotel is a must on the list of small boutique hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: KathrynandSteven
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took a weekend break to Paris to watch some tennis at Roland Garros. We decided to take a risk and save some money on a hotel room. Usually we try to stay at 4 star hotels but because of the tennis hotel rates were increased. This hotel is only 2 star, but it was fantastic. It was clean, bright, average size for a hotel room in Paris, the bathroom was small but did the job. Usually I am a room service junkie and I LOVE hotel bars, this hotel had neither, but I didnt miss them much. There was no ice machine or ice available to us, that was disappointing, but the really nice desk clerck offered to put our wine in thier fridge. Anytime we came up with an issue, either the kind staff or amazing location made up for it. Plus the imac in the room!!! WOW. We loved no having to tote our laptop with us. I would definatly recommend this hotel to any of our friends who are looking to stay in a great location for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, great location and warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: mirabelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my 5-year-old daughter, with a friend who brought her 5-year-old as well. Although the hotel doesn't particularly cater to children, we really enjoyed our stay and felt very welcome. They even arranged for a babysitter. Our rooms were of decent size, with two single beds pushed together to make a double. Very cool design in the rooms. It's so centrally located, near the Luxembourg Gardens and walkable to Notre Dame, the Marais, even the 1st with the Louvre. We walked everywhere and had breakfast every morning in a square half a block toward the Seine, where the children could run around and we could have coffee and croissants. I would definitely return to the hotel, but most likely come with a partner rather than a child, as the setting is quite sexy. The Macs in the room were great for browsing, watching TV and DVDs, although we had a problem with DVDs getting stuck and having to restart the machines to get them to eject. Clean, affordable, well-located and friendly. Very nice indeed.

Reviews.Title: “way better than the next hotel i stayed at, which cost double”
Reviews.Author: joeyagain
Reviews.Content: this was a great hotel for the money. the location is perfect for paris, you really can't do much better. close to food, museums, the seine, everything. and very close to jardin du luxembourg, which is an amazing spot to sit and drink a coffee, especially early in the morning. the rooms are small, but organized so that i felt i had more room than in large hotel rooms--i am specifically talking about the bathroom here. though, the shower is small, if you are of a rounder figure, it's going to be a tight fit! that said, the design was great, the reception was great, and i wish i stayed longer.....

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Cazza21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and could not fault it at all. The hotel is beatifully decorated and the staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough to help. Our room was on the fourth floor and, whilst being on the small side, was scrupulously clean, well laid out and decorated to a high standard. Our room was cleaned daily and clean towels left. The shower was a really good size and very powerful. We did missed tea and coffee making facilities in the room and the lift was tiny, but these are just minor niggles and did not spoil our stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “Bijou-What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: 60spink
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel de la Sorbonne for one week. I had the prettiest single room. It was room 42 and overlooked the Sorbonne-a beautiful view! The room is perfect for a solo traveler. The room is nicely designed and perfectly appointed- I had a very comfortable queen-size bed, side tables, desk and full length mirror. The closet is tucked in an alcove and I had enough space to hang my shirts and fold my pants and skirts as well as tuck away my suitcase and carry on. The bathroom is small but ample for my needs. The shower had great water pressure and tons of hot water. The hotel is set on a quiet street- I slept with the window open and although I sometimes use earplugs because I am a very light sleeper, I slept soundly every night. You may ocassionally hear people talking as they walk down the street . Traffic noise is very minimal. The staff is very nice and friendly. When I arrived (on a Saturday) the lift was not working. Before I even realized what was happening, one staff member took my luggage up the stairs to my room while I finished checking in. I offered to tip him for his troubles and he kindly refused as he said that it was because the lift was not working. As I understand, they were waiting on a part and it was fixed by Tuesday. Every day as I left and came in, I was always greeted with a friendly smile! This is the second time I have stayed at a Hotels Rive Gauche hotel (the first being the Hotel du Pantheon in May 2008). I am impressed with the quality of product they deliver and the friendly caring staff-from the front desk to the housekeepers-everyone always greets you and I don't think there is anything that they wouldn't do if you asked.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully furnished rooms, friendly staff, and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tdriver2008
Reviews.Content: The decor and furnishings really are as super as they look on the hotel's website! The 'Classic' rooms are pretty small, but they do have everything you could want, including an I-Mac with free unlimited access to the internet, which was very useful for checking out the details of local restaurants. The only things possibly lacking were: a safe in the room, and some coathooks on the back of the door to hang up outerwear to keep it from cluttering up the room (even more so in the colder months!) The staff were exceptionally friendly and efficient, and the standards of cleaning of the rooms and public areas were very high. The breakfast was 9 Euros each, but there was a good selection, and worth it for a tranquil start to the day in the well-run breakfast room. As for the location, our room overlooked a fairly quiet small street. It was handy for getting the bus back to after a day of sightseeing as the buses ran down the nearby main roads. We would definitely choose this hotel again when we go to Paris, but would most likely consider upgrading the room to gain a little more space.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mimipink
Reviews.Content: We are staying at this physically lovely and perfectly located hotel right now. The room is very small, but we understand this is typical, and do not have a complaint about that. The room is charming and well appointed and very stylish. What has been disappointing, however, is this: there is a major remodeling project underway in the rooms in the courtyard, which our room overlooks, and starting at 8:30 am there is a very loud racket going on all day until 6 pm or so. At night the courtyard is very noisy - you can hear every sound from the people who live (the hotel shares the courtyard with apartments - about 30 units look out onto this very tiny courtyard) on and/ who enter the courtyard. We were only able to get a few hours of sleep - hard to enjoy the vacation while being exhausted. In addition, the elevator was broken when we arrived ( it had been broken for 2 weeks) and we were on the 5th floor - a long way to haul your luggage and to ascend each time you return. We believe the hotel should notify guests before they arrive, via email, that the hotel is undergoing construction and that the elevator does not work to remove any unpleasant surprises. One great amenity is the in-room IMAC and free internet - this is a wonderful thing to have in the room and we really used and enjoyed it. If you are looking for a quiet refuge in the midst of bustling Paris - don't stay here. The manager will no doubt reply that the remodeling is over now and that the courtyard is really quiet at night (like he told us)- but I recommend that you really check this out yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephanie1913
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel, in an excellent location. The customer service was excellent. Staff always greeted me with a smile. The decor is very chic. I enjoyed the nice hot shower at the end of a long day. The housekeeping staff is superb! My room was spotless each day. I booked the room online at a great rate. There were a few disappointments though. We spent most of the day sightseeing. We would get in very late. It was frustrating dealing with the very loud construction noise early in the morning, that made it impossible to wake at your leisure. I don't know if it was just our room, but it seemed that the noise was directly outside our window. I am sure that the renovations will be great once it is complete. I enjoyed my stay, but probably would have stayed elsewhere had I known I'd have to listen to construction workers in the morning! I also chose the hotel based on the iMac and internet access. I had a very important project due, that required internet access. The Wi-Fi in my room worked very sporadically, if at all. There was a very kind gentleman at the desk that tried to help; but he was unsuccessful in getting it to work. He offered me the use of the lobby's computer. It was frustrating because I didn't expect to have to keep going down to the lobby. I think this was just a problem in my room because others seemed please with their connection. The rooms are very small, but cozy. The hotel is easily accessible by train. Do yourself a favor and let the staff arrange for an airport shuttle, if you decide not to take the train. A taxi from the hotel to CDG is way too expensive. Each member of the staff that I encountered was pleasant and professional. I have to mention that Gaspard made our stay extremely memorable. He answered all of our questions with a smile. He went out of his way to help me resolve the issues with the Wi-Fi. I live in Houston; and each night he would let me know how the Houston Rockets fared in their game. He even helped me with my French before heading out for sightseeing. I wish every hotel had someone like that working at the desk! I can't imagine why this hotel is not ranked much higher on this site. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissAdventure
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel de la Sorbonne for two nights with my mother for a weekend away. The room was lovely-much like the photos I had seen on their website. We stayed in a superior double and it had adequate space and a nice shower. It was overlooking a courtyard although there is construction going on at the moment so we could see mainly scaffolding. We didn't have breakfast there so unable to comment on that but overall was a lovely place to stay and quite a good location for exploring around; metro stop, shops, and places to eat all easily accesible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Style, but Outrageously Small”
Reviews.Author: Foodie26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night last week and first, the good things about the place... --This hotel is in a GREAT location in the Latin Quarter, right across the street from the beautiful and famous Sorbonne. Within just a few minutes by foot you can find yourself at the Parthenon, the Palace of Justice, or any quaint Paris cafe. If you're looking for a great location, this hotel will do it for you. --In addition, the style and decoration of the hotel is very hip and the rooms are stylish so I promise it's definitely not a blase sort of hotel. Okay, now the drawbacks... --We stayed in the most basic room--I think it's called the Classic Deluxe--and paid what I understood was the deeply discounted rate of 125 Euros--the listing price for the basic rate in the room was 289 Euros. Now, I know that Paris hotels are expensive and I know that Parisian hotel rooms are small and not "American sized," but this tiny room was RIDICULOUS. You guys, the size of this hotel room is ABSURD. The bathroom was no bigger than a broom closet, and if you were brushing your teeth if you didn't watch out you'd whack your head on the glass shelf that jutted out. The floor was so small that if you sat on the edge of the bed you could use the computer at the work desk. If there are two people in the room who need to pass by each other one person will have to hop on the bed so the other person can pass. I understand that this hotel was recently remodeled, and I don't understand why they didn't combine some of the rooms--they are that small. I don't expect to get a mansion for a hotel room in Paris so don't think I'm one of these people to expect everything to be American-sized. Things are small in Europe. I get it. But this was to the point of discomfort. I don't know if it's because I'm 5'10" and my hubby is 6'2", but I can't even imagine petite people being comfortable in that room either. And I couldn't imagine somebody paying the full price for that standard room. I think you'll be better off getting a hotel not in the city center where you'd pay a fraction of the price and the value would be much better.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful boutique style hotel that is very enjoyable to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: pixelglitter
Reviews.Content: This a great little hotel, beautiful designed, in a great area very close to the latin quarters with great food nearby. Loved the apple/mac entertainment system with internet access. Got a great rate reserving online!

Reviews.Title: “Good city base, clean and stylish”
Reviews.Author: sleepdeprived1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to stay over a bank holiday and wasn't disappointed. It's a very stylish (for Paris!) hotel with fairly young and (it likes to think) funky decor. The rooms are titchy but perfectly fine - ditto the bathrooms. The whole place has been recently refurbished and it is in perfect condition. Each room has an Apple computer to watch TV/check the internet etc, which is different and useful. The staff were very helpful and the prices for coffee etc very reasonable. I didn't try the breakfast as we booked a room only rate and chose to eat out instead. Our room was pretty noisy. The hotel is based opposite the university and we were rather plagued with students drunkenly singing and shouting just outside the window all night. The rooms were very hot and the air-con didn't work (although we didn't bother to ask for it to be fixed, to be fair) so the window had to stay open for fresh air. With the window closed, the noise was at a more acceptable volume.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Jimbob1983
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from three nights at the Hotel de la Sorbonne and was thoroughly impressed with my experience from start to finish. Having read reviews of the hotel I was not disappointed; a chic, boutique operation in a great location with excellent and friendly staff. We were upgraded without charge upon arrival, and the room was great. The bathroom was a touch on the small side but this was as expected and it was nevertheless perfectly formed. The iMac is a great touch and means you can do last minute research without having to go to an internet cafe or similar. I would definitely stay here if I visited Paris again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GillbertTsai
Reviews.Content: A great location to travel by foot to enjoy the Paris beauty

Reviews.Title: “Very agreeable stay at Hotel de la Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: Therealbigapple
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and me stayed in La Sorbonne for 2 nights this Easter holiday. I read some reviews of this hotel in advance and they surely helped me to make my descision. I must say that all my expectations were met. The staff was very friendly, the room (44, a design deluxe room) was amazingly beautiful with a very big bathroom. Everything was brand new. I had asked for a large bed because I'm very tall and they had promised me to take care of that by placing two single beds together. I was very happy to discover that they had remembered this promise. A possible downside is the size of the elevator, which was hilariously tiny. Just big enough for two people, and with a little squeezing, some luggage as well. I suggest you use it for your luggage and use the stairs (unless you are physically unable). Other small problem we had: the imac in our room would sometimes behave a little awkward (e.g. not responding anymore, showing a black screen, or refusing to let us watch BBC world and some other news channels). To end in a positive way: I would almost forget to mention the excellent location of this hotel, with a view on the Sorbonne university. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - Friendly Staff - Would stay back there in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: AmosLee
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite tied from a very lengthy flight and straight away we knew we would enjoy our stay. The foyer is beutifully designed and we were greated with a smile. It was our honeymoon and as soon as they knew they upgraded us - we were so pleased and grateful. Our room opened out to a typical paris street, the bed was confortable and as the website stated, the room had a MAC. It also had free wireless internet. The location was perfect. We walked accross the river to the Louve in a short amount of time (coffee stops on the way of course) and we would go back in a heartbeat. Recommened to lovers of design hotels and boutique hotels - this is not a big chain - it is a small hotel with a focus on design!!

Reviews.Title: “Completely renovated and welcoming 2 star that feels like 3+ stars”
Reviews.Author: CityMouseTelAviv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel de la Sorbonne during several trips to Paris in my 20s (10 years ago). Learning that it was completely renovated, I decided to try it again, and wasn not disappointed. The staff is friendly and welcoming, the new decor is charming, location is great and the personal I-mac in each room is a real treat. The hotel delivers much more than a 2 star, and apart from a tiny lobby and no mini-bar, I see no reason why it wasn't rated 3 star. The hotel belongs to the group of Paris Rive Gauche hotels, which are all charming. Highly reccomended for singles, or couples for a short stay (I was there for a weekend). May be slightly clastrophobic for 2 people on a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Such a cute and convenient hotel with a great staff!”
Reviews.Author: TheMirrors
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Sorbonne's location in the Latin Quarter near the University is excellent and is surrounded by great restaurants and cafes. The train access if very convenient, but we were able to walk to many of Paris' tourist sites. The decor of the Hotel is innovative and chic. Every room has an iMac, which provided to be very useful to briefly check in with family and friends while away. For a room in Paris, the size was very comparable to other hotels. Some people might find the bathroom a little small (but VERY typical of a the hotel bathrooms throughout France and Spain) and the walls a little thin, but for the price, this hotel is a steal. However, the best part was the staff (although I am very biased towards the decor also), which was always ready to help with a friendly smile. They made Paris a very welcoming city!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous French Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrangeSun2
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our experience at Hotel De La Sorbonne. It was clean, and rennovated with contemporary fresh colors of magenta, gold, black, silver and lime green. The front desk and cleaning staff were outstanding...helpful, nice, and always said "Bon Jour" with a smile. The rooms are comfortable, and small like most hotels in Europe. The furniture was well portioned for the room. The room has a computer MAC with TV streamed via the computer. The location was outstanding...it was a safe area, with mature students and Parisians strolling the streets. Not over run with tasteless tourist which we loved! We wish you the "best of Paris" as we enjoyed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique style hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: FWV400
Reviews.Content: Not knowing Paris at all, we booked the hotel for its smart web site and good location and as we were bringing our friends from New Zealand we were keen to ensure they had a good stay. We were not disappointed. The staff were incredibly helpful and there was a good restaurant 'L'ecritoire' nearby, which was recommended by the hotel. Best points were the decor and location of the hotel. The room was bijou, which we understand that this is the norm for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Some language Problems”
Reviews.Author: SpainLolita
Reviews.Content: We would have liked that the waiteresses had also spoken some of English, it was a bit difficult for us to communicate with them. We also had some problems with the shower, while having a shower the water was poured under the glass door all over the floor in the bath room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, beautiful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: katzilie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in the heart of latin quarter. The rooms are very beautiful and very comfortable for parisian standards. The staff at the reception is very friendly and will try to help you in any way they can. The hotel is clean, and the decoration is very beautiful. i would recommend this hotel to everyone going to paris, i am sure they will love it. I would stay again in my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: lafro22
Reviews.Content: i would like to thank the young lady that worked at the reception desk. she was very helpful and always had a smile on her face! Thank you for a pleasant stay ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - My number 1 in Paris”
Reviews.Author: nicn1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a great trip to Paris. The fact we stayed in this hotel made it all the better. The staff are so helpful and friendly, the location is brilliant and the rooms are fantastic (roomy for Paris, plush small bathroom and great iMac). The pictures of the contemporary quirky decor do not do it justice it has to be seen to be believed, from the vibrant coloured tactile wall fabric to the classic contemporary furniture it is a must for all boutique hotel fans. It is a short walk in the evening to the bustling lively area of the Latin Quarter. There are loads of bars and restaurants which are reasonably priced you cannot fail to find one you like. If you like Jazz and live music the Cavern des Oubliettes on Rue Galande is fun, you have to go to the back of the bar and head down the old dungeon steps for the stage area itâ€™s a tight squeeze but that just adds to the atmosphere. On our stagger home our final stop was just around the corner from the Hotel Sorbonne in a great cafe called â€˜tabac Sorbonneâ€™ (I think! it was late and lots of vin rouge had been consumed), it was the best priced wine and coffee we had all weekend and the menu looked good. For breakfast we strolled to rue Soufflot which leads to the Pantheon and had more great coffee, juice and croissants for 6.50 Euros. We hadnâ€™t been to Paris for about 3 years but we noticed how expensive everything has got yet, I can happily say you could not get better value for money in a great area then the Hotel Sorbonne.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with all the trimmings”
Reviews.Author: Riczero
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sorbonne's main feature is it's wonderful location; right opposite the Sorbonne and bang in the heart of the Latin quarter and right next to the parc du Luxembourg. However it also manages to keep an above average classic styling maintained throughout. Unintrusive staff and Fantastic decor give it a real effortless chic quality, Good quality comfy beds and mind melting power shower mean that when you do return to the room after a day around Paris you feel very comfortable. The hotel also managed to recommend two excellent restaurants, both of which were reasonably priced and exceptional quality. Some renovations were taking place during our stay but we were never bothered by them in the slightest. A fine hotel but my advice would be to skip the over priced breakfast and scuffle around the corner to one of the patissieries instead.

Reviews.Title: “loved the sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: EustaciaVye
Reviews.Content: I must say I am rather upset to hear that the hotel has been renovated. It was just the most darling little hotel. I stayed their with my mother and we loved it so much. I don't know if I will return now, because I might be too sad. Some of the rooms look a little flashy. The breakfasts were divine! Hopefully the menu is still the same.

Reviews.Title: “My Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: tea_thyme
Reviews.Content: This has been "my hotel" in Paris for several years. The rooms are large by Paris standards and the closets and bathrooms are big enough. I've not been there since the recent upgrading but I'm anxious to return. I love the quiet location at the front door of the Sorbonne, and near lots of metro stops and Luxembourg gardens.

Reviews.Title: “A real Jewell in the City Light”
Reviews.Author: EmmanuelFajer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Really stylish, cozy and confortable. The Location is unbeatable and the staff is really friendly and efficient. The breakfasts are great true. If you can get one of their Specials in their website its an absolute bargain. This hotel made it to my list of favourites without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmmccomb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de la Sorbonne in early January. The room was very trendy and well maintained. Although the bathroom was small, it served its purpose well and was very modern. The in-room Mac was very useful and the staff was amazing at recommending local restaurants and the best way to get around Paris. The only complaint would be that scaffolding was just outside our window. The hindrance being the workers climbing up each morning . . . that was a bit annoying around 8:30am everyday. Other than that, it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, very friendly and helpful staff, boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Catherine74Dublin
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay of 4 nights in Hotel de la Sorbonne. Fantastic location beside St. Germaine des Pres. Lovely rooms , a little small, but very clean and well decorated. Mostly decorated in Designer Guild materials and as we are interior decorators we were extremely impressed We spoke to Designer Guild in London and their Agent says she will be staying there next time she goes to Paris - we gave her your details. We have already recommended it to our friends and family who are staying there this weekend. Very good value for money. We were there with our daughter and husband who have also recommended it to their friends. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable design hotel”
Reviews.Author: elli_vienna
Reviews.Content: Great location in a silent street off of St. Michel Boulevard, near RER B and the metro, very friendly staff (all of them), beautiful rooms. I never trust the pictures of rooms - usually everything is smaller and more run-down, so i tuned down my expectations. Especially knowing that all hotel rooms in Paris are a size of some bathrooms at home. We had a superior room on fourth floor, number 44 - it was larger, facing the street and had enough light during the day; we didn't feel claustrophobic. It was always clean and looked completely new! The bathroom was impeccable, the mac with tv and free internet extremely practical, and the bed very comfortable. The pillows could be a little softer for my taste, but they are probably healthier the way they are now. The staff spoke english and always helped with printing out maps and routes to get around. Regarding the price - if you're used to Paris-prices, this should be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Work in progress..”
Reviews.Author: redearthbluesky
Reviews.Content: I loved this little boutique hotel. The staff & service were excellent, the position perfect, the details spot on. Its still in the process of being renovated, which makes it a little noisy, but its easy to see the butterfly its turning into, & i look forward to seeing it finished, & visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “You have to try it!”
Reviews.Author: pepik
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to be, in the middle of Paris. You get your own Mac, pretty cool. I booked a single room which was cute - but can't tell how family rooms are like, if any.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hideaway hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: MiffyBunny
Reviews.Content: when thinking of paris..your mind is instantly filled with images of beauty, romance and intricate design..and this hotel does not disappoint. in a small side street near the university in the city's vibrant and busy latin quarter sits hotel de la sorbonne. from the moment you walk through the front door you are greeted with a warm atmosphere and friendly staff. The decor is of a designer style with bright contempory colours which add to the boutique and exclusive feel of this hotel. the room was cozy, warm and very clean. The bathroom was small but well equipped and had all the necessities...hot shower, toilet, sink and hairdryer. the bed was a good size and was very comfortable. The decor is fresh new and contempory...our room was a stunning pink and gold..beautiful and truly romantic. Each room has an apple computer as standard which provides free internet access, ideal for checking emails and for researching places to go and things to do in paris, as well as providing access to television channels should you need them. the area in which the hotel is situated just a short walk away from many shops and restaurants; however, is just far enough away to be peaceful and relaxing if your heart desires and is ideal for couples or friends on a short break together. it is also ideal for singles as the area felt very safe. this is a charming little boutique hotel and when we return to paris we will be booking this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in the Latin Quarters”
Reviews.Author: StockholmAnzo
Reviews.Content: Warm and cosy hotel with tasteful modern interior decaration. Every room has an iMac which you also use as tv. Breakfast is of international type with yoghurt, eggs, toasts, croissants, ham, cheese, marmelade etc. Hotell is located Wall-to-wall with Sorbonne university, and with only two minutes walk to Place Saint-Michel / Metro. The latin quarters are full of price-worthy restaurants, cafÃ©s and brasseries! I strongly recommend Brasserie Balzar. Only a minute walk from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: VBDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de la Sorbonne for four nights over New Year and were delighted with the location and the standard of this hotel - while it is without doubt small, it is beautifully designed and decorated and has every amenity you would need for a city break. The service was excellent and each member of staff was very friendly and helpful on every occasion. The location is perfect for setting off on a walking tour each day and there are plenty of cafes/restaurants nearby. The shuttle service from the hotel to the airport on our departure date was also great as were the umbrellas provided at reception on the very rainy Tuesday morning! I would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Paris at any time of the year! VB Dublin

Reviews.Title: “A Warm and Inviting Stay”
Reviews.Author: amyjemesouviens
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Sorbonne was exquisite! It was warm, cozy, and friendly. It was like a precious dollhouse! Breakfast was delightful each day, with breads, juices, cheeses, yogurts, eggs, coffee, cereals, and more! The style of the hotel was charming and the service was impeccable! I didn't want to leave! Most definitely, I shall return and recommend this hotel as also the location was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve at a good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: somensato
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend had a wonderful time at Hotel de la Sorbonne. The location and neighborhood are really great, the service as well. The decoration is beautiful, despite our room was too small and the toilet too cold. A heating at the toilet would be a good improve.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with first class service”
Reviews.Author: superpilgrim
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel de la Sorbonne just after Christmas this year and were delighted with the whole experience. The hotel staff were excellent and extremely helpful. The rooms we stayed in were beautifully decorated, clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a quiet location and yet extremely close to the central area of Paris. I would definitely recommend the hotel and would make it my first choice for future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moneypenny28
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find fault with this sweet wee hotel next to the Sorbonne. It's reasonably priced, the rooms are modern & "boutique hotel". Email & web are free (great for checking out where to eat etc). Staff were friendly. Only tiny little quibble (and it is tiny) is that the bathrooms are not heated. And when it's minus 5 outside, it would have been nice. But that's it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de la Sorbonne”
Reviews.Content: My entire experience with Hotel de la Sorbonne was positive from the beginning to end. I received quick, courteous, and helpful responses to my inquiries before and after making my reservation directly through the hotel. The front desk staff, both day and night, were attentive and professional. The cleaning staff was thorough and respectful. The room, possibly on the small side for the typical American traveler, was comfortable, clean and well appointed. The inclusion of an iMac in the room as a television, radio, and Internet provider was a most appreciated and inspired amenity. The hotel is located in a lovely courtyard on a quiet street just off the Blvd. St. Michel with convenient access to two metro/RER stations. There are nice restaurants in the neighborhood such as Le Rostand, Monoprix (a grocery store), ATM's, and lots of shopping. The proximity to the Luxembourg Gardens is a huge plus. I enjoyed my stay at Hotel de la Sorbonne and would recommend it as a safe, comfortable, hotel with reasonable rates and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip yet cozy”
Reviews.Author: BrandingMichelle
Reviews.Content: The only downfall I found at this little boutique hotel was the limited space within the rooms. However, this is not uncommon for Paris and did not present any problems during my stay. Other than that, the hotel was beautifully unique inside and the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was excellent and we were able to walk to many tourist spots as well as cruise along quaint avenues nearby. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “De La Sorbonne - didn't quite do it”
Reviews.Author: Bevcarriage
Reviews.Content: Place de la Sorbonne is a great location - plenty of left bank atmos, a couple of very good bars on the square itself, transport links easy, shops and Bvd St Germain so close too. My room was a peculiar shade of apple green with lots of black detail - not attractive. It was beautifully warm which was a real comfort on cold cold December days. The shower room was minute and there was no room to swing that proverbial cat around the room. But then to be fair that's pretty typical of Parisian hotels of this class. It was totally clean and the bed was very comfortable. I suppose if the pound hadn't suddenly become such dreadful value against the euro I might be marking this more generously - and maybe that's not quite just. The staff were polite but no more. I was fed up as foolishly I realised late that I'd left my make up in my room but neither reception nor the housekeeper were remotely helpful: "The maid will have thought you just wanted to throw it out." Full tubs of face cream? A hair brush? Yes - my foolishness but enough to change my rating from average to "ok but some problems".

Reviews.Title: “Apples at the reception and in the room!”
Reviews.Author: LadydiVienna
Reviews.Content: Very nice cosy little hotel. Very clean and friendly. construction work was still going on while we stayed there, but was no problem for us. Had an iMac in the room - which included TV and Internet. for the price of the stay it was an excellent bargain. Rooms are newly renovated, very clean and nicely designed. And the location is very good - direct connections to both airports. Only a few steps to the Metro. You will enjoy a great stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but ...”
Reviews.Author: CYKL
Reviews.Content: We had a superior double room on the 4th floor. The room is very small. And we had the 2nd biggest room on the floor, according to the evacuation map I saw pasted on the door of the room. While I understand that most rooms in Paris are small, I have stayed in bigger rooms in previous trips at a similar price. I just tend to try a new hotel each time, if you are wondering why I did not just go back to the other hotels I have stayed at. When our suitcase was opened, there was no walking space. But to be fair, the 5 shelves in the storage area in the room, provided enough space for putting our clothes and stuff. There is no wardrobe, only a column of shelves with a curtain over it. I call this the storage area. The bed is very small. The other reviewer said the bed was 1.60m wide. Ours should have been narrower because I "measured" the bed with my height. When I lie across the bed, my legs stick out. The bed was very soft. If you like soft beds, then good for you. The bathroom is also very small. But it has a very nice rainshower. The iMac in the room provided an opportunity to surf the internet, watch TV, listen to music, etc. There was also an iMac in the lobby. I could always hear the coming and going of the guests in the room next to ours, but once they were in their room, I could not hear them. There is a small elevator in the hotel.
