It did not work on one of the days when we were there. The breakfast consisted of 1 butter croissant, 1 chocolate croissant, and half a baguette each, which were brought to us in a basket when we were seated. You are not entitled to more. However, there was free flow of coffee or tea, juice, cereal, sliced bread, and yoghurt. While it was written on our confirmation email that the nearest stations are St Michel and Cluny-LaSorbonne, the nearest station is actually the Luxembourg RER Line B station, which is on the same line as the CDG airport, very convenient. The journey took 40 mins. And while it was written on our confirmation email that the check-in time was from 1pm, I was told when we arrived at 2:20pm, that the check-in time was actually 2pm. And even at 2:20pm, our room was not ready because "there were too many people leaving that morning, your room would be ready in another 30mins". All the staff we have met, had been very friendly. And the whole hotel - lobby, breakfast room, bedroom, bathroom - is truely very beautifully decorated, exactly like you see on its website. If you value decoration over room comfort, this hotel is for you. Otherwise, after all that walking in Paris, I would really appreciate a comfortable good night's sleep. To summarise the positives: - nice rainshower - free internet access - one elevator - convenient location - friendly staff And the negatives from my point of view: - claustrophobic room - narrow bed - very soft bed - small bathroom - thin doors - limited breakfast - room not ready way past check-in time

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully designed hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Philip99
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a lovely weekend break in Paris which was made all the more pleasurable by the pretty hotel de la Sorbonne. The rooms and lobby have been cleverly re-designed in the hotel's recent makeover and the finish is very good quality. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms themselves, while not large, were certainly adequate size for a weekend break and were clean and well-kept. The Imac in the room was SO much more appreciated than the usual TV entertainment system! I'd definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Paris - the location is great too, and yet extremely quiet given just how central it is.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: EbonyChickens
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a superior double room. It looked exactly as it did in the photo. The room wasn't large but the whole hotel was furnished like a higher rated boutique hotel. The staff were helpful and the neighbourhood is great, you are within walking distance of a lot of different areas We will stay there again if we can get the same discount.

Reviews.Title: “99% perfect but needs some tea-making stuff in the room!”
Reviews.Author: Observanttraveller_8
Reviews.Content: this is a perfect little hotel in central Paris, really excellent in all ways. clean, recently renovated, good breakfast, very pleased. I only wish that it had a little kettle and some tea/coffee in the room for early morning cuppa!

Reviews.Title: “quiet location, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: FeliceInViaggio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great combiniation for us: quiet central location, very clean, hospitable staff, comfortable beds, free use of large umbrellas. Having a large-screen MAC in the room is a real plus. We did not opt for breakfast at the hotel, so we cannot provide comments on this, however the breakfast room seemed perfectly inviting. We will certainly book this hotel next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: masoliveira
Reviews.Content: Great location,hepful staff. Clean rooms, although small. It lacks a shower too. Anyway,a great choice,because of its great location(walking distance of many attractions,close to the metro). Looking forward to the next time!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely return to the Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: mongobongo
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to return to a very beautifully redecorated Sorbonne; and to the warm welcome by the friendly staff again. Everyone was helpful, and willing to go the extra mile to make us comfortable & content. Looking forward to another trip in the future. Louise Lee

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jujuki
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel de la Sorbonne for 4 nights at the beginning of November 2008. The whole hotel is nicely decorated and really chic. I was really impressed by the attention to detail, the pictures on the walls, etc... it definitely looks more than only 2 stars hotel. Every room is equipped with a computer having full access to Internet, and on which you can watch TV or play DVDs. You can watch French and International channels on it. The bed was very comfortable, and I found the bedroom to be of decent size for Paris. Even if I had a single room, the bed was double and there was space to move around and put the luggage. The only down side was the bathroom, which was extremely small. Most people would say that I am quite tiny but I could just fit in this bathroom: I bruised my arm twice taking a shower and I could not get dressed in this bathroom unless the door was opened. The sink was one of the smallest I have ever seen. The room and the bathroom were clean, as well as the hotel in general. The breakfast was typically French, don't expect a full English! But it was really decent. The location of the hotel is very good, in the heart of the Quartier Latin, 5mins walk from Notre Dame and even less from the Pantheon. The RER station Luxembourg is about 5mins walk, and goes direcly to the airport Roissy-CDG in 40mins more or less, no need to change train or metro. The area is full of students as there is the Sorbonne University in the same street as the hotel, so there is plenty of restaurants and bars, and there are lots of people in the streets until late at night, so I felt quite safe. Even if this area is quite lively, the hotel by itself was very quiet. The staff was nice, polite and helpful: they would give directions or advise on restaurants. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: anjwaggs
Reviews.Content: I have been dreaming about my trip to Paris since I was a little girl. Finding a hotel there can be a daunting task. Rooms are generally super expensive if you want anything nice and in an even remotely good location. Thankfully, we found the Hotel de la Sorbonne. The main reason we booked was that it was in the perfect location for us (right next to the Pantheon, Luxembourg Gardens, cafes & shops, and not too far from Notre Dame). The second reason was the beautiful rooms that we found on the website. Upon arriving, we were notified that we had actually chosen one of the five rooms that hadn't been updated yet to the new style. We were very disappointed, and expressed our concern to the staff. The room that we did have was very clean and not bad in any way, it just wasn't what we expected. After a couple of nights, one of the new rooms was available though and they upgraded us for no additional charge for the rest of our stay. The location is fabulous, the rooms are clean and super chic, and the staff was more than helpful and spoke excellent English. We would recommend this hotel to anyone in a heartbeat! They made our stay in Paris phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lancsmountainchic
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel at the end of October 2008. Great hotel, great location, very helpful staff. Good breakfast in the morning - continental. Rooms very comfortable, iMac a great addition. Very clean, would definitely stay again. It would have been nice to have a kettle in the room, but maybe this is just a (tea-obsessed) british thing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, almost perfect..........”
Reviews.Author: MrsHartley2410
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the hotel de la sorbonne for our honeymoon. It was in a perfect location, easy walking distance to most of the main sights, we were directly opposite the sorbonne university. The hotel has been lovingly decorated, and our room was lovely. the bed was so comfy. Our only little complaint is the rooms are quite small, but everything was organised well, cupboards in the walls etc. Also when the rooms above us flushed the toilet, the pipes must have run between the walls as it sounded like the water was coming down the actual wall. If you're staying in high season beware, the room does not have a fridge, so no cold water........the staff seemed pleasant enough, but we did not really need their services as we have spent a long time in Paris in the past. All in all tho i would recommend the hotel de la sorbonne, to anyone that wants a comfortable, funky, hotel close to all the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: HanoverHanover
Reviews.Content: My parents and I booked two rooms for the middle of August at Hotel de la Sorbonne which I chose because of its location. I visited the hotel a month before and the rooms seemed OK - nothing much to write home about but maybe I was shown one of the un-refurbished rooms. 10 days prior to our arrival, my mother who is a recovering transplant and cancer patient, was advised to postpone her trip by a few days while she was being treated for a throat infection. Given her medical history, she was advised to wait to get clearance by the surgeon who operated on her during transplant as she has to take various drugs so that her body wouldn't reject the organ and he wanted to make sure that the antibiotics she was taking for the infection would not interfere with what she was already prescribed. I spoke to Arnaud at Reception and explained the situation and asked to speak to Mr Germain, the manager of the hotel who refused to speak with me. Due to the sad circumstances that were forcing us to change our travel plans, I asked if we could postpone our bookings by a week which I was refused and I was forced to pay the full amount for 2 double rooms for 3 nights in a hotel that I never ever got to stay in. When we visited Paris a week later, I dropped in at the hotel as the hotel that we stayed in called Lindberg called Arnaud and got confirmation that the manager Mr Germain was in. Of course, Mr Germain refused to come out of his office to meet with me. What I witnessed next filled me with horror even further. A hotel guest who must have been over 6 or 7 months pregnant in need of rest asked to have access to the room as her husband had gone out and taken their key with him. Arnaud told her that she would have to wait in reception till her husband who was expected 2 hours later to come back even though Mr Germain and House-keeping had spare keys. This hotel might have fancy iMacs but what guests really look for when traveling in a strange place is people with understanding and compassion which was grossly missing in this establishment. Both the manager Mr Germain and his receptionist Arnaud could have made an exception in my mother's case and in the case of the pregnant lady based on the unfortunate circumstances and they chose not to which only goes to show that they shouldn't be in the hospitality business if customer service is not their top priority.

Reviews.Title: “chic, but very small”
Reviews.Author: leuqar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully decorated, clean, and perfectly located. The only problem is that rooms are too small, even "superior rooms" ; make sure you don't get 27/37/47/57, all the #7 rooms are just tiny. The Mac computer and huge screen are great (at least in room 34). Be careful with the French keyboard, though. It'll drive you crazy...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sorbonne - good accommodations - super quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyjenga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Sorbonne over the weekend and enjoyed our stay very much. These were the most restful nights we have ever had in Paris. The hotel is on a very quiet street yet right in the thick of things. The Sorbonne is just a few steps away, as is the Boulevard St. Michel and Luxembourg gardens. The rooms are small but the bathrooms are excellent with strong showers. The hotel is very clean. There is a combination Apple computer / dvd player / flat screen TV that is very cool. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The decor in the room was a little too avant garde but there was an interesting collection of photos on the walls. For the money, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK choice”
Reviews.Author: GRTR
Reviews.Content: Good location and very pleasant hotel. Some rooms have been renovated but other not... I was not very lucky. The breakfast service has definately seen better times but the breakfast room is highly inspiring. Overall for the price and location great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but....”
Reviews.Author: Nubbie
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been completely renovated and looks great. The decor is really modern, unique, clean and compact. The people were friendly and helpful and there was always someone on reception. Our room was well decorated but tiny. So small that I had to put my suitcase in the bathroom. Our bathroom was quite large because we were in a room on the ground floor right next to reception and also the manager's office. We did have the option of staying in a room on the third floor however the bathroom was miniature. Unfortunately as we were on the ground floor we had to put up with a lot of noise (people talking, doors closing, footsteps etc). Our room only had a double bed also which we found a little uncomfortable (and we are not big people!). The room included an iMac which was terrific. Overall we enjoyed our stay however we would only return if we could stay in a larger room on an upper level. The breakfast was great offering a good continental selection. If the rooms were a bit largers and there was less noise it would be sensational.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Frizz1
Reviews.Content: Paris is a wonderful city and this hotel was in a great location to walk to or easily access most sights. The hotel was modern, clean, with excellent internet access and helpful staff. However, like most Paris hotels it was extremely small and quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de la Sorbonne - a lovely place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: felix47
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Sorbonne is a perfect place to stay i Paris. The room was nice, good design, clean and the reception was very nice and helpful. We would love to come back to this lovely hotel. Thanks a lot

Reviews.Title: “Great location- average room”
Reviews.Author: whackerD
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the basic rooms- it's a fair bit cheaper. All the rooms you see on their website are of the newer rooms, which cost considerably more. Location: excellent. Close to sights, cafes, metro, nightlife. Sobronne square is 20 feet from the hotel. the square is nothing stunning but there's a few cafes there so it's a great spot for breakfast, lunch or a drink. I'd recommend this rather than having breakfast in the hotel. The Latin Quarter (pubs, restaurants, clubs- a bit tacky) is a few minutes walk. The Lourve- 10 minutes, Notre Damme less than 10 minutes. Metro about 3 minutes. The hotel: very nice decor, art photos on each floor, free internet in newer rooms (we had none) and lobby, nice staff. The room: very small but clean. In Paris most rooms are small I've heard. We had a double bed, which was comfortable. Bathroom was very small but functional- the bath was 3/4 size and there was no shower. Overall I'd say I was happ with the hotel and room- nothing amazing but price was okay and room was clean and in great location. I wouldn't bother paying extra for a nicer room- after all you spend very little time in Paris in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: wjan
Reviews.Content: small, but clean rooms, great location!

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ln20
Reviews.Content: What a lovely easy hotel to stay in with a really friendy team of people working there. The DVD in the room is a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: BrissieKJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night only. This hotel is in a great position, very handy to the Louxembourg Gardens and the Panthenon. The room was small, but decorated nicely. The bathroom was tiny, but modern. The hotel was very clean. Reception was efficient and friendly and there was no problem with storing our bags before check-in. The rooms tended to be a bit noisy at night with sounds from other rooms (we could hear the man next door snoring), but there was no street noise. I would stay here again, although not for an extended period.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Tripper085
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very quiet location in a backstreet across from the Sorbonne University. It takes about 5 minutes to walk to the nearest metro station. The desk staff were very helpful and spoke very good English when our very average French language skills faltered. We stayed for 6 nights. The superior room was nicely decorated & overlooked an internal paved courtyard. The room had its own iMac ion which we could access the internet, play DVDs & CDs & watch TV, all for no additional charge. The only minuses were: * the small combined bathroom & toilet; there wasn't any space to maneuver in it - strictly elbows in & one person in there at a time. There was a shower but no bath. * thin walls - we could very clearly hear conversations from the guests in the room next to ours. The minuses were minor. We recommend the hotel as a nice boutique hotel in a quiet neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sorbonne and Christie”
Reviews.Author: SpeedyRice
Reviews.Content: Great place and very friendly staff. I will definately come back

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ceri-anne
Reviews.Content: The Latin Quarter is my favourite place to stay in Paris. I've stayed at several hotels in the area but this year most hotel rates seemed to have shot up. For a one night stay I balked at paying â‚¬170+. Having stayed at a sister hotel before I decided to give the Sorbonne a go. The internet rate was very reasonable and also included breakfast (a bonus!). The superior rooms were spotless, nicely decorated and the shower room was bang up to date. Yes the rooms are a tad on the small side but they've made good use of the space and I doubt most 2 star hotels would offer free internet access from a lovely iMac. The staff were helpful and I thoroughly recommend this hotel as excellent value for money and for its location. I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room, basic price”
Reviews.Author: Stradwick
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the unrenovated 'Classic' rooms which seemed to be occasionally available in August on the hotel's website from 74 Euros a night. Based on what similar hotels nearby were charging, this was a reasonable rate for a typical Parisian-sized basic hotel room, so I got what I was looking for at a price that I was prepared to pay. If you are looking for a 'sleeping room' in a good location at a modest price, then this could be the place for you. However, for a bit more (depending on the season) you could investigate staying at one of the more attractive sister hotels on the Place Pantheon, either the Grands Hommes or the Hotel du Pantheon which could provide you with a more memorable stay if you can afford the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: knkuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been beautifully renovated. Our superior room had fab wallpaper, a small wardrobe with hanging space, a full lengh mirror, clean carpet and the brand new bathroom was spotless. Great extra to have an iMac in our room with free internet access. The location is brilliant - about 10 minute walk to the Seine and Notre Dame and on the way are little streets full of restaurants, bistros and bars. We felt the closest Metro Station was Cluny de la Sorbonne but Luxembourg was also close. I would definitely reccommend this hotel to ANYONE going to Paris, loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Parismoncherie
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel is located in a great area, close to metro stops, and next to jardins du luxembourg; the finest park in Paris. The hotel's looks are great. It's modern, cool graphics/colors, designer wallpapers, it's just better then you will expect. There was something else that was bette then expected: the service. Our rooms were cleaned soooo good, and the front desk personnel is extremely helpfull. Breakfast 11 euro is value for money. It's tasty, it's good, it's divers, and it's a lovely room to eat in. After all, great room, great hotel, great people. It's a little treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de la Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: foxLeicester
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a great central location. It's a short walk from the centre/main sights in Paris, just around the corner is the Place de Sorbonne with a couple of nice bars and restaurants. You are also close to nearby metro stations. The rooms in the hotel are quite small but are decorated nicely, they're clean and the inclusion of an AppleMac with internet access is a nice touch. Overall I felt the hotel was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget and transportation-centric hotel”
Reviews.Author: nc2stores
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint 5 floor walk-up building (small elevator) across from the Sorbonne. You feel like you are staying in a local neighborhood when you walk to it from the RER/subway. The top floor is the last one to be renovated (which we stayed on) and it was fine except for no air conditioning during 2 warmer summer days when we were there in late July 2008 (staff said this is coming in 2009). This floor will be redone before the 2009 summer holiday period. These rooms were less expensive since they have the older, less fancy decor. The lower floors are already redone with an art deco design which looks very nice. The breakfast room is nice with a full continental breakfast for a modest price with a free internet Apple workstation in the lobby area which helped people checking email and making calls abroad. My apple notebook connected to the wireless hookup easily in the lobby/breakfast area but I couldn't get the signal on the 5th floor. I noticed that their pictures on a travel website were older pics than what we actually saw when we got there. If you are used to larger rooms, you will be tight here. The bathrooms are very small but very well maintained but there is no bureau or storage area other than one closet in most of the rooms. Also, there is no locking safe in the rooms for valuables so bring a lockable suitcase if you need security for your belongings. A couple of small night tables and a small writing desk & chair were the only other furniture. No pool or exercise room at the moment. The multi-lingual staff was very nice to help us with navigating Paris and the hotel was only 1.5 blocks from the Luxembourg RER & subway stop making it easy to get to both CDG & Orly airports by train and then walking to the hotel. It's about a 4-5 block hike down to the riverfront and Notre Dame where the main St. Michel metro stop is and about the same to the Odeon metro station. If you want to investigate St. Germain, you're only a couple of blocks walking distance to a trendy spot with lots of nightlife too. For "american food die-hards", McDonalds and Starbucks were both within 2 blocks of the hotel. This is a good hotel for the budget, travel saavy person that is mobile using buses and the metro. I highly recommend getting unlimited Paris Visite passes and hoping both to get around - the french rail and bus systems are excellent ways to get around to save your travel weary feet. Lastly, for those people that want to go out to a reasonably priced cafe or pastry shop or shop local merchants, the St. Germain and Latin Quarter were also very lively at night which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “classic and modern”
Reviews.Author: Cois
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay. The neighbourhood is pleasant, place de la sorbonne a great spot for sidewalk cafes, transportation is good (bus 38 from Gare du Nord, soms Velib stations on walking distance), friendly staff, good chamber, good breakfast and the IMAc in the room was a great Plus!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, simple and stylish little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Errantisbest
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and when I asked for recommendations for a restaurant and jazz club, they gave me printed maps and pointed me in the direction of a great place or two. The (new) rooms are nice but small. (isn't really anywhere to lay stuff out). The decor is rich colors and the beds are good. The Imacs in your room are a nice touch and have internet and music etc. Bathrooms are modern, well appointed but again small. Locations is good - looking onto the Sorbonne and walking distance of most things. Right next to the Luxemborg Gardens - a great place to take a coffee and croissant for breakfast. Stumbling distance from some good bars. One drawback is there is no air conditioning. Rooms facing the courtyard are on full display with the windows open to windows opposite so (unless you like an audience) I'd get one facing the street, which though not busy did have some works outside when I visited - but c'est la vie!

Reviews.Title: “A top spot on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: mystery mole
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Sorbonne in July, having stayed there before five years ago. We chose it for its convenient location and its good value compared with most of the surrounding hotels. It looks out onto the lovely and newly cleaned buildings of the Sorbonne, though not all rooms get that view. It had smartened itself up considerably since our last visit, and the bedroom and shower room fittings were very clean and seemed quite new. The bed was certainly very comfortable and the shower was excellent. A welcome addition was the very neat Apple Mac installed in every room providing TV, radio, CD, DVD and internet access as well as a hotel web area containing all the most useful pages, e.g. restaurant guide, what's on, transport information, etc. Breakfast was very adequate, and the reception staff were very courteous, helpful and friendly. The hotel's main drawbacks were the smallish size of the room and the lack of air con (though this matters less from September to April), but this is why it is relatively cheap. You pay for what you get, and La Sorbonne is still very good value for money in this popular part of Paris. There are also plenty of good restaurants within a couple of minutes: Cosi in Rue Cujas for wonderful Corsican food, Tugalik in Rue Toullier for healthy and tasty nouvelle cuisine, Le Petit Prince de Paris in Rue Lanneau for a really great traditional French dinner (be sure to book), or just try any of the row of excellent brasseries round the corner in the Place de la Sorbonne for a simple but delicious meal. All in all this is a top spot.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de la Sorbonne was part of our wonderful experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: fishygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at Hotel de la Sorbonne and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone!! The rooms were beautiful and comfortable and having free internet was a bonus and very useful for checking sights (i.e., museum opening and closing times, etc.). Location was fantastic - we walked to most places and only took the metro a few times and we felt safe staying here. Staff were great as well. If your concerned about noise ask for a room facing the courtyard - a street room can be a little noisy. The breakfast was very good but we thought it was a bit too costly for what we needed so we only had breakfast once. Take advantage of the special rates on their website - all in all a great place!

Reviews.Title: “great wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: beanmuncha
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel, ideal place next to the Universirty, 5mins from Notre dam. I really had a nice time, my only problem was staircase was very narrow but it's part of the character.

Reviews.Title: “Gem for connaisseurs”
Reviews.Author: lingiulla
Reviews.Content: I have been at the hotel la sorbonne for the weekend of the 14th of july 2008. On arrival check in was fast and very nice. The room was not small, at least for Paris. I was facing the street and absolutely no noise even at night with window open. The decor is a bit eclectic but nice, and the bathroom, small, was ok. Breakfast in the morning very nice and good; nothing huge but much more than i expected. So, what makes this hotel so different ??? The location is fantastic, near the luxembourg and saint michel, in one of the best arrondissements, in my opinion. From the outside you don't see the hotel sign and this adds to the charm !! feels more like your home away from home. The reception girl ( sorry that i dont remember names ) and the night concierge were very nice and helpfull, with always a nice smile. If you like charming hotels this is one of the best i ever stayed in paris. Would go back any time !!

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: o0110101010101010
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money. we paid about 180 Euro per night. The STAFF was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Not fluent in english, but certainly enough to get the job done. The ROOM was very small, but that's to be excepted from what I understand. We had a nice apple computer in our room which came in handy. There was some noise from the plumbing in the bathroom problem that was a little annoying, which the staff was actively investigating. The bed was comfortable. Oh, and the bathroom was uncomfortably small - typical for europe? - the sink was soooo small... Check out was at 12, which was awesome! The location couldn't be better. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Many Good Thingss”
Reviews.Author: Zville5
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very near the end of a major renovation of most of its rooms, and deserves to rise quickly in the Paris rankings. A two-star hotel under the French system, this hotel is a good value, especially at lower advance-booking rates. Some of the negative observations must be put in Paris context. Rooms are small, sure, as they are in just about every 2- or 3-star. No air conditioning, but that's also the norm in this bracket and only an issue during heat waves. Noise? Certainly not in the courtyard rooms, which were as close to dead quiet as one could imagine in a big city. Very cool decor in renovated ("superior") rooms, complete with iMac computers. So-called "classic" rooms are perfectly acceptable but minus the iMac and chic look. Personnel were friendly and helpful. Location simply excellent, with the beautiful Place de la Sorbonne around the corner, RER line to the airports just a 3-minute walk, and ditto the Pantheon and the gorgeous Luxembourg Gardens. Notre Dame maybe 12 minutes. Cafes and movie theaters all around.

Reviews.Title: “Qaint Hotel in the heart of Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: A_M_Calgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 2007 and loved this hotel. It was in a good location, close to the Boulevard St. Germain with lots of cafes, restaurants, and shops. Metro stations were also within walking distance along with the Pantheon. There were a wide array of internet cafes available in this area as well. The hotel was quaint and clean, right next to the University de la Sorbonne. The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean, we had our own bathroom/shower with a blowdryer as well. I felt safe and comfortable. Breakfast at the hotel was expensive, so recommend that you eat elsewhere. Overall, a good place to stay and a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel even though it is still under construction”
Reviews.Author: TheCanuckChick
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel de la Sorbonne for two nights in May. It was our first time in Paris and we already can't wait to go back! I recently became a travel agent and during training was informed that even though many tourists book hotels near the Champs Elysees or Opera, the 5th and 6th districts (Latin Quartier/St Germain de Pres) offer visitors the most authentic "Parisian" experience. I have to agree. While the Champs is pretty, the Left Bank is remarkable. And Hotel de la Sorbonne made our stay even more perfect. I booked Hotel de la Sorbonne because I had read about their newly renovated boutique-style rooms that featured iMac computers complete with internet access. I enjoy accommodations with character and Hotel de la Sorbonne fit the bill. I will confess that we were surprised to see that renos were still underway when we arrived. We booked 4 months prior to our trip and checked the website frequently and were under the impression renos had been completed. As of mid-May, they were in full swing, with scaffolding set up and contractors scraping away the facade loudly at the early hour of 8am. THE PROS: *The renovated Superior Room we booked was freshly decorated, clean and modern. The decor is charming. Check out my pictures! *The staff! They were incredibly helpful. My French speaking skills were "tres weak" but they responded with a smile and sense of humour. They all spoke excellent English but I tried to speak French as much as possible in an effort to learn. They seemed to respect my feeble attempts! Try to speak French whenever you can in France. Even if you fumble, French citizens appreciate your efforts. I found all Parisians to be very friendly and hospitable, incidentally. *North Americans must remember that accommodations in Europe tend to be smaller than in Canada, the US, Mexico and Caribbean. I found our room to be quite spacious for Europe! *The location can not be beat! It is close to everything you need: 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, Louvre, a block from the Luxembourg Gardens, St Michel, the RER to the airport/train station, shops, restos, etc. Unbeatable! THE CON: *Only one... The hotel's renos were noisy and our windows were blocked with scaffolding. We didn't mind because we planned on waking up to conquer the day each morning, but those wanting a sleep-in during construction would have a hard time. We would definitely return to this hotel and in fact, we're plan to go back next spring to see what the final renos will look like! However, as a travel agent I must say that I might hesitate to recommend this hotel until renovations are complete. Use your discretion... If you are someone who wants good service, a beautiful renovated room in the heart of Paris, then stay here. If you want quiet mornings and a picture-perfect hotel entrance, then maybe wait a couple of months to stay here. TIPS: *Get a map from the front desk that pinpoints the hotel's specific location when you arrive. We got confused one night and got a little lost on the side streets trying to find our way back. Maybe it was the wine? :) *Ask the front desk to explain how the in-room internet works if you intend to check your Hotmail/gmail/etc. French keyboards are different than North American! The bottom line is that we couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: hooperpig
Reviews.Content: Although a little pricey, this hotel worked out well. My husband and I stayed there recently and enjoyed our stay. Three blocks from an RER station( that connected to most metro stations), and very close to the Latin Quarter. This location is especially good if you're a younger couple like us. We found ourselves drinking wine to the wee hours! The bottom floor was under construction when we were there, but from our room on the 5th floor, it was not heard at all. But I imagine if your room was on the 2nd the noise could be a problem. All in all, a very neat and clean place to stay. Ensuite bathroom was nice, but small, like most in Paris. Well decorated rooms also. I would recommend this hotel to my closest friend.

Reviews.Title: “Wait until renovations are complete!”
Reviews.Author: Weekend-holidaymaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights Sat/Sun (24th/25th May) at a cost of â‚¬160 per night for a Superior room. My heart sank when I turned the corner from Place de la Sorbonne and saw that the whole faÃ§ade of the hotel was under scaffold. When we arrived at midday on Saturday, there were still workmen in the reception area and bags of cement etc just outside the hotel. None of this was notified to us when we booked our room on-line. The only reference I found when I checked their website afterwards was deep in the section titled â€œGreat new roomsâ€�, where it states â€œPlus, a freshly cleaned faÃ§ade (coming soon)â€�. Luckily, work was suspended over the rest of the weekend, but we were woken by very loud noise (an angle grinder for cutting stone) outside our window at 9am on Monday morning. So much for a lie-in before leaving for our flight! Over the next 2 hours, we saw workmen passing by on the scaffold outside our window. We were also under the impression that there was air conditioning â€“ one would assume this would be more important than having internet access in the room?! Alas, we were told that â€œitâ€™s coming in September!â€� Because of the scaffold, we did not feel comfortable or secure leaving the window open while we were out. As a result, the room was stiflingly hot when we returned. Our room was decorated with black & silver fabric on the walls and black drapes. The room size was small, but typical of many in Paris. From our experience, the internet access was restricted to google and news â€“ or maybe you have to be familiar with an iMac to get broader access? However, it was extremely slow. The bathroom was quite spacious, of a cool design and with a good shower, but a very tiny toilet. A very poor quality and minimal range of toiletries were provided. The hotel really lets itself down by only providing plastic glasses! The hotel lift (elevator) is so tiny that it should only be shared with someone with whom you are prepared to be intimate! Unfortunately, the Breakfast room was still a construction site during our visit â€“ but again, it looks like it will turn out â€œcoolâ€�. The 2 staff members we met were friendly, but not accepting of any responsibility about the construction site atmosphere. We twice asked for 2 extra pillows â€“ only one per person was provided â€“ but were told that they had none left!! We stayed on the 4th floor. However, after a quick look at rooms on the 5th, it appears that not all rooms have been renovated â€“ perhaps only the Superior rooms? As for the area around the hotel, we found it a little noisy â€“ motorbikes park just around the corner and that noise carried. The area is quite touristy, but pleasant. We stayed for one night before staying at this hotel, at Hotel Jardin de lâ€™Odeon, which is a sister hotel of the Sorbonne and a ten minute walk away. We found that area less touristy and offered much greater variety of places to eat and drink. [see separate review]

Reviews.Title: “Nice but make sure you get a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: Queenvix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sorbonne in mid May and the renovations were still ongoing. They did not have a breakfast room and there was lot of painting going on. After reading the reviews on here I checked we had been given a renovated room with the hotel and and they moved us into one so I would recommend checking before you book as it seems thier classic rooms are still not done up. The room was modern and really well decorated and the bathroom was lovely too they were both small- the bathroom especially so. The hotel was a nice little hotel that they have trendied up rather than being a proper boutique hotel so the rooms are small and the bed was really hard .On the plus side the room has a Applemac which had an internet conection and doubles as a tv with BBCworld so that was great. The location is also great and close to the station 'Luxembourg' from where you can catch a direct train to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but under renovation”
Reviews.Author: 718eee
Reviews.Content: if the hotel was not under such extensive renovation at the time of our stay, i would rate it as 'excellent'. we wish the website would have provided more honesty and details about the current state of renovation; during our stay the entire lobby, breakfast room, and facade were being renovated. the noise was not terribly disturbing, but some compensation in the pricing would have been appreciated (especially for lack of breakfast facilities). overall, the staff were friendly and helpful, and our room was very clean and chic. we loved having the imac in the room for access to google maps and other paris info. the location is ideal, and very quiet both night and day. other reviewers were shocked at the small size of the room, but for a parisian room with bathroom it is perfectly typical and not too small. living in nyc, we are used to small living quarters, but other travelers might find the bathroom way too cramped. i would definitely stay here again, but only after the renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: BillandBobAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel in Paris, near an RER line to CDG airport, and this hotel was perfect. The rate was 81 euros for the night. Upon arrival the clerk told us first in French and then in English that our room was not ready but for 25 euros we could upgrade to a ready room. She looked further and found another room in our original price that was indeed ready. The room was compact and in the bathroom anyone with long legs would have to sit side-saddle on the toilet because of its corner location. The room was on an interior courtyard so it was quiet enough to leave the window open. The elevator was tiny but 2 adults with luggage stacked were able to fit, just barely. All front desk staff spoke French and English and we plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ramblingcowgirl
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned from a four day stopover in Paris and loved this hotel. It is well located, close to the Luxembourg and Odeon metro stops, and is (as the name implies) directly across from the Sorbonne. My room was generous in size, nicely decorated and quiet. As a single female, I also felt safe in this hotel and the manager and his staff were very friendly and full of excellent recommendations. The hotel is in the process of being remodeled and the new rooms are gorgeously decorated, have lovely baths, and are equipped with a new IMac computer that can be used not only for email and general web applications, but to also watch tv and movies. Each floor has a theme (ex. the louvre) and the hallways and carpets reflect that theme in a very understated, classy way. A continental breakfast is available for 8 euro. For wonderful French cuisine at moderate prices, be sure to dine at Le Cosi, about a 3 minute walk from the hotel. I am looking forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in the heart of the real Paris”
Reviews.Author: ShepsterScotland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for two reasons, firstly because it looked great on the website and secondly because we love the area in which it is located. It was also our wedding anniversary during our stay which made it extra special. Our room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable. All of the hotel staff were helpful, friendly as well as speaking very good English. They also put up with my feeble attempt at speaking French with a laugh and a smile! Breakfast was delicious and very reasonably priced as was the price of the room. As for the location, the hotel is in a quiet street only 10 minutes walk from the numerous number of local bars and restaurants. We will certainly stay here again the next time we visit Paris and would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “good makeover!”
Reviews.Author: blackcherrypie
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed here twice before and it didn't let me down this time in December 2007. Stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms. Lovely decor and as usual very clean. The addition of an iMac in the room was very useful for using the internet to find out about restaurants etc. Staff as usual very friendly and helpful. The only downside is that the renovations were still going on and it was noisy if you came back during the day. They were quite restrained though - not starting til after 9am and always finished by evening. And of course, this is a temporary issue only. Provided lower price offers continue to be available, I will return again I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not Terrible, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: SchafG
Reviews.Content: We got an extremely good rate at the Hotel de la Sorbonne and stayed there for one night after a trip down to the Cote d'Azur before our flight back to Miami. The room was very small (smaller than our room in Paris before the Cote d'Azur). The room and bathroom were however very clean, so cleanliness is not an issue here. However, the shower situation was bizarre -- a tub with a handheld shower head and no curtain or door. It was not pleasant. Also, the walls were very thin and could hear people coming and going quite clearly. However, the staff was nice and helpful and the location is great. If you are looking to save money and can get a good rate here, the location is very good and may be worth it. I would not spend alot to stay here though.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel on back street in Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: dannyjcarr
Reviews.Content: Great little friendly hotel just on a back street off St.Germain and across from Luxembourg Gardens. We stayed in a top floor room, sent the wife up in the 1 person lift (with the cases) while I took the stairs, we had 2 dormer windows in our room overlooking the Panthenon, room was a decent size and bathroom was ok. To me I thought it was a very quaint, clean hotel and the area felt very safe, we ended up wandering around the streets lost at 1am looking for the hotel and never once felt threatened. Close to all the bistro's, cafes and bars in the sorbonne, excellent area as a base for exploring Paris, very cheap high quality food, alot of set menu's to start you evening off (3 courses for less than 10e), what more can you ask for !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: nac06
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location. Room was small, shower/bathroom was very small but all we needed was a place to sleep and this was exactly that. Front desk staff was very helpful as well. Location was close to lots of food, sights, and subway, it was easy to get to all the things we wanted to see from the hotel. At night had plenty of options within walking distance for dinner and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but good location”
Reviews.Author: SWRetiredTraveler
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES: Great location, quiet, nice staff who speak English quite well. NEGATIVES: Miniscule rooms and baths; expensive. Lobby is tiny. No amenities such as a coffee pot in the room. Towels were small and thin. Shuttle reserved by hotel canceled on us. Stayed here Sept 27-29, 2007. This hotel is ideally located on the Left Bank, and within walking distance of a lot of places, including restaurants. It is quaint--and the size of the bathroom is almost hilarious, like a doll house (couldn't sit straight on the toilet, as it was that close to the wall--had to turn sideways!). Our room was initially on the ground level, facing the courtyard. It had the larger bathroom, and the location was very quiet. The location was also good because you didn't have to haul your suitcase up any stairs. The elevator ("lift") held 1 person and your suitcase. When the reservation was made by my friend, she didn't realize that a double was a 'double' bed, and not 2 beds. So, the second night, we were able to switch to another room with twin beds, but on the third floor, and with the miniscule bathroom. Lighting was so dim, it was impossible to read in your bed. The room was tiny. We arrived just before 2 p.m., and had to leave our bags in the lobby area, as the room was not ready. This hotel is considered "budget," with the cost of a night being $180 (USD). That price is ridiculous, but then, it is Paris, where a cup of tea and a pastry will set you back at least $10. And an Egg McMuffin at McDonald's, with hot chocolate, will cost you more than $10, too. (The hot chocolate was good.) We had asked the hotel to reserve the shuttle to take us to the airport upon checkout. That morning, the clerk called to say the shuttle had canceled (the evening before!!) for technical reasons. This was quite upsetting to hear. After going down to the front desk, I learned there were other shuttle companies, and I had the clerk call to reserve with one of them. Why the clerk didn't do that in the first place, we will never know. One thing to know about this hotel--the street name (Victor Cousin) is also named Rue de la Sorbonne (at one end). I got disoriented coming out of the subway stop that was barely a block away, and walked around for an hour--lost! I speak some French, so was asking many shop owners where this hotel was. Not only had they never heard of it, but they didn't know the street! Had I told them "Rue de la Sorbonne,'" getting back to the hotel would have been much easier and faster. Be sure to get a copy of the map from the desk clerk when you go out, showing the hotel location on it--that would have helped. Location was ideal--many restaurants just a half block away, the post office was a quarter block away, and we walked to Notre Dame, the Louvre, and many other sites. There are 2 subway stations close to this hotel. There were at least 12 people trying to check out around 9:30 a.m. on Sunday morning, and it took us nearly 30 minutes to check out (precious time we hadn't planned on). I would suggest that you make arrangements the night before by checking your bill, and paying then. It will be much easier and faster if you do. If you need to get to the airport, reserve the shuttle (much cheaper than a taxi) for pick-up at least 3 hours before you need to be at the airport. I recommend this for several reasons: First, others in the shuttle may be going to a different place than you are, but which is on the way. Second, the traffic, even on a Sunday, was pretty bad. It took an hour to get to the airport. Third, if the shuttle doesn't show up on time, there is still time to order another one. Note, however, that the shuttles require 24-48 hours notice. We were lucky to be able to get the shuttle, with the help of the desk clerk explaining what had happened with the other one canceling out. Finally, do not try to take the subway to the airport if you have anything more than a small suitcase. The reason: The subways have lots of stairs, and no elevators (or if there is one, it is impossible to find). Paris is not an ADA-friendly town, and people who have difficulty with stairs or are hauling around heavy suitcases, will find the subways impossible to maneuver. (One of the subways we exited required walking up more than 70 steps in a circular pattern!!) A shuttle ride will cost about $30 one way. If I were to stay at this hotel again, I would definitely want the ground level. And I would be staying there strictly for its location to so many things.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed”
Reviews.Author: maraemma
Reviews.Content: A friend who lived in Paris told me about the Sorbonne . He'd not stayed there himself but had heard good things about this hotel opposite The Sorbonne and added that it was a non- smoking hotel. Perfect . I wanted to be in the Latin Quarter and the hotel is also just around the corner from the Luxembourg Metro and the RER- B which takes you straight to CDG airport . I insisted on a room with a bath tub as I love the absolute bliss of relaxing in a hot bubble filled bath after a day of walking around and sightseeing. My room , 61 , was on the top floor in the attic; lift to the 5th flloor and then a few steps up. Thankfully I only had a small case. A charming, light bright and airy room with a Parisian feel to it. Out of one window I could see the Pantheon and out of the other the tip of the Eiffel tower visible by night when it was lit up. Bathroom is also bright and clean with a lovely bathtub and an unsual shower attachment . One slight problem here ; .be warned - when you run the bath , make sure that the shower is not on. I saw the water running into the bath and did not notice water coming out of the shower attachment!!! The result - water all over the towels and my toiletries bag . Both got absolutely drenched and sopping wet.. The bed was nice and big and very comfortable. I slept like a log and woke up refreshed. The reception staff were also friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English which I felt was good , as my French is very rusty. Most of the time it is Franglais . The lady who served us breakfast was also a happy soul who sang a little while she went about her business. I thought that was so sweet. So in all , I was very pleased AND there was also a full moon which added to the magic. Yes , I would like to stay here again.Thank you Hotel Sorbonne . xxxx

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel de la Soronne”
Reviews.Author: Marius59
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel de la Sorbonne with my daugher August 21st-24th 2007 and would thoroughly recommend it for value, location and above all cleanliness. Our room and the hotel itself was spotless and if the management maintain this standard they will deserve to prosper. This was my second visit having stayed for a similar period with my wife about four years ago. The location right in the heart of the Latin Quarter is superb - a short walk down Boulevard St Michele to the Sorbonne Cluny and St Michelle Metro and RER stations and a short ten minute walk to the majestic and incomparable Notre Dame where Mass is celebrated several times a day including at 8 am and 6.15 pm. Breakfast is 8 euro and my only quibble would be there is no fresh fruit. Also, there appear to be just French channels on the bedroom TV but who wants to stay holed up in a bedroom watching TV with the magic and beauty and uniquely exciting ambience of one of the greatest cities of the world outside? The receptionists are friendly, helpful and speak good English and one told me all the rooms are being renovated very shortly. But quite frankly our room, Room 56 which has a power shower is perfectly fine. I was expected to be disturbed by the workmen but wasn't disturbed in the least. All told, excellent value and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Martin Belfast N.Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Nice and confortable”
Reviews.Author: traveller20072008
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived from Paris and I decided that I should share my experience in this website since I read several helpful reviews here. Hotel de la Sorbonne is a really nice and confortable place to stay when you visit Paris. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was confortable and clean and the location was simply perfect - we could walk to all major museums and attractions and we were quite near the metro and RER station. My only complaint has to do with the location of the room - since we were in the ground floor we could hear the comings and goings of the other guests at all hours of the night... on the other hand since my husband smoked and it was a totally smoke free hotel, it was handy to be in the ground floor...

Reviews.Title: “Paris in August 2007”
Reviews.Author: castorMunich
Reviews.Content: This was not our first visit and we like the private atmosphere and the perfect location as well as the reasonable price. Team is very friendly and helpful. What could be improved: elevator is very small if you have any kind of luggage with you and who does travel without luggage!? Same for bathroom. It could not be any smaller. Toilet seat almost not reachable because of lack of space in bathroom... Booth next to reception desk to store luggage is much too small and canÂ´t be locked by hotel team. As we took our bikes with us they could only be parked in courtyard without roof (minor problem). What was NOT acceptable: There is a major rebuilt of rooms on floor 2/3 (= below our room in floor4) and builders/workmen started very early (=noise!) even on saturday and sunday (11. & 12.08.2007).

Reviews.Title: “Cute and very French!”
Reviews.Author: bessiek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sorbonne on recommendation from some friends in April this year. I found the hotel to be very original and unique and decorated very nicely. It was in a perfect location just moments form the Pantheon and closely located to the Metro and Luxemborg Gardens. The room and bathroom was very small but who wants to hand around in your room when you are in Paris?! The room was very clean. The lift was so tiny but it added to the character. The staff were quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: arfm
Reviews.Content: Excellent position, excellent employees and good prices. The rooms are very small. Excellent!!!!! Highly recommended! Near from train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravelbunny
Reviews.Content: We booked a three night stay at this hotel over the last bank holiday weekend in May 2007. We woke up on the second morning both covered in bites. Thinking that it was probably a mosquito, we went to bed the third night. That morning, we woke up with even more bites. This time, we inspected the sheets closely and they had small spots of blood on them - a classic sign of bed bugs. We raised the issue discreetly on check-out - but received no apology, no assurance that the issue would be dealth with, a curt nod was all we got - notwithstanding that we raised the issue after paying, so that it did not appear that we were 'trying it on' to get a reduction. I hope this review will make them do something about the problem. Shame on them!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: emaillittlebird
Reviews.Content: Encouraged by the reviews below and the good (for Paris) rate on the hotel's website, we booked in here for a 3-night stay. The welcome was rather surly, although the reception staff were generally very helpful throughout our stay. Our room (34) was a decent size (again, for Paris) and the bathroom, given the reviews, was ok. Our basin had a massive crack in it and several of the bathroom wall tiles were cracked or filled, plus there was no stand-up shower, just an attachment to the bath taps. The room was, however, serviced daily and we were given new towels and, on one occasion, I was left an extra pillow (they provide one tiny pillow each, so if you like your comfort request an extra from housekeeping). The rooms generally were a little worn-looking, but good enough. If you don't speak French and like to watch TV in your room you will be disappointed as there were only 5 French terrestrial channels available. Our main problem with the room was the proximity to the (tiny) lift which made a very loud noise most of the night. If you have the option, request a room at the back of the building, away from the lift. We did not take breakfast in the hotel, instead opting for the cafes on the small Place just 100m down the hill, which was perfect. The location couldn't be faulted. Located close to several Metro & RER stops, it's easy to get around the city. Notre Dame is walkable in about 10 minutes and the Pantheon and Jardins de Luxembourg are just around the corners. Head off to the roads & squares behind the Pantheon for lovely restaurants and bars (Mouffetard & Monge). Generally, this is a well-located, decent-value hotel, but we couldn't help thinking that they could do better - with a bit more attention to detail and a spruce up, this could be a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great price!”
Reviews.Author: Brevic
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sorbonne, is a boutique hotel in a good location. Easy to get to from the airport and with tons of amenities near by. In the Latin Quarter and located near many great sites, like the Pantheon which is literally around the corner, Notre Dame and Pompidou Center. Tons of good food and shopping near by. The hotel is adorable, and well kept. Clean and cozy, all the front desk associates were friendly and easy to conversate with. The breakfast was typically french with bread, coffee, cereal and juice, very filling and good. The only negative was the lack of leg room in the bathroom. The bathroom was clean and the shower was more then adequate. But no one should have to sit side ways or at an angle period.Elevator is small and can only fit one person with luggage. So multiple trips are necessary for those with families. Staff was very helpful in calling a taxi for us who were flying out early and were on hand at all hours. I would recomend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and cosy”
Reviews.Author: RJB21
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a surprise birthday treat for my partner after seeing the reviews on TripAdvisor. We found it more than adequate for our needs and would definitely come back. For Paris, I feel it is good value (I struggled to find something within our budget with good reviews on TripAdvisor). Our room was clean, comfortable and cosy. Yes, it wasn't massive but to be honest I'd say it was standard size for Europe (I gather from other comments on this site that perhaps visitors from the US are used to larger rooms). Our room over looked the street -- it wasn't particualy noisy so it wasn't a problem but if I were to come back, I might try to ask for a room overlooking the courtyard. The location is amazing -- it's so easy to walk around the centre of Paris from here, plus it is just two minutes from a metro station (itself just three stops from Gare du Nord, where the Eurostar gets in). One warning -- remember that breakfast isn't included in the room price (it's an extra EUR8 per person). Again, this isn't bad value for Paris -- although the breakfast wasn't amazing it's probably similar to that you would get in one of the lcoal cafes -- but if we'd realised we'd probably have eaten out if only to avoid the VERY surly woman serving breakfast. I have no complaints about the rest of the staff but she really was quite rude.

Reviews.Title: “Cute & Central.”
Reviews.Author: sadie06
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights taking full advantage of the excellent online discount from the hotel's own website (friend's that paid similar prices for hotels ended up in some very dodgy places... ). We were not surprised to find a small reception area/lift/bedroom and of course the tiny bathrrom as described by others. However everything was clean, comfortable and easy on the eye. We found the reception staff to be extremely helpful and friendly. The manager must get a special mention as he went above and beyond the all of duty, offering my husband the lend of a tie and jacket for a dinner we had booked without realising the dress code. The location could not have been better. It is lovely to chill out in the Jardin du Luxembourg( a mere 3 minutes walk away) after a long day's sight seeing, or chill out on the little square beside the hotel and watch the students entering and exiting the Sorbonne. Metro and tour buses are all within easy walking distance. At â‚¬8 each the breakfast is not great value but pleasant enough. We adored Paris and when we return we will stay here again...it is cute, central and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “This is your budget hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Rebee-Travels
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel this place is tops. Yes the bathroom is miniscule compared to our grand bathrooms in the USA but this is Europe and not only that this is in a very old city PARIS!!! Location is top notch, near the RER (Luxembourg) and Metro stations (Cluny?), near Jardin de Luxembourg, near Sorbonne University, walking distance to Notre Dame and near a tourist restaurant area (quality of food varies greatly)...Felt completely safe, the staff was wonderful and there even was a small elevator (read: fit one person and one suitcase) which I thought would be nice for those folks who have trouble with stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stu-bone
Reviews.Content: * Very friendly * Good located * Good Online-Offers * Fantastic Breakfast Buffet * Lovely calm rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in a good location”
Reviews.Author: peripatetic24
Reviews.Content: I enjoy staying here because of its safe and central location and because of its online discounts. For Americans it can be difficult to shell out 130 euros a night -- at least -- to haul suitcases four flights up a rickety staircase only to get a lumpy, smoky-smelling mattress and a handheld shower head in a curtainless bath tub. I have definitely stayed in those places. But at Hotel de la Sorbonne you can pay half that much and get an elevator, a real shower and a decent bed! True, the toilets require sidesaddle seating. True, the building groans all night (I have never been able to figure out if it's the plumbing, the elevator or what). But the guests and neighbors who share the same courtyard are quiet, the staff are nice and the price can't be beat. I have never eaten here, but the breakfast room with newspapers looks inviting. I speak with the staff in French so I am not sure how their English is. NB: Don't forget to print your confirmation e-mail after making an online reservation. A surly nighttime staffer did not want to acknowledge my reservation without the printout, despite the fact that I had my confirmation number and had phoned ahead.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful place in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: lucialandes
Reviews.Content: We had spend a nice weekend in Paris. Our room, number 61 it was lovely, we have two windows, from one we see the pantheon and from the other one the top of Eiffek tower. Great!! Also it was very quiet and relaxing also we stay in the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “'Petit' but nice”
Reviews.Author: BanDee
Reviews.Content: Room is small - especially the bathroom, a smaller washbasin would improve free space - but very nice. Furniture is real wood with nice dark brown finish, also wallpaper has a good style. Usual Parisien from-knee-to-ceiling window improves the feeling of space. If you use the hotel just for sleep - as a normal tourist - than it is ideal, since price is reasonable if you consider it is just next to University of Sorbonne, so in downtown. Hotel staff is kind, all the hotel looks family style - very kind overall. (But a bit narrow however :-)) Loved to stay there. Only improvement could be to make available some non-french TV channels on room TV - even for a tourist it makes sense ot see news or whatsoever in TV when get up / going to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: Tw0Teachers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the Sorbonne section of Paris right next to the University of Paris which is a convenient location for shopping and dining. The staff was very helpful and more than accommodating. The problem was the room. It was very small, with a tiny bathroom. We've been on cruises with larger bathrooms. The rug was old and stained, and I guess the major disappointment was the bed. Anyone can put up with a lot if you know you can retire at night in a comfortable bed after a long day of sightseeing. Unfortunately, this was not the case. The mattress had to be fifty years old, worn and lumpy. To make matters worse, the courtyard below and street noises were obnoxiously audible regardless of the time of day or night. We were awakened by yelling on two separate occasions in the wee hours of the morning. For 30 or 40 more euros per night, you can find much more suitable accommodations. We will not return to this hotel or recommend it to any of our friends, and we have informed our travel agent not to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Felt very welcomed”
Reviews.Author: scubaexpert
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly staff, very clean, beautiful decor, great location, fair price Cons: Hard mattress, another pillow for comfort

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Weeangelgirl
Reviews.Content: My friend had stayed at this hotel and told me it was lovely so on his reccomendation I booked it. My room was very nice but the noise coming from the lift and the heating system made it miserable. It was difficult to sleep with the noise. Also, the breakfast room was not big enough and people were always waiting for a chance to get a table and as a result I only got to have breakfast in the hotel for 1 day out of my 4 day stay. I also found one of the girls working at the reception desk to be very rude and unhelpful. I was very disappointed because the hotel was in a lovely location but the noise in particular was the main reason why I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: icassini
Reviews.Content: The room was quite small but cozy and very clean and tidy. The friendly service and a great location all serve to make this a great choice if you are staying in Paris on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in Winter”
Reviews.Author: SydneyinEurope2007
Reviews.Content: Hotel very central to the Old Quarter. Very close to good cafes, underground/train, and other attractions. Clean small room basic with double bed and bathroom/shower. Very friendly staff who were helpful with any requests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in perfect position”
Reviews.Author: Templare
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in extremely central position. Beside Paris University La Sorbonne and at about 600mt from Notre Dame and 2km from the Louvre, in the nice area of the Quartier Latin. The hotel is small and our room was quite small as well (the toilet even too small), but it was ok, considering the price we were paying (65 euros per night - web fare). Hotel staff was very polite and supportive. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: nunobensen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend at the end of January. I thought it was fantastic value for money. The location is superb and the rooms, while small, are clean and comfortable. I thought the service was kind and friendly. The bathrooms are tiny and wouldn't suit larger people. Ask for a room with a shower rather than a bath.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: salcido
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excelent location in France, near Notre Dame church, also you have very close the Subway and the RER, very friendly staff, and the rooms are little but confortable, the price is good. I recommend to any traveler this hotel in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Prof.Baltazar
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Sorbonne is a small hotel located opposite from the Sorbonne University. The best thing about this hotel is definitely its location: right in the center of the Latin Quarter, a short walk (10 mins) to the Ile de la Cite. Another good thing are the prices - check their website for offers, we found a great offer (but this did require booking few months in advance). Rooms are rather basic and yes - they are small, but we didn't mind since we came to Paris to enjoy the city and not to stay in our small room. All the staff at the reception desk was very helpful and greeted us with smile. This can't be said for the lady that serves breakfast though. The breakfast itself was a rip-off (consisting only of croissant, bread and jam along with the coffee, juice and yogurt). All in all, we had a pleasant stay here and enjoyed being located very central in Paris for a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights. The staff was very friendly and gave us information on how to travel in Paris. The rooms are small as compared to US, but then the service was very good. Also, the place is right next to the Sorbonne University and a few minutes walk to the Notre Dame. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly little hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: EminMaine
Reviews.Content: My room, though small, was clean, comfortable, and quiet, with a lovely view onto the courtyard. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the location unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a city break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes the room are small, but not uncomfortably so, and staff were very nice. We stayed for five nights on a first trip to Paris and it was pretty much spot on. Clean, pretty, great location, and very reasonably priced. Definitely a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: lmw_8
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Paris here. Our first two nights were at Hotel Monge, then we traveled in France, came back to Paris for one night. De la Sorbonne cost more than Monge, and Monge was much nicer. We liked the location of the Monge better even though they're in the same general neighborhood; our room there was bigger and more comfortable, and noise conttrol was much better. Maybe it was because we were in a room on the first floor, just behind the reception desk. There was a nice courtyard, but it was hard to appreciate from our room. Two different women at the front desk were pleasant and helpful, but so was Julie at Residence Monge.
